loans.name: Suglo Nbori Buni - Tamalgu Group

texts.en:
Fati is an active woman of 40 years old from Tamalgu in the Northern part of Ghana. Fati is married and has seven children. Fati is a member of shea nut pickers and shea butter processing group who have been in this business for the past three years. (She is the person squatting with both hands placed on the shea nuts in their group picture.) Their group is called ‘Suglo Nbori Buni – Tamalgu’ Women Association. She makes good profits from the business since she and every member of her group were trained by Grameen Ghana and Planet finance on how to process high quality premium shea nuts and butter for Planet Finance (Shea butter marketing company) to buy and export.

Fati and the group have asked for a loan of 6,600 GHS. Fati’s share of the loan will help her to pay for the cost of four bags of shea nuts to extract shea butter.  By so doing, she would increase productivity and hence be able to repay the loan, and support her children’s educational and health needs.

loans.use: Fati’s share of the loan will help her to pay for the cost of four bags of shea nuts to extract shea butter.

loans.name: Teresa Elizabeth

texts.es: Teresa de 28 años de edad está acompañada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad. Los padres de Teresa le entregaron en herencia un pequeño terreno y desde hace 5 años levantaron su hogar con materiales poco duraderos. La fotografía muestra muy bien los materiales que han utilizado, los cuales no prestan ninguna seguridad, además Teresa sabe que con estas condiciones la salud de sus hijos podría estar en riesgo. Por lo anterior Teresa ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, clavos, madera y construir su vivienda. Teresa espera que con la asesoría que FUSAI le brinda, seguir ampliando su vivienda y mejorando las condiciones que permita el bienestar de su familia. Teresa solventará las cuotas de este crédito con la ganancia que le deja la venta de comidas y con el aporte que su compañero de vida le da.
texts.en: Teresa is 28 years old, married, and has two children, ages 10 and 6.  Teresa’s parents left her a small plot of land and she built her house there five years ago, using crude materials.  The image clearly shows the materials used, and they provide no security.  Teresa also knows that these conditions place her children’s health at risk.  She has requested a loan through FUSAI to buy galvanized metal, nails, and lumber so she can expand her home and improve conditions for her family’s wellbeing.  Teresa will repay this loan from the earnings she receives from her sale of food and with the help of her life’s partner.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Simbira Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mapendo est  présidente du groupe Simbira. Agée de 35 ans, elle est mariée à un homme d’affaire  et mère de  4 enfants  scolarisés. Commerçante depuis 2007, elle sollicite un credit pour acheter 85kg de fretin et ainsi renforcer son activité. Elle souhaite rehabiliter sa maison et agrandir son entreprise. Sur ceux, elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en: This client, Mapendo, is the president of the group Simbira. She is 35 years old, married to a business man, and the mother of four children, who are provided with education. She has been a merchant since 2007 and is requesting a loan to purchase 85 kg of small fish to bolster her business. She would like to refurbish her house and expand her enterprise. For these things, she thanks Hekima.

loans.use: to purchase 85 kg of small fish

loans.name: Manne Du Ciel Group

texts.fr: La cliente Shabafuko est une brave commerçante et membre de la banque villageoise «Manne du Ciel», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 49 ans, divorcée et mère de 3 enfants, qui tous étudient.La cliente est   vendeuse de la boisson. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un dépôt relais dans un quartier animé de la ville,  où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de sa famille biologique. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 30 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 50 caisses de boissons sucrées, 100 caisses de bière Primus etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une belle maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
This client, Shabafuko, is a good and honest merchant and a member of the ’banc villageois’ called “Manne du Ciel”. A senior entrepreneur and an energetic woman, she is 49 years old, divorced, and the mother of three children, who are all students. This client is a vendor of beverages. She sets up her merchandise at a distribution center in a business district in town, where she figured out how to earn her customers. 

She started her business with initial capital from her blood relatives. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for 30 years. This new loan will be used to purchase 50 cases of soft drinks and 100 cases of Primus beer, etc. Thus, she would like to build a nice house and provide schooling and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among small-scale entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 50 cases of soft drinks, 100 cases of Primus beer, etc.

loans.name: Maa Astalaxmi Group

texts.en:
Maa Astalaxmi is a Self Help Group formed in March 2014 by 12 active women entrepreneurs from Nilji village in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. Nilji is a rural village situated in the inaccessible and backward region of Nuapada district. 

Bharasarani is one of the members of this group who is sitting second from right with her hand raised in the photo. She is 32 years old and a cheerful lady living with her husband, one daughter and one son. Bharasarani is running a milk-selling business with one milking cow at her house and her husband runs a general store .She gets 10 liters of milk per day, which she supplies to 10 households in her village.  She gets her payment on a monthly basis. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR. She has a dream of giving a better education to her children. So, looking at the demand for milk, with her present loan of 16,000 INR, she is planning to purchase another cow of the hybrid variety. This will help her to increase her income and fulfill her dreams. Bharasarani hopes to save enough money for the construction of a house and the development of a good dairy farm. The other 11 members of the group are running small businesses like vegetable.vending, milk selling, a betel shop, a fancy store etc.

loans.use: To purchase another cow

loans.name: Manne Du Ciel B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Marie Claire est une commerçante et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Manne du Ciel B »,   entrepreneur, âgée de 54 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants, dont 3 scolarisés et 4 autres ont terminé leurs études. La cliente est une vendeuse de maïs. Elle étale sa marchandise à domicile dans une avenue mouvementée de la place. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 42 sacs de maïs. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
This client, Marie Claire, is a merchant and a member of the business collective “Manne du Ciel B”. An entrepreneur, she is 54 years old, a widow, and the mother of seven children, of whom three are in school, and four others are finished with school. This client is a vendor of corn. She has been in this business for ten years. She displays her merchandise at home located on a busy local avenue. She started her business with funds from her husband when he was alive.

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 42 sacks of corn. Thus, she would like to provide schooling, clothing, and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical moment post-conflict in the country’s east. It should be noted that one client is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to purchase 42 sacks of corn

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, who is a 66-year-old mother of two children, lives in a remote area of Trapeang Sangae Village, Chrey Vien Commune, Prey Chhor District, Kompong Cham Province. To support the family, Touch has been involved in farming for almost 40 years with her husband growing rice and selling to the dealers in her village. This job can bring an income of USD 4 a day to her family.

Touch’s house is located not so close to a water source. So, in order to get the water, it takes a long time and more energy consumption for her as she is an old woman. To overcome this obstacle, she would like to request a loan from Kiva in the amount of KHR 1,000,000 to make a well that is located just next to her house. Touch would like to express her gratitude for lenders for this lower interest loan that can make her life more convenient.

loans.use: to make a well

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is a solo mother of three children. She runs a small plantation business and has been doing this for two years. She plans to use this loan to purchase two gallons of chemicals, a mist blower for her plantation business, and cement and iron roofing for home improvements. Makerita joined the SPBD program last year to gain access to financial assistance, which has enabled her to earn some money to take care of her three small children. She has now managed to improve their living conditions with this loan and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, a mist blower, cement, and iron roofing

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en: Kalameli is a 48-year-old married mother of seven children. She operates a small retail shop in her village and has been in operation for more than three years. She needs a loan to restock her shop with some items such as sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, boxes of chicken leg quarters, sacks of flour, boxes of tinned fish, soft drinks, and cigarettes. With the profits she was able to get from her business, not only was she able to reinvest some amount back into her business, but she was also able to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, chicken, flour, tinned fish, soft drinks, and cigarettes

loans.name: Koeurn

texts.en:
By residing in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Koeun, 55 years old, is an experienced farmer who grows rice on her own farmland. Having been in this business for more than 30 years, she can generate an income of USD 7 per day to support her two children. 

Because of the inadequate budget for farming supplies, Koeun has taken a loan of KHR 2,500,000 from HKL to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use on her farmland. Last but not least, she is grateful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than usual for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Roses

texts.en:
Roses is 49 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Roses is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Roses has been farming rice for 10 years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Santos Isaias

texts.es:
Santos, es soltero, tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y dos hermanos, de su padre aprendió a trabajar en el campo y a cuidar del ganado, trabaja de 6:30 a.m. a 2:30 p.m., de esta manara tiene ingresos para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar.
Comprará una vaquilla, para aumentar el ganado que tiene y a futuro incrementar la producción de lácteos, espera progresar con su negocio y seguir manteniendo su fuente de ingresos para salir a delante con su familia.
Si visión es tener una ganadería mejor establecida con lo que podrá independizarse y apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Santos is single, 24 years old, and lives with his parents and two brothers. From his father, he learned how to work in the countryside and raise livestock. He works from 6:30am to 2:30pm. In this way, he has income to contribute to his household's expenses.

He will purchase a heifer to increase the number of livestock that he has and later increase milk production. He hopes to improve his business and continue maintaining his source of income to succeed, along with his family.

His dream is to have a better-established stockbreeding business, so that he can become independent and support his parents.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, toilet paper, rice, sugar, soap, beans, snacks, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to attend her coffee crops

loans.name: Sunui

texts.en: Sunui is a 37-year-old married mother of seven children. She has a plantation, which she wants to use as a means to earn extra income for her family and assist in meeting their financial obligations. She decided to join the SPBD program this year to gain access to financial assistance. With this loan, Sunui hopes to purchase tools and equipment to further improve her plantation such as a mist blower, chemicals, bushknives, shovels, and spades. With the profits she gets from her business, Sunui hopes to lift and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a mist blower, chemicals, bushknives, shovels, and spades.

loans.name: Yagamahoro Group

texts.fr:
Spéciose  fait partie du groupe Yagamahoro et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 45 ans et est mariée à  Paul,  un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 15 à 25 ans.

Elle  fait le commerce des avocats  depuis  14 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité  d’avocats beaucoup à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Spéciose is part of the Yagamahoro group and lives in Gitega. She is 45 years old and is married to Paul, a merchant. Together they have four children from 15 to 25 years old. 

She has been trading avocados for the past 14 years. 

This is her fifth credit loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she is granted, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of avocados for resale, to earn more.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of avocados for resale, to earn more

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer sencilla, humilde y muy preocupada por su familia. 
En vista de que su esposo pasaba por un mal momento financiero se vio a la tarea de buscar un empleo que le permitiera estar cerca de su hija y generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Encontró en la venta de productos para el hogar como porcelana, cristalería, y accesorios una manera efectiva de producir capital sin descuidar la crianza de su hija.
Luz está eternamente agradecida con una vecina pues la impulso para tomar este camino el cual ha sido lucrativo. Luz quiere fortalecer su negocio ofrecer mayor variedad abarcar otros accesorios y es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía para el hogar con la que aspira lograr a montar un negocio creciendo paso a paso como una consolidada empresaria que encontró en la humildad y honestidad los mejores valores para forjar su negocio
texts.en:
Luz is a modest, humble, and family-oriented woman. When her husband experienced a time of financial trouble, she searched for a job that would allow her to be near her daughter and generate income to support the family.

She found that selling household products such as china, glassware, and other accessories was an effective way to make money without neglecting her role in raising her daughter. Luz is eternally grateful to a neighbor who encouraged her to follow this path, which has been profitable.

Luz wants to strengthen her business by offering a greater variety and including new items. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise with which she hopes to firmly establish her business. Step by step, she hopes to become a successful businesswoman who shapes her business through her humility and honesty.

loans.use: to purchase household items to increase her inventory and income, in hopes of moving her business from her home to a shop

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y crianza de ganado, trabaja de 5:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m., los trabajos lo realiza con ayuda de mozos, el oficio lo aprendió de su padre. José es casado, en su casa vive junto a su esposa y un nieto.
Invertirá en todo lo necesario para desarrollar de la mejor manera sus diferentes actividades, comprara fertilizantes, insecticidas, abono, plaguicidas, concentrado, afrecho y pagara mozos, realizara sus cultivos sin problemas y tendrá alimento para su ganado, espera incrementar sus ingresos para resarcir su deuda con un buen record crediticio.
Su anhelo es mejorar su negocio y tener los recursos económicos con los que ofrecerá un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José cultivates basic grains and raises livestock. He works from 5 am until 2 pm, with the help of hired hands. He learned the trade from his father. José is married, and he lives with his wife and a grandson.

He will invest his loan in everything he needs to best accomplish his various tasks: he will purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and bran, and he will pay the hired help. He will grow his grain without problems and have feed for his livestock. He expects to increase his income and pay back his debt with a good credit record.

His desire is to improve his business and have the economic resources to offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and bran and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer to store fruit and to buy assortment for her business

loans.name: Tierra Negra Group

texts.en:
The members of Tierra Negra Group are the heads of the families living in that Mexican village, who have decided to improve their living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their houses. Funding is asked for financing the 53% of the cost of those SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that these farmers pay for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

The person in the thumbnail pasted to the picture is Joaquin. He is actually in the photo, standing fifth from the left, but he wears sunglasses which he can’t remove in the outside due to his vision problems. The SSHS installed in his home will provide this 62-year-old farmer and his wife with an electricity service that allows them have 4 hours of electrical lighting, which will help Joaquin to overcome his visual handicap in his daily tasks.

loans.use: for paying PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Kpanmanga  - Tamalgu Group

texts.en:
Alima is 30 years old and has five children. She is a member of a shea nut processing women's group from Tamalgu in the northern region of Ghana.  Alima is the fifth person as you count among the squatting group members from your right as you face their photo. Their group is called ‘Kpangmanga-Tamalgu’ Women Association.

Alima has been in this business with 22 others for the past three years. The group needs a loan of GHS 6,900. Alima will use her portion of the loan to buy four bags of shea nuts to process premium shea butter for the export market. There are available off-taker organizations and individuals who buy the shea butter she processes.

Alima intends to expand the business venture and thereby increase her income, repay the loan, stay in business and help her children to have a better education and better food to eat.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts to make premium shea butter

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Zoila, ha mantenido la venta de tamales de elote funcionando sin tener escases de la materia prima, esto lo ha logrado con la inversión del crédito anterior, su productividad aumento, las ventas y ganancias las ha utilizado para cubrir gastos de su familia y terminar con buen record crediticio su deuda.
El capital que está solicitando lo utilizara para comprar 12 canastos de elote, bolsas, aceite y  leña, son los implementos necesarios para elaborar la venta y seguir teniendo los ingresos que tanto necesita.
texts.en:
Through the investment of her previous loan, Zoila has maintained her tamale sales without running out of raw ingredients. Her productivity increased, and she has used her earnings to cover her family's expenses and pay back her loan on time.

She will use this current loan to purchase 12 baskets of corn, bags, oil, and firewood. These are the items she needs to make sales and continue receiving the income that she needs so much.

loans.use: to purchase 12 baskets of corn, bags, oil, and firewood

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lamine est soudeur. Il pratique le métier depuis plus de 10 ans l’en ayant appris avec son père. Il a ensuite ouvert un atelier avec l’appui de ce dernier et y travaille de 8h à 19h. Seulement, l’atelier manque de quelques matériels qu’il aimerait acquérir grâce à l’appui de l’IMCEC qui lui octroie un crédit pour pouvoir acheter le matériel. Ce matériel lui permettra de pouvoir exécuter des travaux des clients qu’il ne pouvait prendre à cause de l’absence de matériaux nécessaires. Grâce aux crédits obtenus, il a pu agrandir son atelier, diversifier ses produits et services et aussi épargner un peu d’argent.
Lamine est mariée et père de famille dont il a la charge. Il appuie aussi ses parents devenus âgés.
Son rêve : avoir un grand atelier de soudeur métallique.
texts.en:
Mr. Lamine is a welder. He practiced his profession for more than 10 years having learned it from his father. He then opened a workshop with the support of the latter and works there from 8 am to 7 pm.

Only the workshop lacks some material he would like to acquire thanks to the support of IMCEC, which is granting him a loan to purchase equipment. This equipment will allow him to perform customer work that he could not take on because of the lack of necessary materials.

Thanks to the loans he was granted he was able to expand his workshop, diversify his products and services and also save some money. 

Lamine is married and a father, and takes care of his family. He also supports his parents in their old age. 

His dream is to have a large metal-welding workshop.

loans.use: buy metallic material for his work as a welder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, shoulder pads, elastic bands, buttons, clasps, eyelets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for her coffee cultivations

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese is a solo mother of one child. She sells her crops from her plantation in order to get extra income and her relatives assist her with the plantation business. She has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance, which is available from traditional banks. With the loan, she will purchase a mist blower, chemicals, knife sharpener, bush knives, spades, shovels and digging tools. With the profits she will get from her business, Akenese will improve her family's living standards and reinvest part of her profit back to her business.

loans.use: To purchase a mist blower, chemicals, knife sharpener, bush knives, spades, shovels and digging tools

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as gasoline, fishing nets and bamboo for her fishing business.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 5 years. Mary Grace also earns income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as gasoline, fishing nets and bamboo for her business operations

loans.name: Rosario America

texts.es: Rosario tiene 57 años de edad, ella tiene 11 hijos, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 14 años que asiste al colegio, Rosario es una señora colombiana que decidio trasladarse a Ecuador hace 14 años cuando los guerrilleros quisieron robarle a una de sus hijas y que al anocheser ella se vino a Ecuador en busca de trabajo y de una vida tranquila, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para incrementar su neocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario is 57 years old and has 11 children. She lives with her husband and her 14-year-old son who goes to high school. Rosario is a Colombian woman who decided to move to Ecuador 14 years ago when the guerrilla fighters wanted to take one of her daughters. At night time she fled to Ecuador in search of work and a tranquil life.

She makes a living raising small animals and she will invest the loan in the purchase of guinea pigs to grow her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Issa est un jeune de 30 ans qui évolue dans l’informatique depuis plus de 5 ans. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants qui n’ont pas encore l’âge d’aller à l’école. Issa vit dans un village situé dans la petite cote. Issa veut développer son activité en faisant un prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter du matériel informatique pour renforcer son cybercafé. Il n’est pas novice dans les crédits car son premier matériel a été acquis grâce aux prêts. Issa est un promoteur qui a des idées qu’il veut mettre en exécution. Il ouvre son cybercafé de 8h du matin à 22 h du soir. 
Avec les bénéfices de son activité, il nourrit sa famille et met un peu d’argent de coté.
Son ambition est de monter un grand cybercafé espace au niveau de son village et d’ouvrir un centre de formation en informatique.
texts.en:
Issa is a young 30-year-old who has been involved in IT for over 5 years. He is married and the father of two children who are not yet old enough to go to school. He lives in a small village along the coast.

Issa wants to expand his business by taking out a loan that will enable him to purchase computer equipment to strengthen his cybercafé. He is no novice regarding credit loans as his first equipment was acquired through loans.

Issa is a promoter who has ideas he wants to put into practice. He opens his cybercafé from 8 am until 10 pm.

With the profits from his business, he feeds his family and puts some money aside. His ambition is to set up a large cybercafé space in the village and open a computer training center.

loans.use: buy computer equipment for his cybercafé

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr:
La dame Bineta, âgée de 58 ans, s’active dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires depuis plus de 20 ans. Actuellement elle a ouvert une cantine devant chez elle, qu’elle a bien développée au fil du temps. Elle a démarré avec un petit capital en vendant des divers. Dans le souci de toujours s’améliorer, elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer sa marchandise, pour acheter du sucre, du thé, du lait, du café, de l’huile…
Bineta est divorcée et mère de 4 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle achète aussi un sac de riz à ses parents, à la fin de chaque mois. Consciente de cette responsabilité, elle veut améliorer son activité pour en tirer d’avantage de profit et pouvoir mettre sa famille dans de bonnes conditions de vie.
Elle pense aussi ouvrir une grande boutique de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
The lady Bineta, age 58, has been active in the food trade for over 20 years. Currently she runs a canteen in front of her home that she has developed over time.

She started with a small capital by selling various products. Constantly seeking to improve, she is requesting a loan to bolster her supply of goods, to buy sugar, tea, milk, coffee, cooking oil, ... 

Bineta is a divorced mother with four children under her care. She also buys a bag of rice for her parents at the end of each month.

Aware of these responsibilities, she wants to improve her business to generate more profit and be able to provide her family with good living conditions.

She also is thinking about opening a large cosmetics shop.

loans.use: buy food products for resale

loans.name: Rosmery Raquel

texts.es:
Rosmery es una joven emprendedora, tiene 19 años de edad, soltera y vive en Ica junto a sus padres.
Es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace casi 1 año trabaja en un restaurante y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy entusiasta, responsable, respetuosa y amable con los clientes. Con el dinero que gana apoya en los gastos del hogar.
Rosmery está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá remodelar su cuarto para mayor comodidad y para que pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y así seguir trabajando para tener un futuro mejor y más adelante pueda cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su casa propia"
texts.en:
Rosmery is an enterprising young woman. She is 19 years old, single and lives in Ica with her parents. She is a young woman with a strong desire to get ahead. For almost one year she has been working in a restaurant and it has been going very well because she is very enthusiastic, responsible, respectful and kind to her customers. With the money she earns she supports the household expenses. 

Rosmery is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given her she will be able to remodel her bedroom for greater comfort and to improve the quality of her life. She will continue working to have a better future and later on achieve her greatest dream: "To have her own home."

loans.use: to remodel her bedroom

loans.name: Fitinai

texts.en: Fitinai is a 32-year-old married mother of three children. She sells meat buns to the members of her village, schools, and members of the public traveling to and from her village. She has been doing this for a few months and needs financial assistance to maintain her meat bun business. For this reason, she has decided to join the SPBD program. With this money, Fitinai plans to purchase ingredients for her business such as boxes of mutton flaps, sacks of sugar, sacks of flour, cooking oil, soya, yeast, sacks of onions, and garlic. Fitinai hopes to improve her family's living conditions through the profits she is able to earn from her business.

loans.use: To purchase mutton flaps, sugar, flour, cooking oil, soya, yeast, onions, and garlic

loans.name: Masae

texts.en: Masae is a 28-year-old mother of two children. She bakes her puddings and sells them to the villages and nearby shops not only inside her village, but also to the neighboring villages as well. Having observed the SPBD members in her village operating their own businesses, Masae decided to join the SPBD program to get financial assistance in order to start her business. She plans to use the money she is applying for to purchase a cooking stove and ingredients for her bakery such as two sacks of flour, two sacks of sugar, baking powder, eggs, and butter. With the profits she believes she will get from her business, Masae hopes to not only reinvest in her business, but also help assist with her family's daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, baking powder, eggs, butter and a cooking stove

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de dos años de edad. Juan trabaja en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como mantiene a su familia y les da  lo necesario. Juan solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea enladrillar el piso de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, etc. De esta forma espera dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Juan is 25 years old and lives in his own house together with his life partner and their 2-year-old son. Juan works at a nearby company and in this way provides for his family all that is necessary. Juan requests a loan from FUSAI because he wishes to pave the floor of his home with bricks, for which he needs materials such as: cement, sand, bricks, etc. By doing so, he hopes to create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, etc., to pave the floor of his home with bricks

loans.name: Herbert Napoleon

texts.es: Herbert de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, el tiene un negocio de llanteria ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por el buen trabajo que realiza y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Herbert esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas por mayor y poder continuar con su trabajo y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Herbert is 59 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and children. He has a business selling tires located inside his residence. He has many customers because of the good work he does and because of his good prices. With the earnings from his sales, he is able to pay for household expenses. Herbert is requesting a loan to buy tires at wholesale so he can continue with his work and thus provide for his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires at wholesale

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 47 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Monina has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and earns additional income from tricycle transportation.

Monina aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ines Arliria

texts.es:
Al hablar de la señora Ines, es inevitable pensar en una mujer de progreso, empuje y coraje.
Tiene una tienda de abarrotes que inicio hace 5 años y la cual ha ido puliendo a medida que pasa el tiempo. Considera que ha aprendido mucho gracias al negocio y tiene grandes expectativas respecto a este.
En el establecimiento vende productos básicos de la canasta familiar, frituras, bebidas, entre otros.
Su hija le ayuda ocasionalmente a atender en el negocio en los tiempos que tiene libres.
Ella solicita un préstamo para capitalizar su negocio y darle un impulso económico para asegurar su mantenimiento en el tiempo.
Entre sus sueños más importantes se puede encontrar el poder generar un  empleo y tener una vida económica estable y duradera.
texts.en:
Upon speaking with Ines, one cannot help but think of her as a woman of achievement, tenacity and courage. She runs a general store that she opened five years ago, and which she has been improving with the passage of time. She believes that she has learned a lot thanks to her business and has great expectations for it. In her establishment, she sells basic products for the family basket, fried food and beverages, among others. Her daughter occasionally helps her attend to the business in her free time.

She requests a loan to capitalize her business and to give it an economic boost to assure its maintenance. Among her most important dreams is being able to generate employment and to have a stable and lasting economic life.

loans.use: to buy inventory of household goods and other products

loans.name: Faatuatua

texts.en:
Faatuatua is 28 years old and married with three children.

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Faatuatua needs a loan to buy chemicals, sprayers, a wheelbarrow, crops, a tiller, gum boots and new overalls.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Faatuatua will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprayers, a wheelbarrow, crops, a tiller, gum boots and new overalls

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Ton, 51 years old, is an experienced farmer in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two schoolchildren and one married child. Ton and her husband grow rice on their own farmland located near their house. This career allows this couple to earn USD 5 a day.

This season, Ton cannot plow the rice by herself since her health is not so good. In order to continue her farming business, she would like to apply for a loan to hire some laborers to plow the rice for her. Last but not least, she is grateful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than the usual rates for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to hire laborers to plow her rice

loans.name: Siisii

texts.en: Siisii is a 32-year-old married woman with six children. She has a plantation business and she is assisted by her husband and children.They have been doing this for more than three years. She sells her crops around her village and to the public at the main market in town. With this loan, Siisii will purchase a mist blower, wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizers, bushknives, spades, and digging tools to better improve her business. Siisii was able to improve her family's living standards with her profits and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase a mist blower, wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizers, bushknives, spades, and digging tools

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is a 48-year-old widow with nine children. She runs a pancake business and has been doing this for more than two years. With the loan she is getting, Amelia wants to buy more ingredients and utensils for the betterment of her business.These items are as such: sacks of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, sacks of sugar, kitchen utensils, pots and pans, containers, a cooking stove and plastic bags. Amelia joined the SPBD program in 2011 to gain access to financial assistance and with the profits that she has been getting from her business, she has been able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, sacks of sugar, kitchen utensils, pots and pans, containers, a cooking stove and plastic bags.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Mary Joy is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store.

Mary Joy has sustained her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra vive en una Provincia netamente ganadera, ella tiene 34 años de edad y es madre soltera de sus 3 hijos de 13, 15 y 19 años de los cuales 2 están estudiando  y el mayor ya no pudo seguir estudiando y está  trabajando, ella se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde hace 7 años, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para incrementarlos en su negocio, su aspiración es seguir luchando en la vida por sus hijos para darles a la educación.
texts.en: Sandra lives in a mostly cattle-raising province. She is 34 years old and the single mother of 3 children who are 13, 15 and 19 years old. Among her children, two are studying and the eldest could not continue studying and is working. She has made a living raising pigs since she was 7 years old. She will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs to grow them in her business. Her aspiration is to keep on struggling in life for her children and to give them an education.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Filifili

texts.en:
Filifili is a 49-year-old married woman with four children.

She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. Filifili has requested a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, gloves, a farming fork, a tiller, chemicals, sprayers, crops and new gum boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2000. Filifili hopes to save her profits in case of an emergency.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, gloves, a farming fork, a tiller, chemicals, sprayers, crops and new gum boots

loans.name: Anamaria

texts.en: Anamaria is a 58-year-old married woman with eleven children. She started operating her small shop in December last year and hopes to expand the products she is able to sell. That is why she has just joined the SPBD program, in order to gain access to financial assistance. With this money, she wants to buy things to restock her shop such as a new freezer, boxes of chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, sausages, soft drinks and snacks. Anamaria has already planned to reinvest some of her profits back into her business, and save another part of her profits so that it would provide for her family's essential needs.

loans.use: to purchase a new freezer, boxes of chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, sausages, soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Pitovao Anae

texts.en: Pitovao is 45 years old and married with eight children. She runs a small canteen business in her community and has been doing this for five years. Pitovao has requested a loan to buy sandwiches, donuts, soft drinks, candy, potato chips, coffee, sugar, foam cups and a new cash register machine. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pitovao hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, donuts, soft drinks, candy, potato chips, coffee, sugar, foam cups and a new cash register machine

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is a 66 year old widow woman with 6 children. She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages, tomatoes and green peppers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 14 years. Elisapeta has requested a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, chicken manure, sprayers and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2000. With her profits, Elisapeta hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, chicken manure, sprayers and new overalls

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 3 years. Juanita requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, a cutter, wooden carved designs, brushes and rollers. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, a cutter, wooden carved designs, brushes and rollers.

loans.name: Ati

texts.en:
Ati is a 56-year-old widow with 8 children. She has a plantation business and her children help out when their assistance is needed. She has been doing this for more than 5 years. 

With this money, Ati needs to purchase more tools and equipment to better maintain her plantation. These are tools such as chemicals, 2 mist blowers,  a wheelbarrow, empty gallon containers and knife sharpeners. 

Ati joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial assistance. Over the years that she has been a member, she has been able to improve her family's  standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, 2 mist blowers, a wheelbarrow, empty gallon containers and knife sharpeners

loans.name: Lepale

texts.en:
Lepale is a mother with one child. She wants to start a pancake business to help support her family and child. She plans to sell them to the school children and their village school, and also to the villagers. 

She plans to use this money to purchase sacks of flour, pots and pans, cooking oil and kitchen utensils to start up her pancake business. She has just joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services, and she hopes to improve her family's living standards with the profits she is able to make from her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour, pots and pans, cooking oil and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona owns and manage a direct selling business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for more than five years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by maintaining a jeepney unit which they also operate for business purpose. *Ramona appears here in a photo with their jeepney unit.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to purchase more supplies and merchandise for additional stock. She is requesting an amount of PHP 10,000 to buy additional products needed in her business.

In the future, she wants to grow her business and hopes of having a stable earning for living. She also dreams of having additional unit of jeepney.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Eduardo tiene 34 años de edad casado con la señora Zulma la cual tiene 33 años de edad, el señor es una persona responsable. Actualmente está trabajando en una empresa reconocida de la ciudad de Cochabamba, logro estudiar hasta el nivel profesional y se casó muy joven. Gracias a la ayuda de sus padres Eduardo puede vivir bajo un techo y solo se ocupa de comprar las cosas que necesitan sus hijos y su esposa dado que ahora la señora Zulma no está trabajando porque uno de sus hijos esta delicado de salud y no está aportando económicamente, el motivo del presente crédito es para poder comprar una motocicleta dado que este es un requisito para poder trabajar y además haría que su trabajo sea más rápido y más eficiente ya que podrá cubrir más terreno y generar más ingresos para satisfacer sus necesidades y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 34, who is married to Zulma, 33, is a very responsible person and works for a well-known company in the city of Cochabamba.  He was able to get an education and professional training and married very young.  Thanks to the help of his parents, Eduardo has a roof over his head and only needs worry about buying the things his children and wife need.  Zulma is not working because one of their children is in poor health so she cannot contribute to the economy.

The reason for this loan is to buy a motorcycle since it is something Eduardo needs for work to make him faster and more efficient.  He will be able to cover more territory and earn more income for his and his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq (05) femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont mariées toutes dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié,  de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Niomirambougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons, échalote…), œufs, poissons et jus. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Wassa (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des oignons ; elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs d’oignons au marché Médine de Bamako en gros ; la revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits au marché de Niomirambougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Wassa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The five women of the Djiguiya group are all married in polygamous households. They are on average 35 years old with four children. They all live in Niomirambougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako. They became acquainted through kinship, friendship, neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Niomirambougou market.

Members of the group are small retail merchants dealing in condiments (onions, shallots, ...), eggs, fish and juice. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Wassa (the woman sitting on the far left in the photo) has a great reputation in selling onions. She plans to use her loan to buy four bags of onions wholesale at the Medina market of Bamako. Retail sales are made for cash and on credit at the Niomirambougou market and as an itinerant vendor, to a clientele composed mostly of women. 

Mrs. Wassa hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to maintain her children.

loans.use: buy onions

loans.name: Vr

texts.en:
Vr, a 63-year-old father of four married children and one dependent child, lives and has operated a framing business for more than thirty years in Prey Chhor District and Kampng Cham Province. The average income of his family is USD 5 a day. Growing rice and sells at the local market is the only one way that he can do for generating the profit.

Vr, who is an old customer of HKL, has recently applied for his second cycle loan to buy his framing supplies. The farming supplies that he is going to buy include seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and others related materials. To gratitude for them lenders, he promises to the pay the loan back base on the repayment scheduled like he used to do it for one cycle loan already.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and others related materials

loans.name: Reda

texts.en:
Reda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Reda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Reda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Pamela Joy

texts.en:
Pamela Joy is 30 years old and married with four children.

Pamela Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like sugar, soap and other groceries.

Pamela Joy has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto, se ha decidió por un nuevo crédito debido al crecimiento del negocio, en esta ocasión lo utilizara para comprar concentrado, vitaminas y hará mejoras en los corrales en donde permanece los animales, contara con el alimento suficiente para las gallinas ponedoras y el ganado.
El capital anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos, ha tenido buenas ganancias y las utiliza para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, así como también para cancelar sus cuotas del crédito.
texts.en:
Humberto has decided to take out a new loan because his business has grown.  This time he will buy animal feed and vitamins, and renovate the pens where he keeps the animals.  This means he will have enough feed for the egg-laying hens and the livestock.

The previous loan was of much help in improving crop productivity.  He earned a good profit and used it to cover family necessities and pay back the loan.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and vitamins, and to renovate the pens.

loans.name: La Prosperite Group

texts.fr:
Mme  BIBATA est responsable du groupe  LA PROSPERITE. Mariée, elle est mère d’un enfant  âgé de 03ans. IL va à l’école (maternelle). Elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme fait la restauration depuis  plus de 06ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter  une bouteille de gaz pour la cuisine et des condiments (1/2 sac de choux, 01paquet de cube Maggi et 01sachet d’ail).	
Elle veut épargner  ses bénéfices afin d’agrandir son kiosque. Mme  ambitionne assurer la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bibata is responsible for the La Prosperité group. Married, she is the mother of a 3-year-old child who attends school (kindergarten). She has three persons under her care. 

She has been in the restaurant business for over six years. She resupplies at the market in her area. She wants to buy a bottle of gas for cooking and condiments (1/2 bag of cabbage, 1 package of Maggi cubes  and 1 bag of garlic). 

She wants to save her profits to expand her food kiosk. Her ambition is to ensure her child's education.

loans.use: buy a bottle of gas for cooking and condiments (1/2 bag of cabbage, 1 package of Maggi cubes  and 1 bag of garlic).

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les cinq (05) membres du groupe Fotemogoban ont en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Niomirambougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, fruits (mangues), restauration, pâtes d’arachides et œufs. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de fruits (mangues). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs  de mangues à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Niomirambougou à une clientèle mixte. Madame Oumou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
For the most part married in polygamous households, the five members of the Fotemobogan group are on average 39 years old with five children. They all live in Niomirambougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako. They became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Niomirambougou market.

Members of the group are small retail merchants dealing in fruit (mangoes), food preparations, groundnut paste and eggs. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Oumou (the woman sitting on the far left in the photo) is a great seller of fruit (mangoes). She plans to use her loan to buy ten bags of mangoes in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted in Niomirambougou to a mixed clientele.

Mrs. Oumou hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 45,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household needs.

loans.use: buy fruit

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les six membres du groupe Sabougnouma ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à N’tomikorobougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de N’tomikorobougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pagnes wax, restauration et céréales. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokia (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagnes wax. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à N’tomikorobougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Rokia compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
For the most part married in monogamous households, the six members of the Sabougnouma group are on average 35 years old with three children. They all live in N'tomikorobougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako. They became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the N'tomikorobougou market.

Members of the group are small retail merchants dealing in pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric), food preparations, and grain cereals. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Rokia (the woman sitting on the far left in the photo) is a great seller of pagnes wax. She plans to use her loan to buy 40 lengths of pagne wax fabric in Bamako. Retail sales are made in N'tomikorobougou and as an itinerant vendor, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Rokia hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 95,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household needs.

loans.use: buy pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Rokhy

texts.fr:
Madame Rokhy s’active dans le mareyage depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite un village un peu éloigné de la mer mais cela ne l’empêche pas d’aller vers les rives pour chercher le poisson car elle adore cette activité. Elle sollicite un crédit afin de pouvoir augmenter son capital et augmenter la quantité de sa marchandise. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20 h du soir. Elle possède une pirogue et emploie au moins 4 jeunes pour aller en mer. 
Avec les recettes de son activité, elle peut s’occuper des besoins de ses enfants et appuyer son mari dans la dépense quotidienne du foyer. 
Son autre projet après celui-ci sera d’acheter un nouveau moteur pour sa pirogue.
texts.en:
Rokhy has been working in the fish trade for more than ten years.  She is married, has children and lives in a village a short distance from the sea.  However, this doesn't stop her from going to the coast to catch fish as she enjoys this activity.

Rokhy has requested this loan in order to improve her working capital and the quantity of fish she has to sell.  She starts her working day at nine in the morning and finishes at eight in the evening.  She owns a dug-out canoe and employs at least four young people to take it out to sea to catch fish.

Rokhy uses her income to provide for her children and help her husband with the expenses of their household.  Her next project will be to buy a new motor for her boat.

loans.use: to equip her dug-out canoe and increase the quantity of fish caught.

loans.name: Alexi Maricela

texts.es:
Alexi, es casada, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos, las diferentes actividades de su hogar son combinadas con la crianza de ganado y cerdos, también procesa la leche obteniendo así  productos lácteos suficientes para consumo familiar y comercializarlos con sus vecinos; trabaja de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., siendo una niña aprendió dicho oficio junto a su padre.
Como una forma de aumentar el ganado y tener más lácteos, utilizara el capital para comprar una vaca parida, así tendrá ingresos extras que le ayudaran a respaldar sus cuotas y aportar más en los gastos familiares.
Su anhelo es contar con un negocio rentable para ayudar a sus hijos a forjar un buen futuro como profesionales.
texts.en:
Alexi is married and lives with her husband and two children.  The different household chores involve raising livestock and pigs, and also processing milk to make sufficient dairy products for family consumption and sales to neighbors.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. and learned the trade from her father.

In an effort to increase her livestock and have more dairy products, Alexi will use the loan to buy a dairy cow so she will have extra income to help pay off the loan and also to cover family expenses.  Her goal is to have a business that is profitable enough to insure her children will have a better future as professionals.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jeshi Kubwa Group

texts.en:
Tabu, who is in her late thirties, is married. Together with her husband they have two daughters, who are both at school. For three years now, Tabu has been supporting her family with a grocery business selling beers, sodas, juices, water and spirits. She serves people from 8am to midnight daily, and is able to make a small profit each month. 

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Tabu will use this loan to buy beverages for her business such as beers, sodas and water. Her ambition is to build a nice house.
 
Tabu will share this loan with her loan group, Jeshi Kubwa, which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beverages for her business such as beers, sodas and water.

loans.name: Ambekoun Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Ambekoun ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons)  et habits. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme  assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (oignons). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs d’oignons à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila  en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Most of the four members of the Ambekoun Group are married into polygamous households.  They are, on average 40 years old and have five children.  They all live in Kanadjiguila in the commune of Mandé, Kati County.  They know one another through business and local connections.  The women work at the market in Kanadjiguila, and sell food ingredients (onions) and clothing.

Wanting to increase their working capital, the group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their second group loan.

Mariam (sitting on the far right in the photo) sells onions.  She plans to use her loan to buy ten sacks of onions in Médine.  She will then retail them on foot in Kanadjiguila, mainly to women.  Mariam expects this loan to generate an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to provide for the needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de marcos para foto y diplomas desde hace vario años trabaja en su lugar de residencia y luego sale a comercializarlos en las diferentes colonias de la zona, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Flor solicita un credito para poder comprar todo lo necesario para la elaboracion de los marcos como: revistas, láminas, bobinas de plastico, madrea, pintura, etc. para seguir teniendo buenas ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flor, 52, lives in her own house with her husband.  She has a business selling frames for pictures and diplomas which she has been running for several years from home.  She goes out to the different communities in the area to sell them and uses the income from sales to help her husband cover household expenses.

Flor is requesting a loan to buy everything she needs to make the frames such as magazines, prints, rolls of plastic, wood, paint, etc. so she can continue earning a good profit and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To by magazines, prints, rolls of plastic, wood, paint, etc.

loans.name: Ascencio

texts.es: Ascencio tiene 60 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 13 años, 15 años, 18 años y 25 años de edad. Ascencio es agricultor y cultiva principalmente ayotes, ejotes y güisquil desde hace 24 años. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra en mal estado, por lo que con el crédito comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Ascencio, 60, lives in his own house with his wife and their four children, ages 13, 15, 18 and 25.  Ascencio is a farmer and mainly grows pumpkin, green beans and chayote.  He has been in this line of work for 24 years.

In an effort to improve his living conditions, Ascencio is requesting a loan through FUSAI to repair the roof of his house which is damaged.  He will use the loan to buy metal sheeting, wood and nails.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood, and nails to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Hugo Guillermo

texts.es: Hugo es un joven muy positivo que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y también es albañil, vive solo  debido a que sus padres viven en un lugar muy alejado de donde le llevan a trabajar en albañilería, Hugo tiene 31 años de edad, el crédito va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para incrementar en sus cuyeras, su aspiración es poder crecer su negocio, seguir trabajando y en algún momento comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Hugo, aged 31, is a very positive young man who makes a living raising small animals and is also a bricklayer. He lives alone because his parents live a long way away from where he works as a bricklayer. 

He will use the loan to buy guinea pigs to increase the numbers in his pens. His aspiration is to be able to grow his business, to continue working and to buy a house one day.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Amed Elias

texts.es: El señor Amed es una persona responsable y con ganas de superación actualmente trabaja en una empresa reconocida de nuestra ciudad como ejecutivo de ventas en todos los supermercados y mercados, vive solo dado que toda su familia se encuentra en la ciudad de la paz, cuando vino a Cochabamba se esforzó mucho y busco trabajo pero fue muy difícil encontrar ya que estaba recién egresado de su carrera, paso grandes problemas para poder encontrar la fuente laboral, pero actualmente ya cuenta con un trabajo estable, el motivo del presente crédito es para poder comprar una motocicleta ya que esta es una herramienta muy necesaria para poder realizar su trabajo de manera más rápida y efectiva, si bien ya cuenta con una, la misma es muy antigua y está empezando a fallar por ello desea comprar otra que este en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Amed is someone who is responsible and wants to get on in life. He currently works in a well known firm in the city of Cochabamba as a sales executive for all the supermarkets and markets. He lives alone since all of his family live in the city of La Paz. When he came to Cochabamba he put a lot of effort into looking for a job, but it was very difficult to find work as he had just finished his degree. He had a lot of problems finding a source of employment. However, he now has a stable job.

The reason for the loan is to buy a motorbike which is very necessary to allow him to do his work rapidly and effectively. Although he already has one, it is very old and is starting to break down so he wants to buy another one which is in a good condition.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: mariano de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica a la venta y elaboración de hamacas, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, mariano esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos y lanas de varios colores por mayor para poder seguir elaborando mas hamacas y así obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mariano, who is 55 years old, lives in his own house with his family. He earns a living making and selling hammocks. He sells his products in the various markets around his home and with the money he makes from his sales he is able to cover some of his household expenses.

Mariano is asking for a loan to buy different coloured threads and wool wholesale so he can continue making more hammocks, which will provide more income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy different coloured threads and wool wholesale.

loans.name: Jacqueline Valeria

texts.es: Valeria es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y con sus 2 hijos de 5 y 8 años de edad que se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores,  dice Valeria que todo su trabajo y su lucha diaria la hace para bienestar de sus hijos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para mejorar su negocio y por medio de este que a sus hijos no les haga falta sobre todo los útiles para  que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Valeria is a single mother and lives with her parents and her two children aged 5 and 8, who go to primary school. She makes a living raising small animals. Valeria says that all of her work and her daily effort is for the wellbeing of her children.

She will use the loan to buy chickens to improve her business and so ensure that her children don't have to go without anything, especially the equipment they need for school.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 27 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su padre, es un joven muy conocido en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee un chalet en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicado a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que lo buscan y lo prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas su negocio debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
This borrower, who is 27 years old, lives in his own house with his mother and father. This young man is well known throughout the local area as a humble person who is dedicated to his work. He has never allowed himself to be beaten and he has always got on in spite of his difficulties. Through hard work and dedication he has a cabin where he sells everyday essentials such as basic grains, milk, eggs, rice and other items. He is very committed to his work and treats his customers very well. This is why he has customers who come to him through choice and prefer his products.

He needs to stock his business a little more as he has had an increase in demand and does not have the capital to buy more. This is why he is asking for a loan to buy more products such as basic grains, instant food, sweets, drinks etc. He trusts in God that the help he has asked for will soon be provided and his only concern will be providing food for his household every day.

loans.use: to buy more products such as basic grains, instant food, sweets, drinks etc.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Maria, who is 46 years old, lives in her own house with her family group. She earns a living making and selling clothing. She runs the business from her home and is very hard-working, responsible and positive. She also has good references, both personal and for her work, from lots of people. She makes a range of garments at very affordable prices. Her work is also of a good quality, which is why a lot of people prefer her. She has been doing this work for many years and so has a lot of experience and especially regular customers who increasingly prefer her work.

Maria has decided to ask for this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her small business and buy necessary supplies such as fabric, thread and elastic for making a range of garments. She is doing this in order to provide a better service to her customers so that they continue to buy her products and so her sales and income will increase. She hopes to achieve her objective and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic etc.

loans.name: Teresa De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Teresa tiene 22 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre. Ella trabaja en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Junto a su madre mantienen la economía de su familia. Teresa solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila y baño con ducha para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, etc.
texts.en:
Teresa is 22 years old and lives in her own house with her mother. She works at a local business and this is how she earns a living and provides for the household. Together she and her mother provide the family's income.

Teresa is asking FUSAI for this loan to build a sink area with a toilet and shower. For this she needs to buy materials such as bricks, cement, sand, iron etc.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron etc. to build a sink area with a toilet and shower

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es: Rosa de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, tiene mas hijos que ya son independientes pero le ayudan económicamente, ella posee desde hace 5 años un comedor el cual esta ubicado en el punto de buses en una zona muy transitada, tiene mucha clientela especialmente los motoristas,con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de sus hijos y esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: maíz, arroz, frijoles, harina de arroz, jugos, agua, carne, pollo, verduras, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos para darle a su familiauna mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son. She has other children who are living on their own and who help her out financially. For the past 5 years she has run a small restaurant located near the bus station in a very busy area and she has many customers, especially among the bus drivers. With the income from her sales and with help from her children and husband the family pays for household expenses. Rosa is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like corn, rice, beans, rice flour, juices, water, meat, chicken, vegetables, etc. in order to continue with this work that generates a good income and allows her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn, rice, beans, rice flour, juices, water, meat, chicken, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is a 38-year-old woman from Pontevedra, Capiz, Philippines. Capiz province is one of the areas affected by typhoon Haiyan when it hit the Philippines in November 2013. Analyn and her family survived, and they are moving on with their lives. Her business is starting to recover, as is her husband’s crab business. They both work hard to provide for their family. Analy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She makes PHP 500 or more in sales every day. She is applying for a PHP 20,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Analy hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of giving her children a good life and education.
