She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. She is 47 years old and has four children who are currently in school. Her four older children work and help her provide for their everyday necessities. She manages a variety store business, and her income from the business is helping to cover their everyday needs and expenditures. She also sells school supplies for additional income. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She makes PHP 500 or more in sales every day. She is applying for a PHP 20,000 loan to buy grocery items and school supplies for her business. She will be using the loan to buy products and other materials to increase her inventory. In the future, she hopes for an increase the sales of her business, and she dreams of a better future for all her eight children. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Geralda

texts.en: Geralda is 65 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children who are now adults. Geralda has been engaged in managing a sari-sari store that sells groceries and other consumer products for five years, and she earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month from this of business activity. She has applied for a loan to be used in buying additional stocks of groceries and other consumer goods to sell. Geralda has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Geralda hopes to expand her sari-sari business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and other consumer goods to sell.

loans.name: 08 Đông Hải Group

texts.en: Mrs. Anh works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is applying for a loan to invest in her business. Anh is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Anh is the group leader of the 08 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. This is Anh’s first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Anh has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Anh faces in her business is a lack of capital. With her business profits, Anh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Pacca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE PACCA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agripina ella es casada y tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank “Inmaculada Concepción de Pacca”, located in the Anta district, Anta province, in the department of Cusco.

Agripina, one of the members, is 47 years old, married and has two children. She works raising and selling animals. She has guinea pigs and hens, and when they are big and fat, she sells them at different fairs. It is with this business that she is able to raise her children. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her animals.

Agripina is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs, hens and animal feed.

The other members have different activities: food sales, agriculture, grocery stores and animal sales. Agripina wants to thank all of those who make part of this dream through this means and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens and animal feed.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell. Lucena has been in this business for three years. Lucena earns additional income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sithun

texts.en:
Sithun, a 27-year-old mother of one dependent child, lives and operates a farming business in the Prey Chhor District of the Kampng Cham Province. She has been involved in this business for four years. The average income that she earns is $5 a day. Growing rice and selling it at the local market is the primary way she makes her living.

Sithun, who is a repeat customer of HKL, has recently applied for her second loan to buy cows to use in her farmland. To express her gratitude to the lenders, she promises to pay the loan back based on the repayment schedule as she did for the past loan already.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
La socia Segundina  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de frutas , la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende platanos, naranjas y manzanas,  la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos y uvas . 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Segundina continues to sell fruits. She delivers her products to different areas. Segundina sells bananas, oranges and apples. She has been doing so for many years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her fruits.

Segundina is requesting a loan to buy oranges, bananas and grapes. She feels happy with this loan and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas and grapes to sell.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La socia Leonor se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de leche y tambien la socia sigue siendo docente del nivel inicial,la socia lleva a diferentes tiendas de abarrotes,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar leche al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leonor is a member who sells milk. She is also a school teacher. She delivers her products to different grocery stores, working from 08:00 am until 07:00 pm. Leonor has been doing this for many years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have her own grocery store.

Leonor is requesting a loan to buy wholesale milk. She feels happy with this loan and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy wholesale milk to sell.

loans.name: 07 Lạch Trường Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Thủy has a service business tailoring clothes. She is applying for a loan to purchase more fabrics to sew clothes to sell.

Thủy is 38 years old and married with three children.

Thủy is the group leader of the 07 Lạch Trường Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2013, Thủy joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid four loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

In the future, Thủy hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics to sew clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joveniana

texts.en:
Joveniana works hard to support her family. Joveniana is widowed and has a native basket-weaving business in the Philippines.

Joveniana has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business.

Joveniana has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Joveniana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe  Djiguissèmè ont en moyenne 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Niomirambougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, d’habits (pagnes wax), de condiments et de fruits. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme debout l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de, habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 90 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Niomirambougou en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Predominantly married in polygamous households, the four members of the Djiguisseme group are on average 36 years old with five children. They all live in Niomirambougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Niomirambougou market.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in clothing (pagne wax fabric), condiments and fruit. Wanting to increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their third group loan cycle. 

Ms. Fatoumata (the woman standing on the far left in the photo) is a great seller of quality clothing (pagne wax fabric). She will use her loan to buy 90 lengths of pagne wax fabric in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted as an itinerant vendor in Niomirambougou, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Ms. Fatoumata hopes to attain with this loan an average monthly profit of 85,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household needs.

loans.use: buy quality pagne wax clothing (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: 05 Lạch Trường Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Gương operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Gương is forty-three years old and married with three children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 05 Lạch Trường Hải Lộc solidarity group. 

This is Gương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Gương has been involved in this business for over ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is a lack of transportation.

In the future, Gương hopes her family will be healthy and happy. She also hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: Good Work Group

texts.en:
Amina is in her early forties and has four children, one of whom is in school. The rest are grown up. She is married. For ten years now, Amina has had a café business selling soft drinks, milk with snacks, rice, ugali and cooked banana. She starts work at 6am and works until midnight every day. She is able to make a small profit each month. 

Amina is applying for her eleventh loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans (all of which she paid back successfully) to improve her café by replacing stocks (sodas, waters and cooking ingredients). She earned a profit and used it to buy a plot of land, build a house, pay part of her child's school fees and cover household expenses. She dreams that one day she will own a car and improve her life. Amina will use this loan to start serving chips in her cafe. Specifically, she is going to buy a cupboard, Irish potatoes and cooking oil. 
 
Amina will share this loan with her loan group, "Good work," which consists of six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a cupboard, Irish potatoes and cooking oil so she can start serving chips in her cafe

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, needles and zippers for her business.

Juana has been in this business for fifteen years. Juana earns an additional income from pig fattening.

Juana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes one day to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, threads, needles and zippers for her business

loans.name: Tiresa

texts.en:
Tiresa is a 45-year-old mother of 4 children. For more than 3 years, she has operated a small retail shop in her village. Tiresa needs this loan to restock her shop with items such as sugar, flour, Tang, rice, chicken leg quarters, onions, chewing gum and laundry detergents. 

Tiresa joined the SPBD program in 2010 to gain access to financial assistance. With the profits earned from her business throughout the years, she was able to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest some of the profits back to her shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, Tang, rice, chicken leg quarters, onions, chewing gum and laundry detergents

loans.name: Tulia

texts.en:
Tulia is a 40-year-old mother of 5 children. For more than 4 years, she has run a small fishing business, assisted by her husband and children. Tulia plans to use this loan to purchase a fishing boat for her business, and nails, timber, cement and iron roofing for her home renovation. 

Tulia joined SPBD  in 2010 in order to gain access to financial credit, where it cannot be accessed through traditional financial institutions. With the profits from her fishing business, Tulia has managed to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat, nails, timber, cement and iron roofing

loans.name: Faleupolu

texts.en:
Faleupolu is a 42-year-old married mother of 6 children. For more than 3 years, she has operated a lawn mowing business. Her husband and children assist her with the business and they are earning good money. Faleupolu plans to use this loan to purchase 2 lawn mowers, petrol and a business license renewal. 

Faleupolu joined SPBD in 2008 to get access to financial assistance. With the profits that she was able to get from her lawn mowing business, Faleupolu has improved her family's living standards and has been able to cater for their daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase 2 lawn mowers, petrol and a business license renewal

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Zaina is in her early twenties and single. For three years now, Zaina has spent her life managing a beauty salon. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a small return each month. 

This is her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans (all of which were paid back successfully) to buy a salon drier and hair products. She is really doing great and thankful to everyone who has supported the business. Zaina received a profit which she used to pay for her welfare. She is applying for loan to be apportioned among Mshikamano, a group of seven members. Her group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Zaina will use her portion of loan to buy salon hair products.  Her ambition is to greatly improve her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy salon hair products.

loans.name: 0501 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Lý has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food (salt, cooking-oil and peanuts) to resell.

Lý is fifty-two years old and married with two children. Lý is the group leader of the 0501 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

This is Lý's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Lý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Lý hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food (salt, cooking oil and peanuts) to resell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 47-year-old mother of 10 children. She operates a small canteen business, selling to school children and some members of her village. She also sells elei printed materials (lavalava, a type of traditional clothing), which she paints herself and delivers to nearby shops or to members of the public. Fatima has been doing these business for 2 years and knows that she earns a good income from them. She plans to use her loan to purchase crates of canned soft drinks, chicken leg quarters, sacks of rice and cooking oil for her canteen business, and designed prints, fabric paints and fabric for her elei prints. Fatima joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to credit and she has witnessed the good progress she has made in income earning since starting her business.

loans.use: to purchase crates of canned soft drinks, chicken leg quarters, sacks of rice, cooking oil, designed prints, fabric paints and fabric materials.

loans.name: Kayira Group

texts.fr:
Mariées équitablement dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Kayira ont en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako-Coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Bamako-Coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (aubergines, choux, tomates) et habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata  (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des condiments (aubergines, choux, tomates,…).Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 corbeilles de tomate, 6 sacs d’aubergines, 4 sacs de choux  en gros au marché de Médine Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché de Bamako-Coura à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata  compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Equally married in monogamous and polygamous households, the four members of the Kayira group are on average 45 years old with three children. They all live in Bamako-Coura, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Bamako-Coura market.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in condiments (eggplants, cabbages, tomatoes,...) and clothing. Wanting to increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Aminata (the woman sitting on the far right in the photo) is a great seller of condiments (eggplants, cabbages, tomatoes). She will use her loan to buy wholesale three baskets of tomatoes, six bags of eggplants, and four bags of cabbages at the Medine market in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted at the Bamako-Coura market, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Aminata hopes to attain with this loan an average monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household needs.

loans.use: buy condiments (eggplants, cabbages, tomatoes, ...)

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La socia Jovita se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jovita continues to run her grocery store. She sells staples such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She works from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM. She has had this business for 5 years and it has gone well.  Her dream is to grow her business. 

She is seeking a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Tocte  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Tocte está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeado de naturaleza, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, muchos laboran en artesanías o salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades. Todas las socias son amables, gentiles y sobre todo luchadoras que buscan entregarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro a sus hijos, sobre todo desean dejarle un buen ejemplo de trabajo y lucha diaria en sus diferentes actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana, es una socia muy alegre, participativa y trabajadora que forma parte del grupo de crédito Tocte, grupo en el que se encuentra desde hace 8 años, su grupo le gusta porque en cada reunión aprende mas de sus compañeras y así estrechan los lasos de amistad.
La Señora. Ana tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 13, 12, 9, 6 años y su último hijo de 6 meses de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus tres hijos en la escuela, su esposo labora como obrero en una fábrica de cielos rasos, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Ana  pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos y de su hogar, pero hay días que se dedica a laborar en un plantación de tomates, en su casa se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y pollos, también la agricultura que es para la venta. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar pollos y semillas para sus cultivos. Su meta es terminar su casa.
En la foto se encuentran dos hombres uno es esposo de una socia y el otro es su hijo
texts.en:
The Tocte Group is comprised of 8 women that live near the area of Jadan in Cuenca. This region is surrounded by natural beauty and the people maintain their culture and traditions here.  Most people work in agriculture or raise animals. Many work in crafts or leave the city in order to work in various jobs.  

All of the members of this group are friendly, personable, and hard-working people.  They each want to provide their children with a better future, and above all, they want to set good examples of hard-work and daily commitment to their work. 

One of the members of this group is Ana.  She is a very happy, active, and hard-working person in the Tocte Group. She has been a member of this group for 8 years and she likes the group because in each meting she learns a lot about her colleagues and she sees the ways in which they extend their friendship.  She is 29 years old, she is married, and she has 5 children that are 13, 12, 9, 6, and 6-months old.  Her oldest son studies in secondary school and her next three children attend school. Her husband works in a factory. They live in their own home. Ana cares for her children and their home, but there are days when she works at a tomato field.  At home, she raises guinea pigs and chicken and she grows various crops for sale.

She is seeking this loan in order to buy chickens and seeds for her crops.  Her goal is to finish building her home. In the photo, you will see two men -  one of them is the husband of her colleague and the other is her son.

loans.use: to buy chicken and seeds.

loans.name: 0502 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Bào has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food (salt, cooking oil, peanuts, and other items) to resell.

Bào is 49 years old and she is married with 2 children. Bào is the group leader of the 0502 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

This is Bào's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Bào has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Bào faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Bào hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food (salt, cooking oil, peanuts, and other items) to resell.

loans.name: Leonardo Junior

texts.es:
Leonardo es un joven emprendedor, tiene 19 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad en un instituto de la Ciudad donde reside. También desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en un Estudio Contable y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia.
Leonardo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con su apoyo él podrá comprar una cocina para que su madre pueda preparar mejores platillos y así puedan sentir mayores comodidades su mejorar su calidad de vida. De esta manera, con la tranquilidad de saber que su familia está bien seguirá luchando por conseguir su gran sueño: "Tener su propio estudio contable".
texts.en:
Leonardo is a young entrepreneur.  He is 19 years old and lives in Ica with his family. Currently he is studying for a career in accounting in an institute in the city in which he lives.  For the past year he has also worked in bookkeeping and it has gone well because he is a very responsible and hard-working person.  He is a person with a strong drive to get ahead and to provide the best for his family.

Leonardo is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because with their support he will be able to buy a kitchen for his mother so that she can better prepare her dishes.  It will also help the family be more comfortable and improve their quality of life. By gaining peace in knowing his family is taken care of, he will be able to focus on his biggest dream - to have his own bookkeeping business.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen for his mother.

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en: Virgina is married. She has a carpentry business where many people come to create table and chairs. Virgina will use this $800 loan to improve her business by buying some additional supplies such as wood pit tools, wood cutting tools and other tools for making tables and chairs. She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Virgina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy wood pit tools, wood cutting tools and other tools for making tables and chairs

loans.name: San Isidro De Yungaqui Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Yungaqui” perteneciente a la comunidad de Yungaqui en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruth Maritza ella es soltera y tiene 28 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “San Isidro de Yungaqui” communal bank in the community of Yungaqui, district Anta, which belongs to the province of Anta of the department of Cuzco.

Her name is Ruth Maritza. She is single and 28 years old, and the mother of 1 child.  She works in her business raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens, fattens them up, and then sells them in different markets. She has been doing this for several years and it is going well for her. Through this little business she gets her child ahead. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the guinea pigs and the chickens. She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens and to buy feed for them.  
 
The other members work selling food, in farming, running a convenience store and selling animals.

This member is grateful to those who have been a part of this dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Rosa Blanca

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Zhullin, se encuentra en su segundo crédito de este grupo, vive en por los alrededores de la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es conocida como San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues y es considerado como una ciudad patrimonio arquitectónico y cultural del Ecuador, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser gente amable y gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones. 
La Señora Rosa tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo labora en la agricultura como jornalero, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Rosa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y cerdos, también tiene un invernadero de tomates, estas actividades le dan el espacio para poder cuidar de su familia. Su crédito va a  invertir en su invernadero, va a comprar semillas y abono. Su meta es crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Zhullin communal bank. She is in her second cycle with this group. She lives nearby the city of Azogues. This city is known as  San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues and it is considered to be a city of architectural  and cultural heritage of Ecuador. Its people work in commerce, raising animals and in farming. They are described as being friendly and kind and they keep their culture and traditions.
 
Rosa is 34 years old. She is married and from he marriage has 3 children, aged 13, 10 and 8. Her oldest son is in high school and the younger children are in primary school in the city. Her husband works as a day laborer in agriculture, and they own the house they live in. 

Rosa raises and sells guinea pigs and pigs. She also has a tomato greenhouse. These activities give her the space to be able to care for her family. She is going to invest the loan in her greenhouse. She will buy seeds and fertilizer. Her goals is to grow the business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 33-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase additional stock. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially independent. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothes

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a married man from Pontevedra, Capiz, Philippines. Capiz is one of the provinces affected by typhoon Haiyan when it hit the Philippnes last November 2013. Roberto’s business was ruined but is now recovering. He is married to Mary Jean who is a housekeeper and they have children. He works hard to provide for his family.

Roberto operates a sugarcane plantation and he has had this business for twenty years now. Aside from his sugarcane plantation, he also has a piggery and a variety store. His regular customers are the local community and his neighbors. He earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for his business and also will use it for his piggery and variety store.

Roberto hopes that his business will continue to flourish and dreams of giving his family a good life. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for his business.

loans.name: Archielita

texts.en:
Archielita is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She is 37 years old and has five children. Jeffrey, her husband, works as a teacher. She operates a sugar retailing business and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.   

What she basically does is buy sacks of sugar from wholesalers, repacks them and sells them to individuals, general store owners and the local community. Sugar is repacked in ¼, 1/2, and 1 kilo variety. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is taking out a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy products and other materials which are necessary to increase her inventory.

Archielita hopes that her business will continue to improve and to flourish. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of sugar.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 29 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Juanita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Juanita has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 9 Minh Khôi Group

texts.en:
Bé is 52 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 01 thôn 9 Minh Khôi solidarity group.

Bé works in agriculture, raising poultry. Bé has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Bé joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bé has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Bé hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Saramie

texts.en: Being a responsible housewife, Seramie engages in a hog raising business to help her husband in generating income. They aim to improve their status of living and give their family a better life. In this regard, Seramie wants to improve her business and make it profitable in order to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to obtain a PHP 15,000 loan to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise. Through hard work and strong determination, she is hoping that she will improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 53 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 3 children who are now adults. 

Ma. Theresa has been engaged in a processed food dealing business, particularly chorizo and dried fish, for 3 years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of chorizo and dried fish for retail.

Ma. Theresa has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Ma. Theresa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of chorizo and dried fish.

loans.name: Gene Jell

texts.en:
Gene Jell is 31 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children who are school aged.
 
Gene Jell is engaged in dried fish vending and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of dried fish for retail.
 
Gene Jell has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years. In the future, Gene Jell hopes that all her children will finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 12 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates an arts business where she sells carvings. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a stable business that sustains her family's needs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional materials.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be industrious. He operates a market stall where he sells fruits and tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor transport. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to expand his business. His business goal is to own a fully independent business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es:
La Señora María es una persona amable y alegre que forma parte del grupo de crédito Zhullin y está en su segundo crédito, vive en por los alrededores de la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es conocida como San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues, y es considerado como una ciudad patrimonio arquitectónico y cultural del Ecuador, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan porque ser gente amable y gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones. 
La Señora María tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 23, 19 y 14 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a la carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Doña María pasa en casa pero para aportar a la economía de su casa se dedica  a la elaboración y preparación de dulces, los que son solo para entregar bajo pedido. El dinero de su crédito va a ser invertido para la compra víveres para la realización de los dulces. Su meta es tener su propio restaurante ya que le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
María is a kind and cheerful person. She is a part of the Zhullin credit group and on her second loan. She lives outside of  the city of Azogues. This city is known as San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues and it is considered to be a city of architectural and cultural heritage of Ecuador. Its people work as merchants and raising animals and farming. They are described as being friendly and kind and they maintain their culture and traditions. 

María is 39 years old. She is married and from her marriage has 3 children, aged 23, 19 and 14. Her oldest daughter is married and lives on her own. Her younger children go to high school in the city. Her husband works in carpentry. They don't own their home and are renters. 

María stays at home but to contribute to the household budget she makes sweets, but only by order. She is going to use the money from the loan to buy grocery items to make the sweets. Her goal is to have her own restaurant, because she likes to cook.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Chhon, who is 61 years old and a good farther of one school child and two married children, lives in a remote area of Kong Pisey District, Kompong Speu Province. To make money to support his family, he and his wife have been farmers for nearly 20 years. Chhon and his wife are able to earn USD $4 in one day.

During this time, he is borrowing a loan from HKL, which is the first loan for him. He will use it to pay for building a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members. Thanks to the water loan program, with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Chhon is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Herminia Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Herminia Isabel, es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos están a su cargo y  labora como comerciante en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de león, desempaña esta labor desde hace 23 años, inicia sus labores 09:00 am  finalizando  a las 05:30 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a sábado,  ella  realiza esta labor para el sustento de su hogar.   

Doña Herminia solicito un crédito a Ceprodel el que  utilizo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, shores, faldas, entre otros productos, esto le permitirá incrementar su clientela y así poder aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Herminia Isabel is the mother of four children, two of which are at her care. She works as a merchant at one of the markets in the city of Leon. She has been doing this as of 23 years ago. She starts her workday at 9 am and ends at 5.30 pm, Monday through Saturday. She does this activity to provide for her family.

Herminia has applied for a loan at Ceprodel to buy pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, among other products. This will allow her to increase her customers and her working capital.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, girl’s dresses, scarves, towels, pajamas etc.

loans.name: Virigilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 49 years old. She is married and a resident of Bonifacio, Calamba, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have four children, of which two are in school. Starting with capitalization of 1,500 PHP (Philippines pesos), she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member last 2013.  

Now she is applying for 5,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 30-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a farming business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her business is located in a market, and her primary customers are local citizens. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy fertilizer. Her business goal is to own her own cereal store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase concrete blocks, iron, cement, and gravel.

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Salama is a member of Wazo Tegeta group and is aged in her early thirties. She is married and has two daughters who are at school. For two years now, Salama has been managing two businesses: a charcoal store which operates from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., and a grocery from 4 p.m. to midnight daily. Salama has a business helper and is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this will be her first loan request, which she will use to buy business beverages (beers, sodas, juices and water). Her ambition is to greatly improve her business and become successful. She will share this loan together with two other members; the members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business beverages (beers, sodas, juices and water).

loans.name: Advincula

texts.en:
Advincula finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 40 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Advincula wishes to become the supplier of bananas in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Benigno

texts.en:
Benigno Jr. is a farmer. He is married with two children. In order to sustain the needs of his family, he involved himself in a farming business. He plants and harvests corn to sell. He also pays laborers who help him in the farming business. 

He is now asking for additional capital of 20,000 Philippines pesos to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. Someday, he hopes to keep improving his farming output and continuing to give the best education to his children, as it's the only inheritance he could give unto them someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Aurelia Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Aurelia  forma parte del grupo de crédito Sector 3 Marías desde hace un año y medio, este grupo es conocido por la amistad y solidaridad que cada una de las socias, todas son muy unidas y comparten gratos momentos en cada reunión, vive por la comunidad de que tiene el mismo nombre que al banco comunal y pertenece a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia que es reconocida por la belleza de su iglesia, también es admirada ya que desde allí se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es amable, gentil, luchadora y trabajadora, se dedican a laborar en el comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
La Señora. Aurelia tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos  de 23, 20, 18, 16, 11 y 6 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su cuarta hija  estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en una escuelita del sector, su esposo labora como chofer de maquinaria pesada, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Aurelia pasa en casa y se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, pero para tener ingresos para su hogar cría cuyes, pollos y ganado, también se dedica a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa y la venta. Algunos días  le llaman y solicitan sus servicios como empleada domestica. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de ganado y alimento de animales. Su meta es tener un galpón de pollos más grande.
texts.en: Aurelia has been part of the credit group Sector 3 Marías for a year and a half. This group is known for their friendship and solidarity among their members. They are all very close and they share nice times in each meeting. She lives in the community, which has the same name as the communal bank, and she belongs to the parish of Turi in Cuenca. This parish is known for the beauty of its church. It is also admired because from there one can admire a big part of the city of Cuenca. Its people are kind, gentle, strong and hardworking. They work in commerce, raising animals and agriculture. Aurelia is 42  years old, she is married and has 6 children from her marriage, who are 23, 20, 18, 16, 11 and 6 years old. Her 3 oldest children work and help her financially. Her fourth daughter is studying high school, and her last two children are studying in the little school in the area. Her husband works as a driver for heavy machinery. She owns the house were they live. Aurelia spends time at home and does household chores, but in order to earn income, she raises guinea pigs, chickens and cattle. She also works in agriculture, which is for household consumption and sale. Sometimes they call her and ask her to work as a domestic employee. She will invest the loan money in buying cattle and food for the animals. Her goal is to have a bigger chicken shed.

loans.use: To buy cattle and food for animals.

loans.name: Lucinda Magaly

texts.es:
La Señora. Lucinda  forma parte del grupo de crédito Sector 3 Marías desde hace un año y medio, todo este tiempo los créditos le han permitido comprar materia prima para su negocio, vive por la comunidad de que tiene el mismo nombre que al banco comunal y pertenece a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es reconocida por la belleza de su iglesia, también es admirada ya que desde allí se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es amable, gentil, luchadora y trabajadora, se dedican a laborar en el comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
La Señora. Lucinda  tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos, su esposo labora en el área de la construcción, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Lucinda desde hace tres años tiene un taller de costura, en su negocio trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo, esta actividad lo aprendió trabajando y por habilidad, la mercadería que ella elabora la vende los días de feria en la ciudad. En su casa también se dedica a la crianza de pollos. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos y repuestos para sus maquinas de cocer. Su meta es que su pequeño taller convertirlo en una fábrica.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucinda has been a member of the credit group Sector 3 Marías as of one year ago. During this time, the loans have allowed her to buy raw material for her business. She lives in a community that has the same name as her credit group. It belongs to the parish of Turi in Cuenca. This parish is well known for the beauty of its church. It is also admired because it has a beautiful view of the city of Cuenca. Its people are friendly, kind and hard-working. They work in various activities, such as agriculture, sales, and raising animals.

Ms. Lucinda is 24 years old, she is married and has no children. Her husband works in construction, they live in their own house.

Ms. Lucinda has owned a sewing shop for 3 years. She works in her business from Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule. She learnt this job by working and because of her skills. She sells the clothes she makes in the city. At home, she also raises chickens. The money from this loan will be invested in buying fabric, thread, and spare parts for her sewing machines. Her goal is to turn her small shop into a factory.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and spare parts for her sewing machines.

loans.name: Ana Mariana

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana forma parte del grupo de crédito 3 Marías, vive por la comunidad que tiene el mismo nombre que al banco comunal y pertenece a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta  parroquia es reconocida por la belleza de su iglesia, también es admirada ya que desde allí se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es amable, gentil, luchadora y trabajadora, se dedican a laborar en el comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
La Señora Ana tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, cuatro de ellos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijas solteras trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su esposo es jubilado y labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Ana se dedica a la agricultura, a la crianza de animales y a la costura que lo aprendió trabajando y por habilidad, con estas formas de trabajo ha logrado salir en adelante y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de materia prima para su taller y en  alimento para sus animales. Este nuevo crédito va  invertir en la compra de tela, botones, cierres y otros materiales para la costura. Su grupo de crédito le gusta ya que todas las socias  se apoyan en cada momento para que puedan cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Ana is part of the loan group 3 Marías. She lives in the community that has the same name as the communal bank and belongs to the Turi parish in Cuenca. This parish is known for the beauty of its church. It is also admired since from there one can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca. Its people are kind, pleasant, determined, and hard-working. They make their living from commerce, animal breeding, and agriculture.

Ana is 63 years old. She is married and from her marriage she has conceived 6 children. Four of them are married and live independently. Her two single daughters work and help her economically. Her husband is retired and works in agriculture. The house that they live in is theirs.

Ana makes a living from agriculture, animal breeding, and sewing, which she learned working and by her ability. With these forms of work she has been able to come out ahead and provide a better future to her children.

The money from her previous loan she invested in the purchase of primary materials for her store and food for her animals. She is going to invest this new loan in the purchase of cloth, buttons, zippers, and other materials for sewing. She likes her loan group since all of the members support each other every moment so that they can complete their goals.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal stock

loans.name: Hezekiel

texts.en:
Hezekiel is a 49-year-old married man. He has eight children. He describes himself to be kind, hardworking, and successful. He operates a welding business. He has been involved in this business for three years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be market conditions. 

He will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase additional welding materials. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to move his business to bigger premises.

loans.use: to purchase additional welding materials

loans.name: Kuria

texts.en:
Kuria is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport service where he operates a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

He will use the 100,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will own many motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a vibrant area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient funds. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to own a bigger retail shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient funds. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to own a bigger retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, her business will be stable. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming tools

loans.name: Inojat

texts.ru: Иноят женщина в возрасте 45 лет, она занимается откормом скота, но кроме того она швея. У нее есть определенные клиенты , которые постоянно у нее шьют одеяла. Сейчас  усердно занимается шитьем так как от этого она получает доход постоянный чем от откорма скота, тем более она передала бизнес мужу. Из-за обстоятельств в семье и трудных времён она не смогла получить высшее образование. После школы  родители Иноят  хотели чтобы их дочь стала хорошей портнихой. У них в семье почти все девушки стали хорошими портнихами.  Она хорошо шьет и ее труд очень востребован на сегодня.    Считает, что правильный и бескорыстный труд приносит счастье в ее семью, ведь Иноят именно деньгами заработанные трудовым потом обеспечивает своих самых близких людей. У нее хорошо налажен бизнес, но на данный момент для купли тканей ей необходимы дополнительные деньги. Также ее муж как ответственный семьянин, заботливый папа и добрый муж старается, чтобы его семья не нуждались и дети выросли грамотными, но у него дела идут не так уж хорошо как раньше.     С этими намерениями Иноят обратился за кредитом В МДО "Арванд". Очень надеется на поддержку со стороны "Арванд" в дальнейшем продвижении ее бизнеса. Заранее благодарит за помощь и содействие.
texts.en: Inojat is 45 and works as a seamstress in addition to raising cattle. She sews blankets for her steady customers. She is busier now with sewing because she earns a better income from that than from raising cattle, so she handed over the cattle business to her husband. She was not able to go to university because of family circumstances and difficult times. After high school, her parents wanted her to become a good seamstress. Almost all of the women in her family are good seamstresses. She sews well and her work is in demand. She believes that good and unselfish work brings happiness to her family, because her hard work allows her to earn money to provide for those closest to her. She has a well-established business but currently does not have enough money to buy more fabric. Her husband is a responsible family man, a loving father and a caring husband who tries to provide for his family and raise intelligent children, but his business is not going as well as it had been before. Inoyat applied for a loan with MDO Arvand because of these circumstances. She hopes very much for support from Arvand so that she can keep up her business. She is grateful for the support and assistance.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Lidia Del Transito

texts.es:
La señora Lidia del Tránsito, labora como docente en un colegio al igual que en un instituto en la Ciudad de León, desempeña esta labor desde hace 38 años, inicia sus labores desde las 7:00 am a 12:00 pm en un colegio de primaria y de 01:00 pm a 05:00 pm en un instituto de secundaria con el mismo horario de Lunes a Viernes, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, ella realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Doña Lidia solicitó este crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de cerámica y cemento, los cuales serán implemento en la  mejora de su humilde vivienda permitiéndole mejorar su nivel y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lidia del Transito has worked for 38 years as a teacher in both an elementary school and a high school in the City of León. She works Monday to Friday from 7 a.m. to 12 p.m. in the elementary school and from 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. in the high school. She is a single mother with three children. She supports her family with the money she earns from her work.

Lidia is requesting this loan from CEPRODEL to buy ceramic tile and cement, which she will use to make some improvements to her humble home. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tile and cement to make some improvements to her home.

loans.name: 0503 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vinh has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing to resell.

Vinh is 54 years old, and she is married with two children. Vinh is the group leader of the 0503 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

This is Vinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Vinh has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Vinh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Vinh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to resell

loans.name: 0402 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến is 63 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Mrs. Yến has a retail business selling dry food; she has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Yến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Yến is the group leader of the 0402 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of four members.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food (salt, cooking-oil, peanuts) to sell.

With her business profit, Yến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food to sell

loans.name: Yasmin Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Yasmin Esperanza, es madre soltera de 2 hijos pequeños y se dedica al comercio desde hace 19 años, donde su negocio actual es la venta de cosméticos en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, ella inicia a ofertar el producto a su clientela desde las 06:00 am  y finalizándolas a las 05:00 pm con el mismo horario de lunes a domingo, viaja 1 vez a la semana a Managua para la compra de su producto y realiza esta labor para la mantención de sus hijos.   

Doña Yasmin Esperanza, solicito a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo para incrementar su inventario  con productos tales como: cosméticos en general, al igual que ropa para ambos sexos, así lograr mayores ventas incrementando su inventario con productos de mayor calidad lo cual le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos al igual que un  mejor  nivel de vida junto a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Yasmin Esperanza is a single mother with two small children. She has worked in sales for 19 years. Her current business is selling cosmetics in one of the markets in the city of León. She starts selling her products to her customers at 6 a.m. and works through until 5 p.m. She works this schedule Monday to Sunday, making one trip per week to Managua to buy her products. She uses the money she earns to support her children.

Yasmin Esperanza is requesting this loan from CEPRODEL to increase the size of her inventory. She will buy general cosmetics and clothing for both men and women. She hopes to increase her sales by selling higher-quality products, which will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing for both men and women for her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 52 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.

To earn a living, Yolanda has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 6,000 Philippines pesos each month doing this type of business. Yolanda has requested a loan for additional capital to buy raw foods to cook and sell.

Yolanda has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Yolanda would like to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw foods to cook and sell

loans.name: Elionora Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora. Elionora se encuentra en el grupo de crédito  Zhullin desdde  hace 2 años y medio, tiempo que le ha permitido establecer una muy buena amistad con todas las socias del grupo, vive en por los alrededores de la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es conocida como San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues, y es considerado como una ciudad patrimonio arquitectónico y cultural del Ecuador, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan porque ser gente amable y gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones. 
La Señora Elionora tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 15 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y su último hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión sastre, la casa  en donde viven es propia.
Doña Elionora tiene un bazar y papelería, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. El dinero de su crédito va hacer invertido en la compra de artículos de bazar y útiles escolares para su negocio. Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Elionora has been in the loan group Zhullin for 2 1/2 years,  time that has allowed her to established good friendships with all the members. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Azogues, also known as San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues. It’s considered a city of architectural and cultural heritage of Ecuador. The people from the city work in commercial, animal raising and agriculture. They are known for being friendly and kind, maintaining culture and tradition. 

Elionora is 41 years old, married and has 2 children; ages 15 and 5. Her eldest son is studying in high school and her youngest son is in a primary school in the city. Her husband is a tailor. They own the house they live in. 

Elionora has a variety and stationery shop. She works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule. She will use the money from the loan to purchase items for the variety shop and school supplies. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy dollar store merchandise and school supplies

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is a 37-year-old woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a tailoring business where she sews clothes. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

Debora will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase additional tailoring materials. Her business goal is to hire more staff within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring materials

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a 48-year-old married man with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer who deals in poultry selling alongside cocoa farming for extra income. He has been in business since 2008, and this has helped him to cater for his family's basic needs. He dreams of being a model poultry farmer in his area, supplying all the hotels and other people who need to buy in small quantities. Rashid complains of poultry diseases and inadequate capital for expansion. He is requesting a loan to buy chicken to sell.

Rashid is carrying his child in the photo.

loans.use: to buy chicken to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a stock of additional ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve cashflow and purchase additional clothing stock

loans.name: 0113 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Thi operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. Thi has been involved in this business for 6 years. The main hardship that Thi faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell.

Thi is 63 years old and she is married with 3 children. Thi is the group leader of the 0113 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Thi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thi has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetable to resell.

loans.name: Luis Isidro

texts.es:
El señor Luis Isidro, es padre de cinco hijos de los cuales 3 están a su cargo, desempeña la labor de encargado de un molino desde hace quince años en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León,  inicia sus labores 06:00 am  finalizando  a las 01:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a domingo,  el  realiza esta labor para el sustento de su hogar.   

Don Luis  solicito un crédito a Ceprodel el cual  utilizo para compra de bloques, cemento, hierro y la cancelación de mano de obra para la remodelación y acondicionamiento de su humilde vivienda, esto le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida al igual que el de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Isidro is the father fo five children, three of which are at his care. He has worked as the manager of a mill for fifteen years, at one of the markets in the city of Leon. He starts his workday at 6.00 am and finishes at 1.00 pm, Monday through Sunday. He does this to provide for his family.

Mr. Luis applied for a loan at Ceprodel to buy bricks, cement, iron and to hire workers to refurbish and recondition his humble home. This will improve his quality of life, as well as his childrens’.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, iron and pay for labor.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es soltera pero tiene dos hijos Rosa vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Rosa es comerciante de zapatos para dama principalmente, ella compra y vende estos articulos y necesita credito para comprar y vender una mayor cantidad de zapatos para su negocio Rosa es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Rosa is single but has two children. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house that is her property. Rosa has a business selling shoes, mainly for women. She buys and sells them and needs a loan to buy and sells a larger quantity of shoes for her business. Rosa is the only source of income for her house so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her cereal business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 25 years old and married. She was gifted with three children and they live happily in a rural community. Despite the hardship of living, they have the determination to uplift their living status. Agnes runs a small variety store while her husband cultivates their farmland. She wants to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' demand but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to obtain a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more stocks of frozen foods, pork, fish, cull and grocery items to sell. Through this financial assistance, Agnes believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods, pork, fish, cull and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en: Elda is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, rice and other food products. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock. She hopes that, in the future, her family will have an improved standard of living. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  She will use the anticipated profits from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Camino A La Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Camino a la Esperanza está formado por 7 socias quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Santa Ana en Cuenca, esta parroquia goza de un clima frió, se encentra rodeada de mucha vegetación y verdes campos, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo, su gente al igual que las socias son personas de un gran corazón quienes dedican a trabajar duro para mejorar la economía de sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos mayores de edad, cuatro de ellos ya son casados y viven independientes, sus tres hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, su esposo se dedica a la construcción, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María pasa en casa donde se dedica al trabajo que heredo de sus padres el mismo que es la crianza de animales y la agricultura, los animales que cría son borregos, cerdos y cuyes, la agricultura es para el consumo de la casa y si existe un sobrante lo vende. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de cerdos y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es  tener más animales y crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
The loan group Camino a la Esperanza (Road to Hope) is formed by 7 members who live on the outskirts of Santa Ana Parish in Cuenca. This parish enjoys cold weather, surrounded by a lot of vegetation and green fields. Its architecture is a mixture of modern and old. The people, like the members, have big hearts and work hard to improve their household earnings and to come out ahead.

One of the members of this group is Maria. Maria is 60 years old, married and has 7 adult children; 4 are married and live with their families, 3 are single and work and help her financially. Her husband works in construction. She owns the house where she lives.

Maria works from home, work she inherited from her parents; raising animals and agriculture. The animals she raises are sheep, pigs and guinea pigs. The farming is for personal consumption but if there is excess they sell it. 

The loan is for the purchase of pigs and animal feed. Her goal is to have more animals and grow in this business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 58 years old, a widow, and lives in Olingan, Dipolog City. In order to support the family, she operates a sari-sari store. In 2011 she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with a good credit standing. 

She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase an additional inventory of goods (canned goods, milk, shampoo and oil) for her sari-sari store. 

Melchora smiles at the thought of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for an additional inventory of canned goods, milk, shampoo and oil to sell

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 33-year-old married woman. She has a child who is 8 years old. She describes herself to be business oriented. 

She operates a butchery where she sells poultry products. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an urban area, and she describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

Tabitha will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock. 

Her business goal is to open additional branches within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business which sustains her family's needs. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her butcher shop

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
Sangke district, located in Battambang province, is the home of San and her family. She is a 61-year-old widow who has nine children; three of them are living dependent on her. She struggles to earn a living for the family by crop farming. 

Han has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for three cycles already and she has repaid the past loans completely. The  loans allowed her to improve the situation of her family. Now, Han leads a group of three members to request a microloan of 3,000,000 KHR which she owns a portion of 1,400,000 KHR. She plans to use the loan to buy crop seed and pay the land-plowing fee.
