She hopes that the loan enables her to successfully expand her business.

loans.use: To buy crop seed and pay the land-plowing fee

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: Phalla is residing in Sangke district located in Battambang province. She is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. Currently, four of her children are living dependent on her. As a farmer who plants crops to earn a living for the family, Phalla also earns extra money from a fishery. On average, she can earn income of 23,900 KHR per day. Phalla is the leader of a group of two members and both of them have been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for seven cycles already with successful repayment. Now, as a group leader, she is applying for a loan of 2,800,000 KHR of which half of it belongs to Phalla’s portion. She plans to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay a land plowing fee. Also, she will use another portion to buy a fishing net. She believes that the loan will allow her to successfully expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay a land plowing fee.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Touch is a resident of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province. She is a 54-year-old married woman and also a mother of three dependent children. In order to earn a living to support her family, she has engaged in a crop farming agribusiness for about thirty years already. Touch is the leader of a group of three members. This is the second cycle for all of them and they have successfully repaid the past loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. They are requesting a loan of 3,600,000 KHR which will be divided in equal shares of 1,200,000 KHR each. Touch will use the loan to buy fertilizer, crop seed and gasoline. She strongly hopes that the yield will increase and she can earn a higher income to support the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, crop seed and gasoline.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 34-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 16 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells cooking equipment. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial problems. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase additional stock. He hopes that, in the future, his business will be bigger and better. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Yanett Rosalina

texts.es: Yanett, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Petoa, Santa Bárbara. Ella siempre ha buscado como generar sus ingresos, hace 4 años inició su negocio de vender ropa y calzado, vende blusas, camisas, pantalones, faldas, sandalias y zapatos. Estos productos los vende en el mercado en forma Ambulante. Lleva 8 ciclos de préstamo con el actual que es por 25,000 Lempiras, con este préstamo va comprar ropa y zapatos de mejor calidad para vender. Su plan es seguir trabajando con su negocio y tener estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Yanett is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She lives in the town of Petoa, Santa Bárbara. She has always been looking for a way to make money. She started her business 4 years ago, selling clothes and shoes. She sells blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, sandals and shoes. She sells these products as an itinerant vendor at the market.

This will be her 8th loan. This new loan is for 25,000 Lempiras. She will use it to buy better quality clothing and shoes to sell. Her plan is to continue working at her business and to achieve financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra is a resident of Kang Meas district, located in the Kampong Cham province. She is a 41-year-old married woman who has four dependent children. She is also a farmer who has a crop farm to earn a living for the family. She has engaged in agribusiness for about 18 years already. 

She has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles already, and has successfully repaid the past loan. The loan has allowed her to improve the living conditions of her family. 

Now she leads a group of two borrowers to request a loan of 2,800,000 KHR which provides an equal share of 1,4000,000 KHR each. As a group leader, Ra plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. 

She hopes that the crop yield will increase and provide her a higher income so that she can afford to buy pigs to raise to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Oul's Group

texts.en: Oul is a resident of Kang Meas district located in Kampong Cham province. She is 33 years old and married with three dependent children. She has struggled to make a living by doing paddy rice farming for about 12 years already. She also works as a construction worker to earn extra income. Oul is the leader of a group of two members. She and her partner request a loan of 2,500,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR will be Oul’s portion. Oul plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline and to pay a labor fee. She believes that the yield will increase and she will get a higher income so that she can afford to buy a motor-bike to transport people for a fee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline and to pay a labor fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Kang Meas district of Kampong Cham province is a home to Mom and her family. She is a 34-year-old married woman and also a mother of four dependent children. Two of her children are currently going to school and the other two are under school-age. Mom has engaged in paddy rice farming for 16 years. She also works as a construction worker to earn extra income for the family. She leads a group of four members requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The entire group request is for a loan of 2,200,000 KHR of which Mom owns a portion of 600,000 KHR. Mom plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. She hopes that the crop yield will increase and she can earn a higher income so that she can afford to buy pigs to raise to sell.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Kamdou Veng Group

texts.en:
Initiated by Niengneiting, with raised hand, Kamdou Veng is a 17-member group. The group belongs to the tribe residing in a small town in the state of Manipur, which is in the northeastern part of India. 

Niengneiting is a mother to a son and three daughters. She lives with her parent-in-law and her husband. Her husband, Henminlen, is a passenger auto driver by profession. He drives in and around the town. Two of her children are in beginner’s level and the oldest one in primary level. Her husband earns around 400-500 INR per day. The family's income is very scarce. Her husband’s business could never be of much significance in terms of profit calculation.  

As they could not manage the family’s expenditure with just the meager income of her husband Niengneiting took the initiative to generate income by weaving traditional shawls and wrap-around skirts for ladies. Niengneiting said, “I have never had the chance to complete my higher education because my parents were too poor. Thanks to my mother, who taught me how to weave, today I can at least provide food and clothing to my new family through weaving. Every day before I sleep, I pray for my mother’s blessing so that I may weave enough to support my children to complete their higher education.”

She has been weaving using the back strap, which in the long run causes back problems. 

For the improvement of her business and her children’s study, Niengneiting wants to avail a loan amounting to 12173 INR for a 45-watt solar light. Niengneiting says many villages where solar lights are installed see an increase in their economic activity levels. Installing solar lights in villages allows businesses to operate during the evening and night time. Therefore she believes that solar electricity will helps promote her enterprise as she can use the system to provide lighting to operate during the evening and night. 

Like her, the rest of the group members also need solar home lighting for their respective income-generating activities and household use. Their main activities are weaving, variety shop, grocery store and the like.

loans.use: To buy a 45-watt solar home lighting system.

loans.name: Salai

texts.en:
Salai is a 44-year-old single woman with three children. She has a small lawn mowing business to earn a living. She has five years with this business. 

Salai needs a loan to buy a new lawn mower, spark plugs, a new pulling cord, new overalls, and new gum boots. She will use her profits to pay for her children's education. Salai joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new lawn mower, spark plugs, a new pulling cord, new overalls, and new gum boots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tires, a new taxi sign, windshield wipers, a new gear box and seat covers

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Najma is aged in her thirties and has  two boys and one girl who are in school. She is married and for a year now, she has supported her family by running a beauty salon. She performs service from 08:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her second loan request. She used the previous loan which paid back in full to buy hair products and madila (Muslin type of dresses) to resell to her salon's customers. Najma received profit which she used to pay part of her home food expense and school fees. She dreams to become a successful woman. 

Najma will use this loan to buy salon hair products and madila to resell. She will share this loan with her loan group,Ulezi “which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon hair products and madila dresses to resell.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca es casada, tiene 68 años y 4 hijos Rebeca vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento  que es de su propiedad Rebeca es jubilada y recibe una renta Rebeca necesita el credito para apoyar a su hija con el tramite de un titulo en provisión nacional El esposo de Rebeca tambien recibe una renta pero lo que ganan no alcanza y por eso Rebeca necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Rebeca is 68 years old, married and has 4 children. Rebeca lives in La Paz in a cement and brick house which is her property. Rebeca is retired and receives a pension. Rebeca needs a loan to support her daughter with the process of obtaining her National Diploma. Rebeca's husband recently got a pension but what he gets is not enough to pay for the degree, so Rebeca needs to get a loan.

loans.use: to support her daughter with the process of getting her degree.

loans.name: Mijgonai

texts.ru:
Мичгонаи молодая жительница района Хуросон. Ей 23 года. Она уже разведена. Ее семейная жизнь неудачно сложилась, но благодаря поддержке родителей она быстро справилась с депрессией, охватившей ее после развода с мужем. 
Сейчас Мичгонаи живет у родителей. Ее отец шофер, а мать швея. Мичгонаи сама продолжает свой животноводческий бизнес уже 5 лет. Она в основном разводит бычков мясной породы. Ей помогают все члены семьи -  родители и сестра. Мичгонаи обратилась за кредитом, чтобы расширить деятельность. Она собирается закупить несколько бычков для дальнейшего откорма и продажи. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Mijgonai is a young resident of Khuroson. She is 23. She is already divorced. Her family life was unfortunate, but thanks her parents' support,she coped with the depression that gripped her after her divorce. 

Mijgonai now lives with her parents. Her father is a driver and her mother is a seamstress. Mijgonai has been working in the livestock business for five years. She primarily breeds cattle for meat. Her entire family--her parents and her sister--help her. Mijgonai has requested a loan to expand her business. She is going to buy a few calves to fatten and sell. She is hoping for financial support.

loans.use: buy a few calves to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, age 38, lives with her brother in a village on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2000 and has two daughters who attend school. 

Sophal is a construction worker along with her husband. And, she is now in the process of building a new house to stay in (shown in photo). She needs money to make finishes. Hence she decided to apply for a loan!

loans.use: to finish her house building.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотиме 46 лет. Она живет с тремя дочерьми в одном из предгорных селений района Хуросон. Муж и сын находятся на заработках в загранице. Фотима и ее дочери занимаются выращиванием молодых бычков и телят. Этой деятельностью они занимаются уже 5 лет. Фотима хочет поднять финансовое положение семьи. Для этого ей необходимо увеличить поголовье своих телят, чтобы получить больше прибыли от деятельности. Однако препятствием для реализации данной цели является нехватка финансов. Фотима просит кредит, чтобы купить пару телят. Она надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en: Fotima is 46 years old. She lives with her three daughters in a village in the foothills of Khuroson. Her husband and son are working abroad. Fotima and her daughter raise young bulls and calves. They have been doing this work for five years. Fotima wants to improve the family's financial situation. To do this, she needs to increase the number of calves to increase profit. However, she does not have enough money. Fotima is requesting a loan to buy a pair of calves. She is looking forward to your response.

loans.use: buy calves

loans.name: Müge

texts.en:
Müge is divorced and lives with her children, who are 12 and 15. She works at a private company and at the same time, so as to have some extra income, she buys herbs and spices and resells them to her friends and people in her circle. She buys the spices wholesale and then packages and sells them to order. She has been doing this for the past year in order to increase her income.  

With the loan from Maya, Müge will be able to buy spices in bulk. She can says she can make a bigger profit by purchasing the spices in bulk. In the future, she wants to open her own store, selling herbs and natural products. She believes that by earning more income, she will be able to provide a better life for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Müge Hanım eşinden boşanmış on beş ve on iki yaşında iki çocuğu ile yaşıyor.  Özel bir şirkette çalışıyor ve aynı zamanda ek gelir elde edebilmek için çeşitli baharatlar alıp ,çevresine ve arkadaşlarına satıyor.  Baharatlarını toptan alıp isteğe göre kendi paketleyip satıyor.  Bir yıldır bu şekilde kendisine ek gelir sağlıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile toplu şekilde baharat alacak.  Toplu alımlarda daha çok kar elde ettiğini söylüyor.  İleride kendi işini yapmak baharat ve doğal ürünler satacağı bir dükkanı olsun istiyor.  Daha iyi bir gelir elde ettiğinde çocuklarına daha iyi yaşam koşulları sağlayacağını düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy spices in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries for her shop and to buy a multifunction printer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring materials

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en:
Aynur is divorced and lives with her daughter. She has been making and selling jewelry for a decade. For the last five years, she has been selling her merchandise from a stall on the waterfront. Her personal interest in beading and jewelry is what inspired her to get into this business. At first, she started out making jewelry for herself and her daughter as a hobby. Later, she attended various courses and developed her craft. After she retired, she decided to start selling her pieces for some extra income. Aynur continues to sell her own handmade pieces at her stall on the waterfront, which is open eight months a year. Doing this work makes her very happy. Her goal is to enter international jewelry fairs to show her pieces there and to become a brand. With the loan from Maya, Aynur intends to buy beads so that she can expand the range of jewelry pieces she offers. She believes that by expanding her range of products, she will sell more and thereby increase her income this summer. Her greatest wish is for her university-educated daughter to find a job.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Aynur Hanım eşinden boşanmış ve kızı ile birlik de yaşıyor.  On senedir takı yapıp satıyor.  Beş  yıldır sahilde tezgahta satışını gerçekleştiriyor.  Kendisinin  boncuklara ve takıya olan merakı bu işe yönlenmesini sağlamış.  İlk önceleri hobi olarak başlamış ,kendisine ve kızına takılar yapmış.  Daha sonraları çeşitli kurslara giderek bu işi iletmiş.  Emekli olunca ek gelir olsun diye yapıp satmaya başlamış.
Hala Dsahilde tezgahı var ve sekiz ay açık olan tezgahta  kendi el emeği olan takılarını satıyor.  Bu işi yapmak onu çok mutlu ediyor.  Hedefi  uluslar arası fuarlara katılmak.Burada ürünlerini sergilemek.Marka olmak istiyor.  Almış olduğu kredi ile çeşitli boncuklar alıp takı çeşidini arttırmak.  Daha çok çeşit ürünle  daha çok satış yapacağını buna paralel gelirinin bu yaz daha da artacağına inanıyor.  Üniversite mezunu kızının iş bulabilmesi en büyük arzusu.

loans.use: to buy beads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Malick

texts.en:
Malick is a 39-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a grain mill. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a vibrant area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be access to capital. 

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy maize. His business goal is to own another mill within five years.

loans.use: to purchase maize to grind in his mill

loans.name: Soeub

texts.en:
Soeub is a resident of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She is a 51-year-old married woman, and also a mother of six children. She has struggled to make a living by doing crop farm for about 30 years. She earns extra income to support the family by raising pigs to sell. 

This is the first time that Soeub is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She requests a new loan of in order to pay for her child's vocational training fee. 

She optimistically believes that her child will finish the course and be able to earn a living with the skill.

loans.use: to pay her child's vocational training fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: B.vengnom Group

texts.en:
These hard-working tribal women joined hands to support themselves through loans facilities. They live in the outskirt town of Churachandpur, Manipur, which is located in the northeastern part of India. Nenglam, pictured with a raised hand, is the featured profile member. She is 38 years old and is still single. She has six younger siblings, and all of them are married. She takes care of her mother and younger brother’s family and lives with them since her father abandoned her mother for another woman. Due to health complications, her brother does not work; only she and her sister-in-law earn and support the family.
  
In spite of her difficulties, she is determined and happy that she could at least sustain the family and send her niece and nephews to school. Nenglam’s source of income is brewing local wine and selling it for a profit. In order to supplement her income, every night before going to bed, she weaves clothes to sell. She is thankful to her sister-in-law for helping her in the weaving business. With the income she gets from the business, she pays her brother’s children's school fees and manages the household expenditures.

 Nenglam wants to avail a loan to buy mini solar home lighting of 45 watts for 1,2173 INR to be install in her house so that she can extend her business hours in the evening and night. It is very difficult to weave at night without proper lighting. She believes that this solar home light will make a great impact in her business. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members requested a solar loan to improve upon their respective income-generating activities, which also include weaving, variety store and agriculture.

loans.use: To buy a mini solar home lighting system to weave longer hours at night.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is residing in Kang Meas district located in Kampong Cham province. She is a 32 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are living dependent on her. 

Her main income source comes from a coconut selling business. She also earns extra income to support the family from the crop farm. 

This is the fourth cycle loan for Srey and other two group members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The whole group requests a loan of 4,200,000 KHR, which will contribute an equal share of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Srey plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. She strongly believes that the yield of crops will increase and she will get a higher income so that she can afford to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Channon

texts.en:
Channon, age 22, is single and lives with her sister and widower father in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

She is a garment factory worker. She wants to put an addition on her house so it would be larger and better for her family to live. 
Hence Channon decided to apply for a loan. She hopes the lenders will help her!

loans.use: To put an addition on her house.

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Soeung (in photo), age 33, lives in a village on an Island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2005 and just has one daughter. 
Soeung is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a mechanic. She requests a loan in order to buy a motorbike for commuting because her motorbike was stolen.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Tamalinda Group

texts.en:
Bahati, who was born in the 1970's, is married and has got two daughters who are in school. She has been running a beauty salon for five years now. She is open from 9 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is her second loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. Bahati used the previous loan to buy hair products. She covered paying back successfully her previous loan. With the profit earned, Bahati covered school fees and home food expenses. She believe that her salon with grow and generate high returns so as to improve her family. She dreams of opening another successful business. Bahati will use this loan request to buy salon hair products. 
She will share this loan with her loan group"TAMALINDA" which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon hair products.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana de 39 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, honesta y humilde, con gran esfuerzo hace 10 años empezó a trabajar en la agricultura sembrando maíz y frijol, hoy ha tenido buenos resultados ya que obtiene una buena cosecha que comercializa en los alrededores de la zona, posee mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y lo vende a buen precio, Ana vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, ella esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar los insumos necesarios para la siembra como lo son: abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. y también mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder seguir con sus siembras y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old. She is hard-working, responsible, humble and honest. With great effort 10 years ago she started to work in agriculture growing corn and beans. Today she enjoys good results as she produces a good harvest which she sell around her area. She has a lot of clients as her product is of high quality and she sells at a good price. Ana lives with her family in her own house.

She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy the inputs she needs for her crops like manure, fertilizer, herbicides, pest control, etc. Plus she wants to make improvements to her land which is shown in the photo. Then she can continue with her crops and provide her family with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicides, pest control, etc and to improve her land.

loans.name: Baara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Baara est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 44ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de,  friperies, fruits, savons et du charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Coumba (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des habits (friperies) de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperie en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Coumba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Baara Group is made up of married women who live with their husbands and children in traditional families. Their average age is 44 years old, and they have on average four children each. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the commune of Mandé, Kati Cercle. They know each other because they are related to each other, or because they are neighbors or friends. They work buying and selling products such as second-hand clothing, fruit, soap and charcoal.

The members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to increase their working capital. This is their first group loan.

Coumba (the second woman from the right in the photograph) is well known for selling all kinds of second-hand clothing. She plans to use the loan to buy two bales of second-hand clothing wholesale in Médine. She will then resell the clothing retail in Kanadjiguila as well as by traveling from place to place. Most of her customers are women. Coumba expects to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 XOF, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to pay for some of the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy two bales of a variety of second-hand clothing to resell.

loans.name: Elianne

texts.en:
Elianne is a 29-year-old mother of two, who has been working from her house as a beauty specialist since 2011, to support her beloved husband in covering their family's needs and expenses.

She used to work as a nurse, but her children need a lot of care and she has to stay next to them. For this reason, she attended a technical school and got the required techniques and started her own business after three years of training to acquire special talents in this domain until she found herself three years ago capable of running her own business.

Today, Elianne is working hard to develop her business more, through an acquired YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, which she will invest in increasing her business merchandise with special released beauty cosmetics and facial products to develop her business and attract more customers.

She hopes that one day she can afford to open her own separate beauty salon when she finds that her children are grown up enough to handle their own needs.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special released beauty cosmetics and facial products to develop her business and attract more customers

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 11 years to 15 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a chemist where she sells health products. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of adequate finances. She will use the Kes. 50,000 loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to have a stable business able to serve the growing population in the area within five years. She hopes that, in the future, her business will be able to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to add to stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom, 57, lives in a remote area of Prasat Bakong District of Siem Reap Province. She has one married child and one unmarried child.To support the family; she grows many kinds of vegetables to sell at the small market in her village. Her husband is a fisher man in the lake near the house. This family is able to make USD 4 a day. 

Sreymom is borrowing her fourth loan from KIVA to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sreymom hopes that it will help improve her family’s living condition, maintaining a good health and environment

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a married woman from Pontevedra, Capiz, Philippines. Capiz province was one of the areas affected when typhoon Haiyan hit last November, 2013. Cynthia’s business was also affected but, after few months, she started to recover and her business is continuously growing. She is 56 years old and she is married to Renato who helps her in their business. They have children, one of which finished studying already.

Cynthia has a rice field. Capiz is known for growing rice and it is one of the areas in the Philippines where there are lots of rice fields and farmers.  She and her husband operate the farm and they also sell rice.  She earns a minimum of Php. 800 in sales daily.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php. 30, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm.

Cynthia dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Maria Isidra

texts.en:
Maria Isidra is a very hard-working entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. She is 40 years old and together with her husband, Donald, she manages their dried fish business. Her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

She buys different kinds of dried fish from her suppliers, then sells it in the market. Her store is located in a temporary fish market.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP1,000 in sales every day. Aside from dried fish, she also makes "ice scrumble" and sells it to students since their place is just nearby a public school. She is also in a direct-selling business.

Maria Isidra is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to purchase more food to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she hopes to expand soon. Maria Isidra also dreams about having a child, God willing.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of different varieties of dried fish

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly is living in Srey Snom district located in Siem Reap province. She is a 35-year-old married woman who has four dependent children. 

She is also a farmer who makes a living by planting cassava. She has engaged in this agribusiness for about seventeen years already. The average income for her family is only 13,900 KHR per day which is barely enough to support a family of four children. 

Ly has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for one cycle already and she has successfully repaid the past loan. It has enabled her to improve living conditions. Now, she leads a group of three members to apply for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR which contribute to an equal share of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for land plowing fee. She believes that she will be able to increase the yield of her cash crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the land plowing fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Yeny Sarai

texts.es:
Yeny de 24 años de edad, es una persona laboriosa, con muy buen talento en la cosmetologia, donde ella vive la reconocen por los diferentes peinados y tratamientos que le hacen a ambos sexos, ella tiene un centro de estilismo y cosmetologia, Sus estudios obtenidos fueron en un centro escolar de la localidad, estudiando  bachiller general. Ella es casada y  él se dedica  a la agricultura.  Esta familia todos los días se levantan muy temprano a trabajar,ella se encamina hacia su trabajo desde muy temprano, y su esposo se va hacia al campo a cultivar la tierra,es a si como cada día esta familia desarrolla largas faenas para un futuro mejor.


Yeny aprendió este oficio hace 6 años, esto lo aprendió cuando ella no tenia dinero para estudiar una carrera muy larga por eso opto por estudiar cosmetologia y estilismo,  así  fue adquiriendo muchos conocimientos en esta área. 


El préstamo que esta soliictando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar tintes, shampoo, acondiacionador, cremas, maquillaje, etc. sera  utilizado en la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio familiar que es pequeño salón de belleza, el cual les permite sobrevivir y llevar el sustento a su familia.
     

Yeny  planea a futuro tener otro local, mejorar este negocio con mas productos innovadores y  poder tener mejores ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Yeny is 24 years old. She is a hard worker with talent in the field of cosmetology. She is known for her various haircuts and treatments where she lives that she does for either sex. She has a styling and cosmetology center. She received her studies at a local school getting her general diploma.

She is married and her husband works in agriculture. This family gets up very early every day to work. She walks to her work very early and her husband goes off to work in the fields. So the family does a lot of work each day in order to have a better future.

Yeny learned this trade 6 years ago. She learned at a time when she didn't have the money to take a long course. So she opted for cosmetology and she gained lots of experience in this field. The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy dyes, shampoo, conditioners, creams, make-up, etc. It will be used to buy merchandise to stock her family business which is her small beauty salon. This will allow her to live and support her family. Yeny's plans for the future are to open another shop, improve her business with more innovative products and to have more income for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, conditioners, creams, make-up, etc.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz, age 37, is a married woman. She has four children. She is keen to provide her family with a good standard of living. 

To support her husband financially, she started a business selling animals. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Sola's Group

texts.en:
Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province is the home of Sola and her family of one little child. Sola is a 21-year-old married woman. She is also a farmer who struggles to make a living by paddy rice cropping. The agribusiness makes an income of only 23,900 KHR per day. 

Sola is the leader of a group of two members and this is the first cycle for both of them. She and the other member request a loan of 1,300,000 KHR, of which Sola owns a portion of 1,000,000 KHR. Sola plans to use the loan to pay the land plowing fee and to buy fertilizer. 

She hopes that the loan will pave a way for her to earn a higher income to support her family.

loans.use: to pay the land plowing fee and to buy fertilizer

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход добропорядочный, целеустремленный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 37 лет. Фарход женат и имеет 2 детей . Фарход живет в сельской местности и имеет свой небольшой бизнес. Фарход решил обустроить свой дом и поставить пластиковые окна и паровое отопление. Доход который Фарход получает от своего бизнеса недостаточен для того, чтоб обустроить дом и поэтому он обратился в нашу организацию для поддержки, так как мы предоставляем кредиты которые не влияют негативно на экологию и помогаем сельским жителям. Фарход заранее благодарен "Кива"  за предоставленную помощь в улучшении условий жизни населения.
texts.en: Farhod is a respectable, purposeful and responsible 37-year-old man. Farhod is married and has two children. Farhod lives in the countryside and has his own small business. Farhod decided to build himself a house and install plastic windows and steam heating. Farhod's income from his business is not enough to finish the house. He turned to our organization for support, since we offer loans that do not impact negatively on the environment and help the villagers. Farhod thanks Kiva in advance for help improving the standard of living of the population.

loans.use: buy and install plastic windows.

loans.name: Sambour's Group

texts.en:
Sambour is living in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is a 27-year-old married woman and also a mother of two dependent children. 

In order to earn a living for the family, she has engaged in paddy rice farming for about 10 years already. She also earns extra income from her corn farm. The average income for the whole family is about 20,800 KHR per day. 

In a group of two members, this is the second cycle for both of them to request loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The total requested loan amount is 2,200,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is requested by Sambour. 

She plans to use the loan to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide and to pay the land plowing fee. She hopes that the yield from her crops will increase so that she will be able to uplift the family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide and to pay the  land plowing fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help and maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Kafiya

texts.en:
Kafiya has successfully built her business selling “gol gappy,” which is a dish consisting of a round, hollow puri fried crisp and filled with a mixture of flavored water ("pani"), chili, potato, onion and chickpeas. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her eighth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase stock of flour, chickpeas and spices. This will enable her to increase her sales and gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase stock of flour, chickpeas and spices.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Chhoeun (in photo) is 31 years old, lives in a village across the Mekong twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three daughters; two attend school and another one is still young. 
Chhoeun is a silk weaver, while her husband is a construction worker. She asked for a loan to add to her own money to buy a motorbike for her husband for commuting, because her husband commutes by bicycle. Bicycling is not timely and tiring.

loans.use: to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for her husband for commuting.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 25 años de edad vive junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia , ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 5 años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener siempre las mejores cosechas, el terreno está en un lugar accesible, apto para el cultivo y con suelo fértil, todo lo que produce lo comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles, ella es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora, esta solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía,la clienta tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: This borrower is 25 years old and lives with her family in a house that she owns. The borrower makes a living growing corn and beans. She has been working in farming for five years, and has gained a lot of valuable experience. This allows the borrower to gain the best harvests. The borrower's land is in an accessible area, apt for farming and with fertile land. Everything grown on the land is sold around the community. The borrower has many customers as people know that what she sells is of top quality and sold at affordable prices. The borrower is very responsible and hard-working. She is applying for a loan from "Apoyo Integral". This loan will allow the borrower to buy seeds, weed-killer, manure, tools and more, and to improve her land (shown in the photograph). This borrower has good credit references; she assures us that she can pay off this debt and, at the same time, offer her family a great life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, weed-killer, manure, tools and more, and to improve her land.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Balimaya est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 47ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé/cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font  le petit commerce de, condiments (aubergines, choux et tomates). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sabou (femme assise à l’extrême droite  sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (aubergines, choux et tomates). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs d’aubergines, 3 corbeilles de tomates et 3 sacs de choux en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sabou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Balimaya Group is made up of married women who live with their husbands and children in traditional families.  They are, on average, 47 years old and have eight children.  They all live in Kanadjiguila, Mandé commune, Kati county, and know one another through family, neighbourhood and friendship connections.  They sell food ingredients (aubergines, cabbages and tomatoes).

As the women all want to increase their working capital, the group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their second group loan.

Sabou (sitting on the far right in the photo) is well-known for selling food (aubergines, cabbages and tomatoes).  She plans to use her loan to buy three sacks of aubergines, three baskets of tomatoes and three sacks of cabbages, from wholesalers in Médine.  She will then retail the produce in Kanadjiguila, mainly to women.

Sabou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used to provide for some of the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 37 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos.
Desde muy joven se inquietó por el estudio y por el ánimo y las ganas de prosperar, creció junto a sus 2 hermanos menores a quienes aprecia mucho y quiere que ellos tengan un futuro prospero.
Juan culminó sus estudios secundarios, optó por una beca dentro de un instituto de enseñanza superior y 3 años después se graduó como técnico en kardex, con eso satisface las demandas de su hogar y sus hermanos, Juan no se quedó ahí con el apoyo de sus familiares logró ingresar a la universidad publica y estudiar la carrera de derecho ahora se encuentra terminando su licenciatura y con muchos ánimos de seguir adelante.
Juan estudia y trabaja, el dinero no le alcanza para mantener a su familia y hacer estudiar a sus hermanos, en este momento sueña con terminar su carrera y comprarle una casa a su madre a la que tanto quiere.
Es por esos motivos que Juan solicita un préstamo para la compra de una laptop para realizar sus trabajos y  terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juan is a 37 year old man, single and with no children.
He has been interested in studying from a very young age. He grew up with 2 younger brothers who he appreciates a lot, and he wants them to have a prosperous future.
Juan completed his secondary education, obtained a scholarship in a higher education school and three years later graduated as a technician in inventory systems. With his degree, he is able to cover his household expenses and help his brothers.

Juan didn’t stop here. With the help of his family he managed to enroll in a public university and study a law degree. Now he is finishing his degree and has a lot of energy to keep going.

Juan works and studies. The money he is making is not enough to support his family and keep his brothers in school. He dreams of graduating and buying a house for her mother, whom he loves very much.

This is why Juan is applying for a loan to buy a laptop so he can do his schoolwork and finish his degree.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to do his schoolwork.

loans.name: Rosalin Marlene

texts.es:
Rosalín es una mujer de 33 años de edad soltera y cargo de sus dos hijos de un año y el otro de dos.
Ella vive de la cocina, toda la vida se la dedico a preparar comida primero como ayudante de su madre y más adelante se independizó siguiendo el mismo oficio, Rosalín logró concluir sus estudios secundarios y accedió a estudios a nivel técnico sobre el arte culinario. Ahora ella tiene un emprendimiento parra lograr cumplir su sueño de tener su propio restaurante, pero para eso necesita un horno y capital de trabajo, ella desea sacar a sus hijos adelante, planea poner un negocio de comida para llevar utilizando los servicios de sus hermanos y familiares como ayudantes “pienso que vende comida para llevar es menos costoso porque no tengo un lugar i el capital para alquilar un restaurante” también comenta que sus hijos son pequeños y  necesita estar en contacto con ellos de manera continua. Ella tiene toda la confianza de que su negocio será un éxito y con esa  utilidad  podrá hacer estudiar a sus hijos, es por el futuro de sus niños que Rosalin solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno y capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosalín is a 33-year-old woman, she is single and raises her two children who are one and two years old.

She makes a living from cooking. For all her life she has worked preparing food, first as an assistant to her mother and later she became independent in the same trade. Rosalín finished secondary school and started to study culinary arts. Now, she has a trade to fulfill her dream of having her own restaurant, but for this she needs an oven and working capital.
 
Rosalín wants to get her children ahead. Her plan is to sell takeaway food and to ask her siblings and other family members to help. “I think that selling takeaway food is less costly, because I do not have premises or the money to rent a restaurant”, she says. She also says that her children are small and she needs to be with them all the time.

She is convinced that her business will be a big success and with this she will be able to send her children to school. For this reason – the future of her children – Rosalín is asking for a loan to buy an oven and to have working capital.

loans.use: to buy an oven and to have working capital.

loans.name: 0504 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Khánh is 30 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

She operates a food stall/restaurant selling noodles. She has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Khánh is requesting a loan to purchase more food to cook noodles to sell. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 0504 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

With her business profit, Khánh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook noodles to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 21 years old and married. She owns and manages a small retail store within the local community. She and her husband aspire to become successful and financially stable in the future. To attain their goal, Joy wants to improve her store in order to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to  buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings and laundry soaps to sell. Having this financial assistance, Joy believes that she will improve more of her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings and laundry soaps to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 35-year-old woman. She describes herself as focused and business-minded. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a market and her primary customers are commuters and market goers. She describes her biggest business challenges as inflation and weather conditions. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to own her own boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open additional businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing stock.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells timber. He has been involved in this business for 50 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are from the urban area. He says that his biggest business challenge is dealing with policies which affect timber production. 

Joshua will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of timber. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his twelfth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the roof of her home and improve security their.

loans.name: Maria Vianney

texts.es: Vianney es una joven de 25 años de edad, la cual tiene su primaria cursada de forma completa muy agradecida por el apoyo que sus padres le brindaron para que ella pudiere estudiar. Ella es casada y tiene una hija la cual esta pequeña y estudia en la escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo actualmente reside en los EE.UU. el cual le ayuda con remesas para poder salir adelante ya que es ella la encargada de cuidar sus cultivos de café como fuente secundaria de ingresos. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a esta actividad la cual aprendió de sus padres pues sus ingresos dependen de este rubro. La tierra que ella trabaja una parte la ha adquirido con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio y la otra gracias a la voluntad de sus padres la cual está ubicada a 3 kilómetros de distancia desde su casa de habitacion a la cual se traslada caminando en compañía de sus hermanos y primos para dar el mantenimiento a los mismos. Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de insumos (Abono y Foliares) entre otros para asistir sus cultivos de café para que el final de la temporada pueda obtener una buena cosecha. Sus planes y metas adquirir un pedazo más de tierra para poder seguir ampliando su plantación, esforzarse para seguir fortaleciendo su patrimonio y que su esposo pueda regresarse para honduras de nuevo para estar en familia.
texts.en:
Vianney is 25 years old, who finished primary education thanks to the support she was given by her parents to study. She is married and has a young daughter who studies in the local school. Her husband currently lives in the US, and helps by sending her money to move forwards, as she is responsible for looking after her coffee crops as a secondary source of income. 

She has made a living in this business for 7 years, which she learned from her parents, and her earnings depend on it. She has acquired part of the land she farms on with a great deal of effort and sacrifice, and the other part thanks to the help of her parents. This second plot is located 3 kilometres from her home, and she gets there by walking with her siblings and cousins, to maintain the crops.

She is currently requesting a loan to look after her coffee plants through buying inputs (compost and foliar applications) among other things to help her coffee crops so that she achieves a good harvest at the end of the season. 

Her plans and goals include buying another plot of land to continue expanding her crop, and to work hard to keep strengthening her heritage, and so that  her husband can return to Honduras to be together as a family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Muhoi

texts.en:
Smallholder farmers from Murang’a own approximately 2.5 acres per household on average. However, these farms are no longer competitive. Muhoi, a father of 4, came to this realization and began a proactive process to address charting a new course for his farm’s operation.
He mobilized farmers and formed a group that later joined Juhudi Kilimo. Juhudi transforms smallholder farmers’ lives by financing income-generating agricultural assets. Furthermore, farmers get a two-month training to ensure these assets are used in the most productive way. 
Muhoi has been a farmer for seven years now. He has been making a living selling milk and tea produced on his farm. He uses his motorcycle to transport milk and farm produce and to also offer transportation services to other farmers in order to make extra income. 
Muhoi is seeking a loan to purchase poultry, a chaff cutter and a water tank. The purchase of these assets is aligned to the business plan he has to make the most of his farm and act as an example to others.
He is diversifying into poultry to spread the risk and increase income. The chaff cutter will chop fodder into a small, easily-digestible form for the dairy cow. The water tank will help in rain-water harvesting, water conservation and storage in anticipation for drought.
With your lending, Muhoi projects he will generate enough income to comfortably repay the loan after which he will direct the income to his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase poultry, a chaff cutter and a water tank

loans.name: Isel Lucila

texts.es:
Isel es una joven emprendedora, tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la Ciudad de Chincha junto a su familia.
Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por eso que estudió la carrera de Técnico Farmacéutica. Actualmente trabaja de manera independiente en su domicilio vendiendo medicamentos y dando consultas a las personas que requieren sus servicios como toma de medida de presión entre otras consultas.
Isel está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá remodelar su cuarto y pintar las paredes para que así pueda sentirse más cómoda y en un ambiente confortable. De esta manera seguirá luchando con mucho empeño para que más adelante pueda cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Isel is a young entrepreneur who is 29 years old, single, and lives in the city of Chincha with her family. She is very keen to succeed, which is why she studied a degree to be a pharmacy technician. She currently works independently in her home selling medicines and giving consultations to people who need her services, such as taking blood pressure. 

Isel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with their help, she will be able to refurbish her room and paint the walls so that she can feel more at ease in a comfier environment. In this way, she will continue to fight hard so that in the future, she can achieve her biggest dream of having her own business.

loans.use: to refurbish her room and paint the walls.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 42-year-old married woman. For about five years she has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. She is in her eighth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
Pastor de 68 Años de edad, es señor de talla muy fina trabajador y con principios de lucha muy bien arraigados en su espíritu incansable, a su edad el día con día se levanta temprano para comenzar la faena diaria en sus parcelas sembrando maíz y frijol y una variedad de hortalizas las cuales a él le sirven para su propio consumo y así no tiene que comprarlas en el mercado municipal.

Entre él y su esposa apoyan a su nieto que esta actualmente con ellos, que les brinda mucha felicidad por estar acompañándoles en su vejes. 

Pastor ha realizado la agricultura desde que tenia 7 años con su padre, al que acompañaba a trabajar al cerro como él comenta eran días largos aprendió a trabajar desde que el sol salia hasta que se ocultaba por la tarde todo el día era de trabajar,  pero en pocos días habían terminado, así aprendió a trabajar antes gracias a su padre que le enseño a luchar con ganas. le párese que fue ayer cuando juntos con sus otros hermanos subían a las laderas del cerro con el machete bien afilado y su  tecomate lleno con agua para aguantar todo el día hasta que llegaba el almuerzo. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas. Para la temporada agrícola ya que tiene una parcela sembrada de maíz a la cual le falta abono y con el financiamiento lograra comprarlo.

El deseo de Pastor, es que su nieto siga siempre con ellos.
texts.en:
Pastor, 68 years old, is a hard-working man who has fighting principles well rooted in his tireless spirit.  Despite his age he gets up early day after day to begin his daily chores in the fields sowing corn and beans and different vegetables for family use, so that he doesn't have to buy them in the city market.

He and his wife support a nephew who now lives with them, providing them much happiness by accompanying them in their old age.

Pastor has worked at farming since he was 7 years old,  going with his father to work on the hill.  Those were long days.  He learned to work from the time when the sun rose till it was dark at night; the whole day was for working, but in a few days they would finish.  Thus he learned to work thanks to his father who taught him to fight hard.  To Pastor it seems like just yesterday when, along with his brothers,  they would go to the slopes of the hill, with a well- sharpened machete and his gourd full of water, enough to last until lunch time.

He is asking for a loan to buy seed corn, manure, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides for this agricultural season since he already has one parcel sowed to corn which needs manure, and with the financial assistance he can buy it.

Pastor's hope is that his nephew will continue to live with them.

loans.use: to buy seed corn, manure, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides

loans.name: Meki

texts.en: Meki is a 34-year-old unwed mother of three children. She runs a small canteen in her community and has been doing this for three years. Meki has requested a loan to buy sandwiches, soft drinks, donuts, pies, twisties, coffee, sugar, a new boiler and foam cups. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Meki will help out with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, soft drinks, donuts, pies, twisties, coffee, sugar, a new boiler and foam cups

loans.name: Delmis Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Delmis es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, desde hace 6 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y lugares cercanos que ella recorre ofreciendo su producto. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para seguir realizando su trabajo; el cual le ayuda mucho ya que las ganancias son de mucha utilidad en el hogar. Con el préstamo espera incrementar la cantidad de productos de su negocio de tal manera que sus ventas aumenten de forma considerablemente, y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario, y gracias a esto espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. Ella espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo del  2014
texts.en:
Señora Delmis is a very hard-working and responsible person who lives in a town in the south of Honduras with her family. She has had a business selling clothing for the past six years, which operates out of her home in the town in which she lives and in nearby communities she visits to sell her wares.

She needs the loan to buy more products to continue her work, which really helps her since the earnings are very useful in her household. With the loan, she hopes to increase the amount of products in her business so that her sales increase significantly, which will help a lot because she doesn't have all the goods she needs to cover the orders she gets from customers on a daily basis. Thanks to this, she hopes to be able to improve her family's quality of life through a boost in household income. 

In the short term, she hopes to grow her business, and in this way, continue to support her family and allow her children to study what they need to, so that they have better life opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras – May  2014

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, blouses and other clothing for her business.

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en:
Afshan is a 41-year-old married woman. She is been in the beauty parlor business for seven years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her high quality services she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, Afshan is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. Because of having a low amount of cash on hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her seventh loan. She needs a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a hair roller and combs, as well as packs of hair and skin care products. She hopes to cater to more customers over time. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a hail roller, combs and packs of hair and skin care products.

loans.name: Claudia Andrea

texts.es:
Claudia es una persona con ideales firmes y metas claras. Su mayor sueño es tener un gran negocio que le permita obtener ingresos estables y con un gran nivel de producción.
Ella tiene una hija de 16 años por la cual ha luchado para sacarla adelante y darle la mejor educación que le sea posible.
Tiene un taller de confección y arreglos de modistería con una producción medianamente buena. Trabaja con línea propia y en los meses de temporada alta contrata dos personas para que le ayuden.
Ella pide el préstamo para comprar un maquina recubridora con la cual podrá tener un mejor nivel de trabajo.
Esta máquina le permitirá cubrir una mayor cantidad de producción y podrá ofrecer un empleo adicional ayudando así a las personas de su comunidad.
Su mayor sueño es poder ver a su hija como una profesional.
texts.en:
Claudia is a person with firm ideals and clear goals. Her biggest dream is to have a large company with a high level of production which allows her to obtain a stable income. She has a 16 year old daughter for whom she has fought to move forwards and give her the best possible education. 

Claudia has a dressmaking and sewing workshop with quite a good output. She works with her own line, and in the high season, she hires two people to help her. 

She is requesting the loan to buy a covering machine, which will help her to improve her work. This machine will allow her to increase her output and offer an additional job to help out with this to people in her community. Her biggest dream is to see her daughter become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy a filleting machine.

loans.name: Tamseela

texts.en: Tamseela is 28-year-old hard working woman.  She has been doing business selling milk for many years. She has two cows and three buffalo for milk. She counts a good client list. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income.  She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life.  It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. Now she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. It will help her to inflate her milk sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Shabena

texts.en: Shabena is a 51-year-old vigorous, married woman. She is a mother of two. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past ten years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best-earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is 51 years old, widowed, and has five children. She has been weaving sweaters for almost 15 years. She works hard on her weaver every day so she may earn a living for her family and provide food, health, and education. Nazia is requesting her seventh loan from Kashf Foundation for 50,000 PKR which she will use to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors along with the packs of needles. With the loan, she hopes to increase her sales. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors along with the packs of needles.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina, age 31, is a married woman. She has been involved in a business, stitching clothes for the past 17 years. She earns a good amount of income to financially support her husband. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Rubina requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of zippers, laces, and buttons, to meet the increasing customer demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of zippers, laces, and buttons.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally is 19 years old and lives in a village across the Mekong, twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He has been married since 2013 and has no children yet. Phally is a gardener, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He does not have his own motorbike for commuting so he spends lots of money on motor taxis. He decided to apply for a loan to buy a motorbike. (Photo: Phally and his wife.)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta de 43 Años de edad, es una mujer de mucho empeño y trabajo, comenta que la razón fundamental de su existir, es su familia su esposo y sus tres hijos, trabajando muy duro a logrado sacar adelante a su familia junto a su esposo; pero sobre todo lo que la caracteriza es su incansable espíritu de lucha día con día no desmalla pero sobre todo una cosa de lo que mas le encanta es la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral, en su casa nunca faltan este tipo de animales. Su esposo se preocupa mucho por llevar el sustento al hogar y así lograr el bienestar de su familia, el esposo de Mata cultiva el maíz y el frijol en su parcela para su consumo y la venta.


Marta a criado aves de corral y cerdos desde que era una joven  y cuando se caso  aprendio mucho mas con el tiempo a cultivar también la tierra, con su esposo en esas largas faenas del campo, juntos antes de que tuviesen hijos, recuerda que  se levantaban muy temprano a preparar café y luego él se marchaba al cerro a trabajar y regresaba hasta el atardecer cuando el sol ya casi rayaba.


El préstamo se empleara para la compra de insumos para la temporada agrícola tales como agroquimícos y el abono para las plantas de maíz y frijol,  así lograra una mejor producción en esta temporada y tendrá mejores ingresos y mas grano para su consumo, con ello apoyara a su esposo y comprara un par de cerdos para engorde y destazo.


Marta planea mejorar su crianza de cerdos y aves, para  apoyar de mejor manera a su familia.
texts.en:
Marta, 43 years old, is a woman of much effort and work. She says that her fundamental reason for living is her family, her husband and their three children, and she works very hard together with her husband to ensure that her family gets ahead. But above all that which characterizes her is her tireless fighting spirit day after day. 

One thing that she most loves to do is to raise pigs and chickens, and in her house they never lack these type of animals. Her husband worries a lot about bringing food to the family, in this way ensuring the welfare of his family. He cultivates maize and beans in his plot for consumption and sale.

Marta has raised poultry and pigs since she was a young girl, and when she was married she learned a lot more over time about how to farm the earth with her husband during those long days of labour in the fields. Together before they had children, she remembers that they would wake up very early to make coffee and then he would go to the hills to work and would not return until evening when the sun had already almost set. 

The loan will be used for the purchase of supplies for farming season such as agrochemicals and fertilizer for maize and bean plants. This way, they will achieve better production this season and will have better earnings and more grains to eat. With this she will support her husband and will buy a couple of pigs for fattening and selling.

Marta plans to improve her raising of pigs and chickens in order to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for farming season such as agrochemicals and fertilizer for maize and bean plants.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is a 43-year-old, married woman. A year ago, she started a business, selling bed covers and bed sheets in her locality. She offers great variety to her customers and has become famous in her locality. 

For the improvement of her business, Ruqia contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy good quality bed sheets, covers, and spreads to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality bed sheets, covers, and spreads.

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid, who is in her mid-fifties, is married with five children and all of them are grown ups.  She lives with three grand children who are still at school.  She has been a food vendor for thirteen years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwanaid's seventeenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy missing items in the food store, opened a small food shop and bought a motor cycle. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees for her grand children, built her house and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy more stock of food,  chairs and tables for her business.  She dreams of owning a hotel.

Mwanaid will share this loan with her loan group, Lindi, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food, to buy chairs and tables for her business.

loans.name: 0506 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hợp operates a small restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to cook fast food to sell.

Hợp is 55 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province.

Hợp is the group leader of the 0506 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is Hợp's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Hợp has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hợp faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hợp hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to be enabled to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook fast food to sell

loans.name: Saman

texts.en:
Saman (in photo), age 48, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She has three children--two sons and one daughter. All of her children are in school. 

Saman stays at home and does housework. Her main source of income is from her husband who is a soldier. 

One of her children is attending university, majoring in electrical engineering. He needs a computer to assist in his studying with assignments such as research. Hence Saman decided to apply for a loan to buy a computer for her son.

loans.use: To buy a computer for her son.

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida is a single woman. She has two children. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en:
Nosheen is a 42-year-old, married woman. She has been running a beauty parlor for a period of about 12 years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through her best-providing services, she has become very famous on her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, Nosheen is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. For this reason, she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. 

Nosheen is in her fifth loan cycle with good credit history. She is hopeful of catering to more customers, time after time. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a 37-year-old married woman who has been doing business selling milk for the past 9 years. She has two buffaloes in milk. She sells the milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk.  Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

She has three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.
