 It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through their support. Now she requests a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in her earnings through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 45 years old, married and has five children. Three of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Analie has been raising pigs for 25 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida, a 41-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, does hand embroidery, and then sells it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Zahida has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history,  Zahida requests her fifth loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old, married and has three children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Jocelyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is 41 years old and married. Her husband is a laborer. She has six children and a total of eight members in her household. Her husband was the only wage earner of the family. It was very tough for Yasmeen to manage her household needs with the small income from her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband by selling cloth in her area. She purchases a variety of cloth from the wholesale market to meet her customers’ demands. Now, she is playing a very important role in her family. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more varieties of cloth in different colors, taking into account the tastes and choices of her customers. She aspires to save money for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of cloth in different colors.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 29-year-old married father of one child. A year ago he established his own cafe, offering several hooka flavors and services in addition to tasty coffee.
Samir has 13 years of experience in this domain which he started after quitting school during the elementary stages to support his family.
This long experience provided him with special talents which he uses to attract loyal customers. He is developing his business by diversifying his services.
Today, Samir is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with a new hooka collection with popular special flavors. He also will use the loan to buy charcoal and other cafe needs.
He hopes that in the future, he can expand his working place or move to a larger one and increase his services.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with a new hooka collection and also to buy charcoal and other cafe needs

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 28-year-old married woman who has a 4-year-old child. She describes herself as business-focused. She operates a retail business where she sells electrical products. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial difficulties. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase additional stock. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business capable of supporting her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her retail business selling electrical products.

loans.name: Fokaben Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Fokaben ont en moyenne 28 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’ustensiles plastiques de meilleures qualités, de fruits, d’habits et du sucre. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bintou  (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des ustensiles plastiques de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  15 seaux et 10 baignoires  en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Bintou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married in only monogamous households, the four members of the group Fokaben average 28 years of age and four children each. The women all live in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé, Cercle de Kati. And they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the Kanadjiguila market. The group members have small-scale businesses involving good-quality plastic utensils, fruit, clothing, and sugar. 

Intending to increase their capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Bintou (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) is a major vendor of good-quality plastic utensils. She intends to use her loan to purchase 15 buckets and 10 basins wholesale at the big market. In Kanadjiguila and by hawking, her sales are made at the retail level to a customer base composed mostly of women. 

With this loan, Ms. Bintou plans on making an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting sundry needs at home.

loans.use: to purchase utensils

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
This is Felisa, 26, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to John Boy, her business partner. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a dried fish vending business. She is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Felisa buys different kinds of dried fish from her suppliers and then sells them in the market. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day. To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more dried fish needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Felisa hopes to improve her family's living conditions through the business and dreams of a happy and contented life together with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a very hard-working entrepreneur from Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is 37 years old and has children. She solely supports her children through all her hard work. She operates a junk shop to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, and papers. They sell these items to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries and factories. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Veronica is taking out a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors.

In the future, she dreams of having her own car. She also hopes that she will be able to send all her children to school and have them finish their studies.
 
She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Vilma has successfully paid back her previous loan. She is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Vilma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en: Sharifan is a 55-year-old married woman. She is in business selling milk with her husband. She has two buffaloes. She looks after the livestock while her husband sells milk to different places on daily basis. She earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family. To meet increasing demands of her customers, she needs to purchase one more buffalo and feed. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She is on her fifth loan with good credit history. She is hopeful to get an increase in her net income through her increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo and feed.

loans.name: Benko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benko est majoritairement composé des femmes mariées dans des ménages polygamiques vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, du bois de chauffage, de condiments, de pâtes d’arachides et de produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Adam   (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du bois de chauffage. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 chargements de camionnette de bois dans les villages environnants de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila et à une clientèle mixte. Madame Adam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 110 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Benko is composed mostly of married women  in polygamous households who live with their husband and children. The woman average 44 years of age and seven children, all living in the village of Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé, Cercle de Kati. And they know one another through community ties. The group members have small-scale businesses involving firewood, condiments, peanut butter, and cosmetic products. 

With the goal of increasing their capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Adam (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) is famous for selling firewood. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 truck loads of wood from the villages surrounding Bamako. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base in Kanadjiguila. 

With this loan, Ms. Adam hopes to make an average monthly profit of 110,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to purchase a plot of residential land through this Soro Yiriwaso relationship.

loans.use: to purchase firewood

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 28 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sébenikoro l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sébenikoro. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax), d’ustensiles et d’huile d’arachides. Dans l’obtention de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une  vendeuse d’habits (pagnes wax) de qualités supérieures. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 70 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Sebenikoro à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer et autres.
texts.en:
Most of them married in monogamous households, the four members of the group Benkadi average 28 years of age and four children, all living in Sébenikoro, a district in Bamako. The women know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses  at the Sébenikoro market. The group members have small-scale businesses involving clothing (made from ’pagnes’ the colorful cloth of western Africa), utensils, and peanut oil. 

Intending to renew their cash supplies, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Mariam (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) is a vendor of Wax ‘pagne’ cloth of superior quality. She intends to use her loan to purchase 70 lengths of Wax ‘pagne’ wholesale from the big market. Her sales are made at the retail level to a customer base composed mostly of women in Sebenikoro. 

With this loan, Ms. Mariam hopes to make an average monthly profit of 125,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting various needs, such as household needs.

loans.use: to purchase Wax 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Herèmakono ont en moyenne 32 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sébenikoro l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sébenikoro. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, échalotes, habits et ustensiles. Dans l’intention de constituer leurs stocks  de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (échalotes). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 sacs  d’échalotes en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Sebenikoro et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Heremakono group are married women and mainly living in polygamous families. On the average, they are 32 years old, with five children. They all live in Sébenikoro, a neighborhood of Bamako, and know each other as neighbors as well as through their work as vendors at the Sébenikoro market. The group members sell clothing and utensils. With the goal of replenish their stock, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan.

Mrs. Aminata, the one standing in the far right in the photo, is a well-known vendor of condiments (shallots). She plans to use her loan to buy eight bags of shallots in Médine. She resells retail in Sébenikoro and as a street vendor, mainly to female customers. With this loan, Mrs. Aminata plans to  earn an average monthly  revenue of 150,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvested in her business and cover some minor household needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: martha de 52 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta y elaboración de tortillas su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder seguir con sus ventas ya que le genera buenos ingresos y poder tener junto con su compañero de vida y mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Martha is 52 years old and has made a living making a selling tortillas for a number of years. Her business is located in her home, and she has a lot of customers because she is very friendly to them. This is how she earns a living and pays her household expenses. She lives in her won home with her partner. She is requesting a loan to buy quintales of corn and lime, so that she can continue to sell her food, which generates a good income, and achieve more financial stability with her partner.

loans.use: to buy quintales of corn and lime.

loans.name: Urpi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana ella es soltera y tiene 29 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende quinua, maíz y trigo, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar quinua, maíz y trigo.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de fotocopiadora.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Urpi." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.

Roxana is 29 years old, she is single, and has 1 child. She works in her business where she sells cereal grains. She sells quinoa, corn, and wheat. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She has been in this business for several years and it's going very well for her. Her dream is is expand her cereal grain business. She is requesting the loan to buy quinoa, corn, and wheat.

The borrower whose photo is attached to the group photo had his picture taken after the group meeting because of work. 

The other members have a restaurant sales business, a business selling clothing, a small grocery store business, and a photocopy business.

loans.use: to buy quinoa, corn, and wheat.

loans.name: Njia Ya Ng'ombe Group

texts.en:
Hamida is a mother of two school-going sons and is in her late twenties. She is a divorcée, and for three years she has been taking care of her family by managing a fish business. She travels a distance from home to the fish market (from 5:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m.) to buy stock, then returns home to fry the fish and resell it. She has a big table where she arranges her fish in bundles depend on their size (big and small corresponding with prices). Hamida sells her fish up to midnight daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is her first loan request through Tujijenge Tanzania. Hamida is applying for a loan to be apportioned among Njia Ya Ng'ombe, a group of six members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Hamida will use this loan to repair her table where she displays her fried fish and to restock her supply of fish for her business. Her ambitions are to greatly improve her fish business and to build a nice house.

loans.use: to repair her table where she displays her fried fish and to restock her supply of fish for her business.

loans.name: Yasmina

texts.es:
La socia Yasmina  se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas para la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yasmina has a small grocery business.  She sells staple items such as rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.  She works from 8am to 7pm.  She has had her business for 5 years and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and crackers for his grocery store.  She is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas para la tienda de abarrotes.

loans.name: Dúo Luchando Por Nuestro Sueños Group

texts.es: Dúo Luchando por nuestro sueños La encargada de este grupo es la señora Evelyn Carolina quien tiene 39 años de edad, y se dedican al lado de su familia a la confección de playeras desde hace 8 años en su pequeña maquila, cuenta con 5 empleados por el momento y su sueño es seguir creciendo para tener una fabrica con varios empleados y ser una gran confeccionista de su pueblo.  Cada día le llegan más pedidos al negocio y es excelente.  Tiene la necesidad de comprar una maquina llamada ojaleadora que se encarga de ponerle los botones a cada playera, necesita comprar una de ellas para no tener que pagar a parte este trabajo y así hacer un solo trabajo en su casa, el dinero no le es suficiente y por tal motivo está solicitando un crédito mas.
texts.en:
Dúo Luchando por Nuestro Sueños [Duo Fighting for Our Dreams]: The person in charge of this group is Evelyn Carolina who is 39 years old and, aside from caring for her family, has made a living sewing shirts for the last 8 years in her small assembly plant. She has 5 employees at the moment and her dream is to continue growing into a factory with many employees and to be a large manufacturer in her town.

Every day more orders arrive at her business and it is excellent. She needs to buy a machine called an ojaleadora [buttonhole sewing machine] which places buttons on each shirt. She needs to buy one in order to avoid having to pay separately for this work and thereby have the entire process done in house. She does not have sufficient money and for this reason is requesting another loan.

loans.use: to buy a machine to sew buttons on garments

loans.name: Claudia Yaneth

texts.es: Claudia tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 años y 12 años de edad. Claudia tiene un puesto de tortillas, todos los días elabora y vende tortillas lo cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario y junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Claudia solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo de la vivienda y comprar puertas y ventanas para la misma.
texts.en:
Claudia is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two sons aged 15 and 12 years old.

Claudia has a tortilla stand.  Every day she produces and sells tortillas allowing her to earn her daily bread and, with her husband, maintain the household finances.

Claudia is requesting this loan from FUSAI because she want to repair the roof of the house and buy doors and windows for it.

loans.use: to purchase doors, windows, sheet metal and wood to repair the roof of the house and make it more secure.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador tiene 65 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa. Salvador es un hombre muy trabajador quien desde hace años se gana la vida por medio del cultivo de frijoles y maíz lo cual es lo que le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar. Salvador solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas para la vivienda y así poder contar con mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Salvador is 65 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. Salvador is a very hardworking man who has made a living for years by farming beans and corn. This has allowed him to support his household. Salvador is requesting this loan from Kiva partner FUSAI to invest in the purchase of doors and windows for his home so he will have better security.

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows for his house.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita has been engaged in making and selling soft brooms within the local community. She is 41 years old and has five children who all attend school. She aims to make her business more profitable to help her husband support the education of her children. She plans to make more soft brooms to sell but has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more rattan, nylon and plastics needed to make soft brooms. Through patience and hard work, Marita believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy rattan, nylon and plastics to make soft brooms.

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
Tétela  se encuentra dividido en 8 colonias y son: La Zapata, La Bascula, Comitancillo libre, Garibaldi, Nueva Reforma, Huapinole, Loma del Jazmín y San Ángel.

El nombre de TETELA es de origen náhuatl y se explica cómo: TETE plural de TETL, piedra y LA por TLAN designación de abundancia, resultando su traducción como:
"LUGAR DONDE ABUNDAN LAS PIEDRAS" En este lugar se ha formado un grupo llamado Estrellitas, los integrantes del grupo son; Ines- Venta de antojitos, Rosa- Venta de tacos, Zacarías- servicio de molino, venta de abarrotes, frutas y verduras, Marlem- Venta de tacos, Maria-Venta de refrescos, Nohemi-Calzado por catalogo.
Don Zacarías es el único hombre integrante del grupo, comenta que desde hace ya 10 años se ha dedicado a moler nixtamal, cuando era joven tuvo un accidente en el cual perdió tres dedos de la mano derecha, eso no le ha impedido salir adelante al contrario le da la fortaleza necesaria, de igual manera trabaja en el campo por las tardes, el préstamo solicitado lo utilizara para comprar piedras nuevas para el molino, con las ganancias obtenidas sustenta su hogar y da mantenimiento a su molino, espera que Dios le dé aún muchos años de vida para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Tétela is divided into eight colonies: La Zapata, La Bascula, Comitancillo Libre, Garibaldi, Nueva Reforma, Huapinole, Loma del Jazmín, and San Ángel.

The name “Tétela” is of Náhautl origin. “Tete” is the plural of “Tetl”, meaning stone, and “la” comes from “tlan”, meaning abundance; therefore, the translation of “Tétela” is “Place where stones abound”. 

It is in Tétela where the group “Estrellitas” (“Little Stars”) was formed. The members of the group are: Inés, who sells snacks; Rosa, who sells tacos; Zacarías, who runs a mills and sells groceries, fruit, and vegetables ; Marlem, who sells tacos; María, who sells soft drinks; and Nohemi, who sells shoes by catalogue.

Zacarías is the only male member of the group. He says he has been milling nixtamalised maize for ten years. When he was young he had an accident, in which he lost three fingers from his right hand. This has not stopped him from getting ahead in life; on the contrary, it gives him the necessary strength. He also works in the fields in the afternoon. He will use the requested loan to buy new stones for his mill. He uses the profits he obtains from his work to provide for his family and maintain his mill. He hopes that God will give him many more years of life so he can continue working.

loans.use: to buy stones for his mill

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Nenita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Nenita's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Meet Geoffrey, a father of three, who has been farming for six years. He lives with his family on family-owned land in the Kericho, Kenya. Geoffrey sells milk, eggs, tea and various food crop varieties from his farm to earn a living. 
Geoffrey is very passionate about horticultural farming. However, he faces market challenges such as low prices and low demand in certain seasons. 
Geoffrey joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that provides both training and financing to smallholder rural farmers. He learned about loan management during the training sessions. 
He is now seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase horticultural inputs. 
With the loan, Geoffrey will pay the input expenses that are beyond his means at the moment. With the inputs, he is set to achieve not only a great quantity, but also high-quality yields. 
With the additional income from horticulture, Geoffrey will comfortably complete his loan repayments. He seeks to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy horticultural inputs.

loans.name: Maria Guillerma

texts.es:
María, cuenta con un negocio de venta de frutas desde hace 25 años, también ofrece diferentes tipos de bebidas refrescantes, trabajad de siete de la mañana a seis de la tarde, esté oficio lo aprendió de su mamá, actualmente vive con una de sus hijas, juntas atienden el negocio, su ventaja es la ubicación, ya que esta frente a una parada de buses.
Comprará uvas, mandarinas, granadillas, plátanos, jugos, agua, gaseosas, refrescos y bolsas, tendrá capital para surtir su negocio eventualmente cuando sea necesario y así mantenerse trabajando por un largo tiempo, continuara teniendo los ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y resarcir la deuda adquirida.
Su anhelo es seguir esforzándose para que su negocio se mantenga en el mercado y tener los ingresos que tanto necesita para subsistir.
texts.en:
María has a business selling fruit for 25 years.  She also sells different types of refreshing drinks.  She works from seven in the morning until six in the evening.  She learned this trade from her mother.  She currently lives with one of her daughters, and they tend the business together.  The advantage that she has is the location because it is in front of a bus stop.

She will buy grapes, tangerines, passion fruit, bananas, juices, water, soft drinks, refreshments and bags.  She will have capital to stock her business as needed.  This way she will keep working for a long time.  She will continue to have the income to cover her household expenses and to repay the loan.

She longs to continue putting forth great effort so that her business stays in the market and so that she has the income that she needs so much in order to survive.

loans.use: to buy grapes, tangerines, passion fruit, bananas, juices, water, soft drinks, refreshments and bags.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: Luz María es una orgullosa madre de dos hijos por los cuales se ha, trasnochado, esforzado y como dice un popular dicho se ha roto el lomo para brindarles una educación, una vivienda, una buena vida y sus deseos no terminan pues ella siempre ha querido brindarles una educación universitaria y adquirir una vivienda propia y para ello se ha desempeñado como una confeccionista y tiene su negocio propio hace aproximadamente 20 años donde realiza acabados en acolchados, sabanas y arregla prendas en general su principal ventaja es que tiene una línea propia en los acabados primeramente mencionados, en busca mejorar sus condiciones laborales atraer más clientes y poder cambiar constantemente sus artículos Luz María solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina fileteadora y telas para la elaboración de sus productos con un mejor terminado con lo que espera atraer un nuevo mercado.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is a proud mother of two children, for whom she has pulled late nights, worked, and as the popular saying goes, broken her back in order to give them an education, a home, a good life, and these desires for them don't stop. She has always wanted to give them a University education and own their own home. 

For this, she has worked as a clothing manufacturer and has had her own business for about 20 years, where she finishes quilts, sheets, and fixes clothes in general. 

The main advantage is that she has her own line in the finishing previously mentioned. Looking to improve her working conditions to attract more customers and be able to constantly change her items, Luz Maria asks for a loan to buy a threading machine and fabrics for the development of her products with a better finish, with which she hopes to attract a new market.

loans.use: to buy a threading machine and fabrics for developing her own line of quilts and sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crop.

loans.name: Elmer Ivan

texts.es:
Elmer de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, ya que era uno de los hermanos mayores y tenia que ayudar a sus padres, su compañera de vida se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, sus hijos están estudiando, por lo que son 4 personas que dependen de él.


Elmer actualmente se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y lo ha hecho desde niño, lo aprendió de sus padres pues ellos eran agricultores, aparte de la agricultura también se dedica a la crianza de animales, los que vende en poco tiempo y sobre el horario es difícil decirlo porque él aveces sale temprano y aveces tarde.


El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, para cultivar debido a que el invierno ya inicio.  


Los sueños de Elmer son tener un vehículo para trasladar la cosecha y para su familia, darles un estudio a sus hijos para que tengan una mejor oportunidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
Elmer is 39 years old. He has a third-grade education, as he was one of the older siblings and had to help his parents. His life partner takes care of the household duties and his children are in school, so there are four people who depend on him.

Currently, Elmer earns his living working in agriculture; that's what he has done since he was little. He learned it from his parents, since they were farmers. In addition to farming, he also works raising animals, which he sells quickly. Regarding his schedule, it is difficult to say, because he sometimes starts early and other times late.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy corn seed, soil amendments, fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides in order to farm, since the rainy season has already begun.

Elmer's dreams are to have a vehicle to transport his harvest and, with regard to his family, to give his children an education so that they can have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, soil amendments, fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides in order to farm, since the rainy season has already begun.

loans.name: Rit

texts.en:
Rit, 33, is a hard-working man who lives in a rural area of Prey Veng Province. To make a living and support his one son, he works as a farmer on a small farmland near his house. From being a farmer he can earn 3.50 USD per day. His wife is also a farmer who can make the same profit.

Rit would like to improve his living conditions and make life more comfortable by having clean energy like solar to use. Due to insufficient funds, he has applied for a loan of 300 USD to buy a solar system for his home. This purchase will enable his family to gain access to solar electricity, which provides power to home devices such as lights, TV, and radio. Rit thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate for this loan than its general loan product.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy system

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells vehicle spare parts. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of spare parts. His business goal is to own a big shop within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of spare parts

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells bananas. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a populated place and his primary customers are daily customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas. His business goal is to have a stable business with branches in other areas within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas.

loans.name: Mwende

texts.en: Mwende is a 30-year-old married woman. She has four children between the ages of 18 months and 12 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a food kiosk. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to own a sustainable and stable business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy educational equipment for her daughter.

loans.name: Saman

texts.en:
Saman is a rice farmer. As the father of seven children, he works as hard as he can hard on his rice field in order to satisfy the family’s needs. He lives with his family in a remote area of Kampong Speu Province. 

Saman is requesting a loan in the amount of USD 560.00 in order to build a hygienic latrine for his family to use. This will be his first loan from HKL. 

He thanks lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides him with a low interest rate.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for his family

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn 09 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ has a business selling soft drinks; she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. 

Huệ is 52 years old, and she is married with two children.

This is Huệ first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the NHóm 05 Thôn 09 Quảng Lưu solidarity group. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to sell.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes to buy a motorbike, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Shifah

texts.en:
Shifah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She sells second hand clothes at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. 

She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fess and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Thôn 09 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Cương operates a food stall/restaurant selling dry food. She is applying for a loan to purchase more dry food (salt, cooking-oil, peanut,...) to resell. Cương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Cương is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children. Cương is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 Thôn 09 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. This is Cương first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Cương hopes to buy a motorbike, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food (salt, cooking-oil, peanuts) to resell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family member. 
She has been selling charcoal from home at wholesale from door-to-door for the last ten years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 400,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include transportation and thieves. Her dream is to acquire a truck for ferrying charcoal from the village. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans. 

She stays with her husband in a rented house with access to electricity and no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child and she does not go to school. She has no additional family member. She sells charcoal at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 09 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Tĩnh works in agriculture raising poultry . She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Tĩnh is 54 years old and is married with two children.

Tĩnh is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thôn 09 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

This is Tĩnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Tĩnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tĩnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tĩnh hopes to buy a motorbike, for her business to do well and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 03-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tỵ operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits to resell. Tỵ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tỵ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Tỵ is 63 years old and she is married with 3 children. Tỵ is the group leader of the 03-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Tỵ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tỵ has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Tỵ hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to resell.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 46 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is the sole bread winner for her four children who are now adults. 

Elenita has been engaged in a hog fattening business for two years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase three sacks of booster and grower feed for her hog fattening business. 

Elenita joined PMPC just this year. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of booster and grower feed

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 22-year-old single man. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a supply business where he sells cakes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to expand the business. He hopes that in the future, his business will be stable and able to support his basic needs.

loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 62 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with six adult children. Violeta is engaged in the hog fattening business for two years now. She earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing three sacks of booster and grower feeds for her hog fattening business. 

Violeta has been a member of PMPC since this year. In the future, Violeta hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing three sacks of booster and grower feeds.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 49 years old, married and has four children in school.

Sally is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sally has been farming sugarcane for 12 years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sally would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nancita

texts.en:
Nancita is 45 years old and married with four children.

Nancita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like rice, snack foods, sardines and other groceries.

Nancita has borrowed and repaid 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from fishing.

Nancita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, snack foods, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He deals in motorcycle transportation and also does farming as a side income activity. He started the business in order to raise funds to look after his children and eradicate poverty. He faces a difficulty of poor roads that cause him constant mechanical break downs. In spite of this, he desires to own more motorcycles and educate his children so they can go to higher institutions of learning.

Deo intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer afortunada ya que hace mas de 2 años un jefe que tenía le dio la oportunidad de administrar un negocio de restaurante bar en el municipio de Medellín. Ella inicio allí como empleada pero gracias a su buen trabajo y proactividad, su jefe decidió darle la oportunidad de progresar y salir adelante con sus hijos al permitirle administrar el negocio y entregarle toda su confianza.
Hoy, Luz es feliz con su trabajo ya que ha podido tener mucha independencia y se ha dado la oportunidad de soñar con un futuro prometedor para sus hijos.
Ella desea aumentar la capacidad de venta y servicio de su negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo para comprar más surtido de licores y de este modo aumentar su inventario.
De esta manera podrá tener más producto disponible para sus clientes y ofrecerá un mejor servicio.
Vive muy agradecida con las entidades que permiten que las personas de bajos recursos puedan soñar y elevar sus ilusiones.
texts.en:
Luz is a fortunate woman because 2 years ago her boss gave her the opportunity to run a bar and restaurant in the city of Medellin. She began as an employee but thanks to her good work and pro-activeness, her boss decided to give her the opportunity to advance in her career and to make life better for her and her children by entrusting her to run the business.
Today, Luz is happy in her work because she has been able to achieve a lot of independence and this has given her the opportunity to dream of a promising future for her children. 
She hopes to increase sales and expand service, so she is asking for  a loan in order to purchase more liquor so she can increase her inventory. 
This way, she will be able to have more available product for her customers and offer a better service. She is very thankful for the institutions that help people with limited resources like her to be able to dream of the future.

loans.use: purchase stock for her business.

loans.name: Raeesa

texts.en:
Raeesa is 54-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business selling cloths. She has been doing it for the past five years, and has become famous for providing good quality cloth in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase good quality fabric in different colors. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history. She aspires to save money for the prosperous future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase good quality fabric in different colors.

loans.name: Abed Al Nasser

texts.en:
Abed Al Nasser is a 26-year-old engaged man, the sole breadwinner for five other members of his family. He has been employed in a wholesale lingerie business for four years, and it is going on just fine. But his family's needs are increasing and his limited income can't cover everything and help him start and develop his own business at the same time these days, due to several social and political changes in his region. 

That's why he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to  buy necessary electronics and closets he needs for his house which he is preparing to move to when he gets married soon.

He hopes to afford the necessary money to start his own business soon.

loans.use: To buy necessary electronics and closets he needs for his house.

loans.name: 0505 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lý is 50 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 0505 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Mrs. Lý has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for 5 years, and the main hardship she faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food (salt, cooking-oil, peanuts, etc.) to resell. With her business profits, Mrs. Lý hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food to resell

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius, age 46, is a farmer. He grows, harvests, and sells maize and beans to earn an income. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. He describes his biggest business challenges to be poor weather and price fluctuations.

Pius and his wife have six children. He works hard and describes himself as industrious. 

He will use his Kes 30,000 loan funds to purchase fertilizer and animal feed. He hopes that in the future, his farm will become a family business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as maize and bean seedlings for planting

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 64 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with six children now at their adult ages. 

Claudia is engaged in food vending, and has been managing a little sari-sari store business for five years already. She earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of business activity.  

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of groceries and other consumable products for retail.

Claudia has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, Claudia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: 10-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lý has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food (salt, cooking oil, and peanuts) to resell. She 52 years old and married with three children. Lý is the group leader of the 10-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lý has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lý hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, cooking oil, and peanuts to resell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar, age 40, operates a tricycle transportation business. His wife Marcy is a worker abroad. They have one child. They work together to manage their household and to provide for the family's everyday needs. They live in Bacoor, Cavite.

Edgar owns one tricycle (a motorcycle with a sidecar), which carries up to four passengers. He drives passengers to their destinations in this vehicle from early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives well into the wee hours of the morning in order to earn a bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and members of the local community. He earns a minimum of PhP 500 from his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, Edgar is requesting a loan in the amount of  PhP 8,000. He will use his loan funds to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. It is essential that he keep his vehicle in good condition in order to have a regular income to meet the daily needs of his family. 

Edgar dreams of having a second tricycle vehicle eventually. His goal is to give his family a good future. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle vehicle

loans.name: Edwin Ciro

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Parcona junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 2 años trabaja en un prestigioso supermercado de la Ciudad donde vive, y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora, y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
A su corta edad ha tomado la responsabilidad de su familia es por ello que día a día busca sacarlos adelante y brindarles un futuro mejor con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Edwin está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque gracias al apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar una cocina para regalarle a su madre, ya que ella es su mayor motivación en esta vida y quiere darle todo lo mejor, y con esta tranquilidad seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder cumplir su gran sueño: "Construir una casa para su madre".
texts.en:
Edwin is a young entrepreneur.  He is 20 years old, single, and lives in Parcona with his family.

For 2 years, Edwin has worked for a renowned supermarket in the city where he lives.  It's going well for him, because he is a very hardworking person who has a strong desire to get ahead. 

At his young age, he has taken the responsibility for his family.  It is for them that he strives to get ahead each day, so that with his efforts and dedication he can provide them with a better future.

Edwin is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the support that they are providing, he will be able to buy a stove to give to his mother.  She is his main motivation in life, and he wants to give her the very best, and a peaceful life.  Edwin will continue to exert himself in the future so that he can accomplish his greatest dream: "to build a house for my mother."

loans.use: to buy an appliance (a stove)

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn farms rice and sugarcane to make her living. She earns an additional income by operating a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. Evelyn and her husband work hard to support their family.

Evelyn is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nooreen

texts.en:
Nooreen is a 42-year-old married woman.  She has been doing a business selling milk for a period of about five years. She has three cows. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, and earns a good amount of income to fulfill the needs of the family members. 

It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. 

Now she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. 

She hopes to get increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Edgardo Giovani

texts.es: Edgardo de 32 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador, responsable y honrado, desde hace 13 años el se dedica a la agricultura siembra cada año maíz y frijol, y esos años le han dado la experiencia necesaria para cosechar un buen cultivo, muchos vecinos dan buenas referencias de su persona y de los productos que comercializa por esa razón posee mucha clientela,  el vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Edgardo esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc., y al mismo tiempo mejorar el terreno donde realiza su siembra que es el que muestra en la fotografía y así el y su familia puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Edgardo is 32 and is a hard-working, responsible and honourable man. He has been working for 13 years in agriculture and he sows maize and beans every year. These years have given him the necessary experience to harvest a good crop. Many neighbours give him a good character reference and praise the produce he sells, and this is why he has a lot of customers. He lives in his own house with his wife and two children.

Edgardo is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL to be able to buy necessary agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilisers, herbicides, etc., and at the same time to improve the land where he sows, which is shown in the photo. In this way, he and his family can have a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, herbicides, etc., and at the same time to improve the land.

loans.name: 13-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiến operates a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients to cook noodles to sell. She is 57 years old and married with five children. Tiến is the group leader of the 13-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tiến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tiến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tiến hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 22 años de edad se dedica desde hace 5 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo, y es así como se gana la vida honradamente, con su trabajo logra solventar cualquier gasto que se le presente en su hogar, el cliente vive con su grupo familiar conformado por su compañera de vida y su hijo, el quiere seguir con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo pero no tiene de suficiente capital para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito y poder comprar los insumos necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y también mejorar el terreno donde hace su siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía y asi poder seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The 22-year-old client has earned an honest living as a corn and sorghum farmer for the past five years. His work allows him to take care of any household expenses that arise. The client lives with his family, which consists of his life partner and son. 

He wants to continue growing his crops, since it is his only source of work, but he does not have enough money to be able to achieve this. This is why he is requesting a loan to be able to buy the supplies needed such as: fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides and to also improve the land where he has his crops, which is the one shown in the photo. This way he will be able to continue giving his family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides and to also improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy a new computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are frequent. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have frequent cash flow. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be hopeful. She operates a trade business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for four years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional and more diversified stock. Her business goal is to own her own shoe store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional and more diversified stock

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be good. He operates a transport business where he transports goods and customers. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Micro Finance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Elineo

texts.en:
Elineo used the previous loan to buy cosmetics to sell. His main business is running a cosmetics shop alongside a barber shop to boost his income. Having a bigger, well-stocked shop and the ability to provide fully for his family are his greatest dreams. Despite his progress, he faces the challenge of price fluctuations. 

Elineo is requesting a loan to add more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his car and to buy a mattress.

loans.name: María Emma

texts.es:
María de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato general,esta acompañada, su compañero de vida trabaja de motorista en un camión, su hija esta pequeña de dos años de edad,  viven en casa familiar.

María aprendió a elaborar hamacas, ya que su suegra y todos sus hijos a eso se dedican,ahora ella hace muchas durante el mes, el horario es factible.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar arena, cemento, grava, hierro, bloques y pago de mano de obra para construir un baño y una pila,el cual es necesario para su familia.

El sueño de María es vender mas hamacas y de esa forma obtener mas ingresos económicos para su pequeña hija y lo lograra con la ayuda de Dios y de credicampo.
texts.en:
María, 22 years old, studied through general high school. She is in a relationship. Her life partner works as a bus driver. Her little daughter is 2 years old. They live in the family's house.

María learned to make hammocks. Because her mother-in-law and all her children work at this, she now produces many each month and the schedule is feasible.

The loan she is requesting is to buy sand, cement, gravel, metal, cinder blocks and labor to build a bathroom and a sink which her family needs.

María's dream is to sell more hammocks in order to have a higher income for her little daughter. She will achieve this with help from God and Credicampo.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, metal, cinder blocks and labor to build a bathroom and a sink, which her family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her churro cart and to buy supplies for her preparations.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
Fidelia de 42 años de edad,  estudio hasta 3º grado, es madre soltera tiene una hija mayor de edad, quien esta estudiando el ultimo año de bachillerato. Fidelia es empleada en un restaurante de cocinera, por varios años decidió buscar trabajo debido a que sola le ha tocado crecer a su única hija; su horario de trabajo es de 6:30  AM a 6:00PM,de toda la semana le dan un día de descanso.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para  comprar un ropero y  una plancha, ya que no tiene estos electrodomésticos tan importantes en un hogar, ya que sacarlos por cuotas le saldrá mas caro y prefiere tener una sola cuota.

El sueño de Fidelia es que su hija saque el ultimo año de bachillerato y siga estudiando en la universidad,que saque su carrera para que sea profesional y se gane la vida por si sola,y eso lo lograra con la ayuda de Dios y su esfuerzo y también con el apoyo de la institución.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 42 years old; she studied up to the 3rd grade. She is a single mother with an adult daughter who is completing her last year of high school. Fidelia has been employed as a cook in a restaurant for various years. She decided to look for work since she had to raise her daughter on her own. Her work schedule is from 6:30 AM to 6:00 PM every day; they give her one day off.

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy a dresser and an iron because she does not have these very important appliances at home. Taking them out on credit will be more expensive and she prefers to only have one loan.

Fidelia’s dream is for her daughter to finish her last year of high school and continue studying in the university, to get a career so that she can be a professional and earn her own way through life. She will be able to obtain this with God’s help and her effort as well as with help from the institution.

loans.use: to buy a dresser and an iron because she does not have these very important appliances at home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlocker machine which is very necessary to speed up his processes because, due to his advanced age, he does his sewing more slowly and his orders have deadlines that he must meet.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José es una persona de 60 años de edad, Unido, quien tiene trece hijos, cinco varones y 8 mujeres, quienes vive en el departamento de Sololá. Su actividad principal es la agricultura, la siembra de papa y zanahoria son cultivos con alta demanda a nivel regional como nacional, se ha especializado en la producción y comercialización de hortalizas durante su vida al igual que su esposa quienes comparten sus ganancias para el sostenimiento de su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de insumos agrícolas especialmente semilla de papa, así poder ampliar y  diversificar su producción. La meta que tiene es poder mejorar e incrementar el rendimiento de su producto y que sirva de experiencia hacia otros pequeños productores.
texts.en:
José is a 60-year-old individual. He is in a relationship and has 13 children, 5 sons and 8 daughters. They all live in the Department of Sololá. His main business activity is agriculture. His crops of potatoes and carrots are products that are in high demand, both at a regional and national level.

José has specialized in producing and selling vegetables throughout his life. His wife also contributes to the income for supporting their family. José is requesting a loan of 4,000 GTQ so that he can buy farming supplies, such as seed potatoes, in order to increase and diversify his production. His goal is to improve and increase his product output. His experience will serve as an example to other small producers.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes for cultivation.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 27-year-old single man who is the sole earner for two other members of his family. He has been employed  for four years in a company that has to do with making special wood kitchens.

He used to work in motorcycle maintenance, but he discovered that he would like to improve his special wood talents and create special designs through working in a specialized company at the beginning to develop his talents and then start his own business. Thus, for this reason, Elias is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his own business through buying updated tools that will help him expand his own working sector.

He hopes that soon he can take the step forward towards having all his time be fully on his own business development.

loans.use: to buy updated tools

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en: Sophie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other members of the family. She has been operating an eating place for the last six years, working seven days a week. She does not have another source of income. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to stock cereals and charcoal, and to replace worn out saucepans. Her challenges include transportation. Her dream is to upgrade to a restaurant and open up branches, thus providing employment to more people. She joined MCDT-SACCO because of the hope to get loans for school fees. She and her husband live in a rented house with access to electricity, but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To stock cereals and charcoal, and to replace saucepans

loans.name: Yoern

texts.en:
Yoern is 64 years old and lives in Baray Dirstrict, Kompong Thom Province of Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers in the cassava field, which can earn USD 4 a day to support the family. She has involved in this business for more than ten years, so far.

Now, Yoern is requesting a loan from Kiva in the amount of KHR 3,000,000. She is going to use this amount of money to hire a tractor and some laborers to start her cassava farming. Yoern thanks the lenders for the financial support, via Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to hire a tractor and some laborers.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en: Muyassar was born in 1974. She is divorced and has two children. She is only breadwinner for children. With the aim of earning a living, she began her own business two years ago. Muyassar sells children's clothes. She sells in a local market where she has a store. Muyassar and her children live poorly because Muyassar’s business is their only source of income. She renews her assortment of goods every season because the business struggle is big in the local market. Muyassar is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy children's clothes for the new summer season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new summer season

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 17 años, 19 años y 21 años de edad. Rosa posee un negocio de venta de pupusas el cual ha adecuado  en su hogar de habitación. Tiene mucho tiempo de contar con el negocio por lo que ya cuanta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Rosa solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion and their three children (ages 17, 19, and 21). She has a business of selling “pupusas” (tortillas stuffed with various fillings) that is set up in her home. Rosa has been in business for a long time and she has many customers who buy from her each day.

Rosa is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in repairs to the roof of her home. The amount she requested will be used to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails in order to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Sheroz

texts.en:
Sheroz lives in a village. He is 19 years old.

Sheroz is a student in the first course at Tajikistan Polytechnic University. He studies at the faculty of finance and credit. He studies full-time. Sheroz likes to read books and analyze them. He has read many books. Sheroz lives with his parents. He is happy and loves his parents. They live together in an amicable atmosphere.

He is asking for a loan because he must pay for his tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Julissa Stefany

texts.es:
Julissa es una joven emprendedora, tiene 20 años de edad y vive en Punta Negra junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y apoyar a su familia es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas en la Universidad de la zona donde reside y desde hace más de 1 años trabaja como Asistente Administrativa en una prestigiosa empresa.
Julissa está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá arreglar y pintar las paredes de su vivienda así como cambiar el cerrojo de la puerta por uno que brinde mayor seguridad, de esta manera ella podrá seguir estudiando y trabajando para mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Julissa, age 20, is an enterprising young woman.  She lives in Punta Negra with her family.  She is a person with a great desire to get ahead and to help her family.  This is why she is studying for a degree in business administration at the area’s university.  She has been working as an administrative assistant for a prestigious company for more than a year.

Julissa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  With the support they have provided, she will be able to fix and paint the walls of her house.  She will be able to change the bolt on the door for one that provides more security.  This way she will be able to continue studying and working to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to fix and paint the walls of her house.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 34-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 6 to 12 years old. She describes herself to be determined, focused, and ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, shoes and bags. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good market.
