She will use the KES 20,000 loan to expand her business. Her business goal is to be the supplier for the entire region within five years. She hopes that in the future, she and her family are successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to expand her clothing business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman and has 4 children. She describes herself to be patient.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase more goods.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products to use in the salon. Her business goal is to have a big salon within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a business that is stable. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products to use in the salon

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a single woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be focused.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a permanent structure.

She will use the 98,000 KES loan to expand the business. She hopes that in the future she will become a better business person.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Ozodamo

texts.en: Ozodamo has experienced a lot of difficulties in her life. She is divorced and has two children. Her children are adults. For more than 23 years, she has been busy selling fabrics and women's clothes. She sells a variety of fabrics. Women buy fabrics from her and make dresses. Ozodamo tries to offer beautiful, high quality fabrics. She opened a new store some months ago and she is going to increase her working capital now because her new store is bigger than the previous one. She is asking for a loan of 5,100 somoni to buy fabrics. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to sell

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es: rosa de 32 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su esposo ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old and she has been working as a farmer for several years. This job has given her the necessary ability and knowledge to take care of her crops. Her main crops are corn and beans. She commercializes her crops in agencies that do the buying and selling of basic grains, these are close to her residence. With the profits she gets from her sales, she helps cover the family expenses. She lives in her own house with her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy farming supplies to help her cultivate her crops, such as: compost, seeds, fertilizers, and to improve the land shown in the picture. She’ll be able to have a better income and she’ll keep contributing to her household expenses without restrictions.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 2 to 16 years old. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells auto spare parts. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spares. Her business goal is to have a big auto spares shop and attract more customers within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a business that is stable and sustain her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Hadijja

texts.en:
Hadijja lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with one school-going child. She is also looking after her sister. 

Hadijja has been selling sweet potatoes in the market, at retail, for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to enable her to stock more sacks of sweet potatoes to sell. Her challenges include thieves and transportation. Her dreams are to buy land and to plant food, including sweet potatoes, and to upgrade to wholesale. 

Hadijja joined MCDT SACCO because it is easy to access credit and savings. She stays with her husband in a rented house, without access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an appliance (stove)

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is a 23-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a fall in demand. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to renovate the business premises and purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to grow her business into a boutique within five years.

loans.use: to renovate the business premises and purchase additional stock

loans.name: Doviko

texts.en:
Doviko used the previous loan to buy cement for construction of his house for rentals. He is a farmer who grows bananas and cassava to supplement his other businesses like piggery and rentals. He has a dream of seeing his children attain higher levels of learning. Doviko is a very enterprising man who started from a meek background selling a few pigs and graduated to weekly trading of at least eight pigs. Unpredictable weather changes are what he usually complains of.

Doviko intends to use the loan to plant Irish potatoes this season.

loans.use: to plant Irish potatoes this season.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hard-working entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan. She is 26 years old and has three children. Paul Francis, her husband, works as a fisherman. She manages a piggery and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market.  Aside from this she also operates a rolling store for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,200 in sales every week.

Daisy’s family is one of those affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what they lost. Daisy is taking out PHP 10,000 loan assistance to buy feed and additional hogs. She will be utilizing the loan to buy items and other products which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she hopes she will be able to raise more healthy hogs and that she will be able to give her children a good education and life through all their hard work.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 26-year-old, married man, living in Fort Portal Uganda. He runs a pool table business, earning a monthly salary, and he does farming in order to increase his monthly income. He faces a challenge of low capital, however, he has a vision of having a stable and healthy family. 

Tadeo needs a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: David Alivenis

texts.es:
David de 42 años de edad, es albañil, estudio hasta cuarto grado debido a la situación económica en que vivía junto a sus padres, le fue imposible continuar  estudiando, su esposa es ama de casa, procrearon 5 hijos de los cuales todos están solteros y viven todos juntos en la misma casa.


 David  se dedica a la pesca y a la recolección de conchas,  también sabe el oficio de albañilería y agricultura por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en dichas actividades las cuales aprendió de sus padres y un amigo,  él viaja un kilómetro en su lancha hasta donde va recolectar las conchas para ello lo hace con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposa.



El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz,  ya que tiene dispuesto sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y le hará unos arreglo al techo de su casa, dado que ya empezó la época lluviosa para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.



 David sus sueños y proyecciones son pues darle estudio a sus hijos,  mejorar cada vez su vivienda y poder seguir cultivando que Dios le de salud para  seguir trabajando para que esto se le haga realidad y gracias a los créditos espera lograrlos.
texts.en:
David, age 42, is a construction worker who studied until the fourth grade. Owing to the economic situation he lived in with his parents, it was impossible for him to continue studying. His wife is a homemaker, and they have five unmarried children who all live with them in the same house. 

David works in fishing and gathering conch shells. He also knows the construction and agriculture businesses because he has a lot of experience in these activities, which he learned from his parents and a friend. David travels a kilometer in his boat out to where he gathers shells, which he does with the help of his children and his wife. 

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy fertilizers for growing corn since he has prepared 7,000 square meters for planting, and he will make some repairs to the roof of his house so that his family can live in better conditions since the rainy season has already begun.


 David's hopes and dreams are: to give an education to his children, to continue improving his home, to be able to continue planting, and that God gives him health to continue working toward  making this a reality. Thanks to the loans he hopes to achieve these things.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing corn since he has prepared 7,000 square meters for planting, and he will make some repairs to the roof of his house.

loans.name: Freedom Group

texts.en: This group is made up of three members who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group representative is Rita (the woman standing at the far right in the photo). She is 25 years old and did not have the opportunity to frequently attend school. Rita is married to a man named Ransford. The couple has two children who are six and one years old. The various household expenses are met by Rita and her husband. In order to meet these expenses, Rita has been selling tuna fish for 10 years. Rita gets her supplies from a market in a cool store. In her quest to satisfy her customers, Rita, together with the other members of her group, is requesting a sixth loan from ID-Ghana. The previous loans were paid back in full.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Edelmira De Jesus

texts.es: edelmira de 42 años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 15 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista sale a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicida, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Edelmira is 42 years old and lives with her family in their own home.  She works cultivating corn and beans.  She has been working in agriculture for 15 years and this has given her much experience that allows her to produce better crops.  When her crops are ready, she goes to sell them at different markets near her home. She has many customers who prefer her crops for the quality, good prices and, above all, the great service.  

She needs to invest and, for this, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizer, herbicides, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photograph.  She assures that she will be able to pay off the debt in the established time period and, at the same time, she is confident that she will raise the economic security of her household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizer, herbicides, etc. and to improve the land

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
Jawad is a 26-year-old single man who has been employed in  a special house doors, electricity and window accessories business since September 2011. 

He is a hard worker who works hard to develop his living through establishing his own business in the future. 

Today Jawad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to do necessary maintenance to his car which is necessary for his transportation needs in his region.

Jawad is working hard to take his own step towards establishing his own business, but he has to make sure that he is financially capable of supporting his business in a well-managed way.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his car

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children between four and nine years old. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a salon where she offers salon services and cosmetic products. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are predominantly women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds from time to time. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of cosmetic products. Her business goal is to open additional branches within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of cosmetic products

loans.name: Roselia

texts.es: Roselia tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, dos hijos de 13 años y 12 años de edad y su pequeño nieto de 3 años de edad. Roselia es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos y además trabaja en una finca de café como jornal. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño sanitario y  para pavimentar el piso de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava, hierro, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en: Roselia is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her partner, two children ages 13 and 12 and her tiny grandson who is three years old.  Roselia is a very hardworking woman who provides domestic services and also works on a coffee plantation as a day laborer.  She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in the construction of a bathroom and to pave the floor of her home.  With the amount requested, she will buy cement, sand, brick, gravel, iron, etc. She hopes she can count on this financial support and with it improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, brick, gravel, iron, etc. to build a bathroom and to pave the floor of her home

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 to 13 years old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the poor weather. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to have a fully expanded grocery store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the products and materials needed in her business. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She previously accessed 25,000 PHP.

She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy party supplies, including party poppers, balloons, hats and souvenirs. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julieta dreams of expanding her business and have other sources of income. She hopes that her children will finish their education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for party supplies, including party poppers, balloons, hats and souvenirs.

loans.name: Yendry Gabriela

texts.es:
Yendry tiene 26 años de edad, es madre de tres niños, divorciada, pero actualmente esta conviviendo con su ex esposo, el papá de sus tres hijos. Ella me comenta que desde muy niña trabaja con su madre y hermanas ya que su mamá que también se dedica a lo mismo ha logrado salir adelante con sus seis hijos gracias a la maquila de diferentes prendas. Ella me indica que desde los 15 años de edad confecciona prendas bien acabadas, ya que su mamá les confeccionaba los moldes y ella debía armar la pieza, Yendry trabajo durante muchos años en una exportadora de Plantas Ornamentales de la zona, hace tres meses cortando el tallo de estas plantas se amputo su dedo meñique, eso no le impide trabajar en la confección de ropa, aunque no le ha sanado completamente.
Inicia con su actividad desde hace 15 años , ya que para ella desde muy niña le es muy normal ver máquinas y telas en su casa, en los últimos años ha logrado crecimiento, todas las personas de la zona le compran la ropa que confecciona, lo que la lleva a solicitar apoyo económico para comprar las tres máquinas propias.
Ella vende en forma ambulante, atendiendo clientes que trabajan en negocios, empresas y amas de casa, ha logrado consolidar una cartera amplia de 50 clientes en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Yendry is 26 years old. She is the divorced mother of 3 children but she is currently living with her former husband, the father of her 3 children. She says that she has been working since she was a little girl. She worked with her mother and sisters. Her mother, who does the same work, has provided for her 6 children through the manufacture of different garments. Yendry tells us that she has manufactured well-made garments since she was 15 years old. Her mother makes the patterns and Yendry assembles the pieces. Yendry has worked for many years as a leading exporter of ornamental plants from her area. Three months ago, when cutting the stem of these plants, she cut her finger. It does not stop her from working on garments, but it has not completely healed.
She began this work at 15 years, and since she was very young it has been very normal for her to see machines and fabrics in her home. In recent years, she has achieved growth. Everyone in the area will buy the clothing she makes which has led her to apply for financial support to buy three machines herself.
She sells in an itinerant manner, serving customers who work in businesses, companies, and to housewives. She has a broad portfolio of 50 clients in her community.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 63-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a banana farming business for both home consumption and commercial purposes. He is facing challenges of price fluctuation and weather changes.  However, he has a vision of having his project well established and becoming a model farmer. 

Peter needs a loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.name: Rwebigwara United Group

texts.en:
Naume is a 46-year-old lady who sells general merchandise like rice, sugar and cooking oil to the general public. She also practices farming to add to her income. She started business in 2000, and hopes to increase her output, although she is challenged by unpredictable changes in weather. 

She is a hardworking woman who needs a loan to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

Naume is a member of the Rwebigwara United Group, where members guarantee each other in order to acquire a loan. 

Also, the photo has i4 members who are all in the same group but only 11 have taken the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Juan Isidro

texts.es: Juan de 52 años de edad es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa, sus hijos ya son mayores y viven independientes, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista sale a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Juan solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plagas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juan, age 52, is very friendly and hardworking. He lives with his wife, and his children are grown and live independently. He works very hard on his own small plot of land where he plants corn and beans. His products  are of a very good quality; when his harvest is ready, he goes to sell them to different markets that are near to his home. 


Juan requests a loan from INTEGRAL to have the necessary money to invest in purchasing agricultural supplies like pest controls, fertilizers, manure, and seeds, among other things necessary for planting and improving the land that he shows in the photograph. Juan is eager to increase his sales to be able to make greater profits and give his family more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pest controls, fertilizers, manure, and seeds, among other things for improving the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy educational equipment for her daughter

loans.name: Risolatkhon

texts.ru: Рисолатхон добросовестная женщина. Ей 34 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 несовершеннолетних детей. Ее муж добрый человек, который всегда поддерживает ее. Рисолатхон более 15 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она два раза в год получает урожай. Рисолатхон в основном выращивает овощи. Она продает полученный урожай на местном рынке. С полученной прибыли она постепенно строит новый дом. Она всегда старается для того, чтобы улучшить условию проживания. Она должна сделать второй посев. Поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Risolatkhon is a conscientious woman. She is 34, married and has three young children. Her husband is a good man who always supports her. She has been growing crops for more than 15 years and has a harvest twice per year. She mainly grows vegetables and sells them at the local market. She is using the profits to save money and build a new house. She is always trying to improve the family's living conditions. She needs to complete the second planting of the year and applied for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline used the previous loan to buy shoes and clothes to sell. She sells secondhand shoes and clothes to earn a living. She started the business in order to raise money to support her family. Since she operates in the open, weather changes affect her business growth. Her dream is to own a modern boutique in town that that suits the current trends.

Jackline intends to use the loan to buy more shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, sheet, wood, and nails to build a shed.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, invirtió el préstamo anterior en la talabartería comprando cuero para realizar sus trabajos, lo que le ha dado muy buenos resultados ya que se ha mantenido trabajando y teniendo los ingresos económicos para costear los gastos familiares.
En está ocasión solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en otra actividad económica como lo es el cultivo de maíz,  comprara fertilizantes, semilla, abono, herbicidas y plaguicidas, espera tener una mejor productividad y una cosecha sin problemas de plagas.
texts.en:
José invested his previous loan in his leather goods business, buying leather to finish his jobs. This has given him very good results, since he has continued working and having the economic income to support the family expenses. 

This time he is asking for a new loan to invest in another business, which is the cultivation of corn: he will purchase fertilizer, seed, compost, herbicides and pesticides. He hopes to have better productivity and a harvest without infestation problems.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, manure, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Flor Mireya

texts.es:
La señora flor ha podido obtener una amplia experiencia como comerciante gracias a diferentes actividades que ha realizado.
Es una mujer organizada con empuje y dedicación, con sueños claros y convicción fuerte.
Ella desea iniciar con un negocio de ferretería buscando obtener unos mejores ingresos que le permitan tener estabilidad económica y por ende familiar.
Tiene grandes expectativas e ideas para su negocio; por ahora solo tiene el local y solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido y adecuación del establecimiento.
Este crédito le permitirá montar su proyecto productivo y eliminar la frustración de no ser independiente.
Ella sueña con tener un gran negocio que le de las garantías de un buen futuro para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Flor has been able to gain a lot of experience as a businesswoman thanks to different occupations she has had. She is an organize woman, driven and dedicated. Her dreams are clear and her conviction strong.
She wishes to start a hardware business to get a better income that will allow her to have some financial and familiar stability.

She has great expectations and ideas for her business. For now, she only has the store and she is requesting a loan to buy the supplies and to make the necessary changes to the shop.

This loan will allow her to set her productive project, and to eliminate the frustration of not being independent.
She dreams with having a big business that will secure a good future for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy the supplies for her hardware store and to make the necessary changes in the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, snacks, oil, toilet paper and detergent.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn 09 Xã Qlưu Group

texts.en:
Bình is 40 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She works in agriculture, raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and the main hardship that she faces is a lack of capital.

Bình is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 thôn 09 xã QLưu solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby chickens to raise and sell in the future. With her business profits, Bình hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby chickens to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Thôn 09 Qlưu Group

texts.en:
Nam is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children. She works in agriculture raising poultry, and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

Nam is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 thôn 09 QLưu solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Nam's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby chickens to raise and sell in the future. With her business profit, she hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby chickens to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 09 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Đức is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children. She operates a food stall selling vegetables, and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

Đức is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn 09 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She is applying for a loan to purchase vegetables to resell. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profits, Đức hopes to buy a motorbike, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Ambrocio Alcides

texts.es: Ambrocio tiene 67 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida. Ambrocio trabaja como ayudante de albañil y como jornal en una finca cercana a su localidad. Ambrocio habita en condiciones muy humildes y se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y visionario. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un muro de retención y para construir una champa. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, piedra, madera, lámina, etc. Dado que desea proteger su casa y sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en: Ambrocio is 67 years old.  He lives in his own house with his life partner.  Ambrocio works as an assistant bricklayer and as a farmhand on a nearby farm.  He lives in very humble conditions, and he is known for being a very hardworking and visionary man.  Ambrocio decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a retaining wall, and also to build a hut.  With the sum that he requests he will buy: cement, sand, stones, wood, sheets of corrugated metal, etc.  He is doing this to protect his house and his few belongings.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build a retaining wall and a hut

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated iron, nails, and cement in order to finish the construction of her house.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a married woman. She has three children between the ages of 5 and 14. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy water tanks to store water for selling. Her business goal is to have an independent business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy water tanks

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Mary, a mother with one child. She hails from Murang’a which is a rural town popular for pineapple and tea farming. Mary has been a farmer for only two years but she finds it to be very fulfilling! Her best part is waking up every day and heading out to the fields. However, her constant challenge is market uncertainties. Mary also engages in various personal businesses to make additional income to take greater care of her family. 

Mary is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. With this loan, Mary will increase her income through meat and egg sales. The potential for poultry product sales in Murang’a is very high. The additional income from this expansion will relieve the high farm-related expense burden on Mary’s shoulder. Her family will also get to enjoy other benefits that come along with increased income such as improved diet.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en:
Kellen used the previous loan to buy fresh food products to sell. She operates a stall where she sells fresh food products; she also farms in order to boost her income. She is facing the challenge of variable weather; however, she has a vision of buying another plot of land and improving her family's standard of living. 

Kellen has asked for a loan to buy more fresh food products to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food products to sell.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Visionarias Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Visionarias
Puntarenas

El grupo se integra y se visita por recomendación de una líder de la comunidad de Fray Casiano de Puntarenas. Se realiza la capacitación a un grupo inicial de 8 señoras, quedando 6 interesadas en completar la solicitud y trabajar en grupo por alcanzar sus objetivos principales, destacando el apoyo a la economía familiar y mejorar las condiciones de vida. Se organizan actividades de ventas de comidas y rifas, para fortalecer el trabajo e integración de las participantes.

Son 4 familiares y 2 vecinas, se han dedicado al comercio, comidas y actividades de costura, generando ingresos al hogar, apoyando la economía familiar, han trabajado con capital propio y esperan tener la oportunidad de empezar a crecer con el apoyo de Fundación Mujer y KIVA.

Cada una aporta a su hogar y desarrolla un negocio que le genera ganancias, se están organizando para realizar actividades, apoyarse entre ellas y generar ingresos adicionales para ahorrar y hacer de Mujeres  Visionarias una gran microempresa. Las compañeras se conocen y han trabajado juntas.

Condiciones: Actividades consolidadas en la comunidad, personas activas, puntuales, participativas. Entre ellas destaca la presidenta, Cintia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas en la comunidad de Fray Casiano, mujer con deseos de superarse, se capacita y aprovecha las oportunidades para apoyar a sus compañeras y a su familia, mujer de escasos recursos, ha sacado adelante su hogar y con esta oportunidad desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, vive con sus papás y hermanos y entre todos generan ingresos para el hogar. 
Ellas buscan desarrollarse integralmente, por lo que con este grupo desean participar en actividades comunales y regionales y esperan recibir el apoyo de Fundación Mujer para participar en ferias y otras actividades similares.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Visionarias
Puntarenas

The group is made up and visited by a community leader in Fray Casiano de Puntarenas.  Eight ladies were trained and there are six making this request and working as a group to achieve their main objectives of supporting their families financially and improving their living conditions.  They sell prepared foods and raffle tickets to strengthen the group.

They are four relatives and 2 neighbors and they sell food and sew, generating income for the household and supporting the family finances.  They have been working with their own capital and the hope to have the opportunity to begin growing, with support from Fundación Mujer and Kiva.

Each of the members has a home and develops a business that generates income.  She are getting organized to perform their activities, support one another, and generate additional income to share and turn Mujeres Visionarias into a great small business.  The members know each other and have worked together.

Conditions: Consolidated community activities, active persons, punctual, participative.  Among them, Cintia makes and sells food in the Fray Casiano community.  She has a desire to succeed and takes advantage of the opportunities to support her fellow members and family.  She is of limited resources, has gotten her household ahead, and wants to use this opportunity to improve her and her family’s living conditions.  She lives with her parents and siblings and the all generate income for the household. 

They want to develop themselves and want to participate in community and regional activities and hope to get support from Fundación Mujer to participate in fairs and other similar activities.

loans.use: to by merchandise.

loans.name: Faye

texts.en:
Faye is a very hard working entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan. She is 35 years old and has three children who are currently in school. Richard, her husband, works as a pastor in one of the local churches in the community. She manages a buy-and-sell business, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenses. 

What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from ready-to-wear clothing and eyewear to beads, bracelets and other similar products. She also sells rice, which she buys by the sack, and other goods. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

Faye’s family is one of the families affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what they lost. Faye is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase more products and merchandise to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she hopes to prosper through her business, for she desires to help her husband in his ministry.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her general store

loans.name: José Martír

texts.es: José tiene 61 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a su esposa. José es un hombre trabajador quien toda su vida ha trabajado muy duro para sacar adelante a su querida familia. Actualmente, cuenta con un negocio de tienda en la cual distribuye variedad de productos como: cereales, golosinas, detergente, aceite, café, pan dulce, etc. José solicita este crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la construcción de un muro de retención en su vivienda para proteger sus pocas pertenencias y a su familia. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, ladrillo, hierro, arena, etc.
texts.en:
José is 61 years old and resides in his own home along with his wife. He is a hardworking man who has toiled his entire life so that his beloved family can get ahead. José currently has a store where he sells a variety of products such as grains, snack foods, detergent, oil, coffee, sweet bread, and other items.

He is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that he can invest in the construction of a retention wall to protect his family and the few belongings in his home. The amount he requested will be used to buy cement, bricks, iron, sand, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, iron, sand, and other materials for building a retention wall.

loans.name: Rosa Fabiola

texts.es: Rosa se dedica a la crianza de chanchos en unas chancheras que le arrienda un señor, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los que 2 ya son casados y una de 15 años se encuentra estudiando, comenta que se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde hace 2 años cuando Fodemi le otorgo  el primer crédito, su esposo trabaja en la cuadrilla (personas que se reúnen diariamente en lugar esperando que llegue alguien y les de trabajo), el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para mejorar  su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa raises pigs in some pens that she rented from another gentleman. She is married and has three children, two of whom are married. The youngest child is 15 years old and in school. Rosa says that she began raising pigs two years ago when she obtained her first loan from FODEMI. Her husband is part of a work crew that meets every day at the same place in order to be taken to a job site.

Rosa’s loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs so that she can improve her business and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Keneya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du  groupe   Keneya  sont mariés équitablement dans des ménages  monogames et polygames, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce du poisson fumé, d’habits, du charbon de bois et  de pommes de terre. Dans l’intention de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Maï (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande  vendeuse du poisson fumé. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 corbeilles du poisson fumé en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à  Kanadjiguila et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Maï compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
he members of the Keneya group are married and living in monogamous as well as in polygamous families. On the average, they are 35 years old, with six children. They all live in Kanadjiguila, in the township of Mandé, district of Kati and know each other as neighbors as well as through their work as vendors at the market of  Kanadjiguila. The group members sell smoked fish, clothing, charcoal and potatoes. With the intention of replenish their stocks for cash, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity cycle.

Mrs. Mai (the one seated on the far left in the photo) is a well-known vendor of smoked fish. She plans to use her loan to buy three baskets of smoked fish wholesale in Médine. She sells retail, [at the market of] Kanadjiguila as well as a street vendor, mainly to female customers. With this loan, Mrs. Mai plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 90,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvested in her business and cover some minor household needs.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 23-year-old, single man who works hard for his living. He has been employed in a plastic-manufacturing company since 2012 and he is working hard to improve his experience in this domain.

Husein lives far from his work and transportation is very hard in his region, which puts him in an embarrassing situation among his colleagues and management. Thus, for this reason, he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to buy a small car, necessary for his transportation.

He hopes that, one day, he can establish his own business and develop his living.

loans.use: to buy a small car necessary for his transportation.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells soft drinks. She operates her business from a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy crates of soda, passion fruits, pineapples and powwows (fruits) for making juice. Her major business challenges include electricity and the perishability of her products. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a better fridge for storing juice and other soft drinks. 

She would also like to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy sugar, passion fruits, crates of soda and watermelon.

loans.name: Hamiya

texts.en: Hamiya is 40 years old. She is widowed and is bringing up a child. She has a higher education. She graduated from Pedagogical University. For the last two years Hamiya has worked in a local school. She is a teacher of math. Hamiya is a successful teacher with fresh ideas. Now, she is a student also. She is studying at the university to get more higher education. She is asking for a loan of 355 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Anthony Raul

texts.es:
Anthony es un joven emprendedor que tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Palpa junto a su familia.
Desde hace varios años trabaja transportando a personas a diferentes lugares de la Ciudad con un mototaxi que tiene, y con los ingresos que tiene ayuda a su familia con los gastos de su hogar. Le va muy bien porque es una persona dedicada a su trabajo, responsable y sobre todo porque transporta a sus clientes con mucha seguridad y respetando siempre las leyes de tránsito.
Anthony está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar herramientas para poder realizar mantenimiento a su medio de transporte de manera continua y así pueda obtener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia. También comprará algunos muebles para su vivienda como un juego de sala y un colchón y cama para así sentir mayor comodidad y bienestar en su hogar, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y él seguirá trabajando con el mismo empeño y entusiasmo con el que trabaja siempre.
texts.en:
Anthony is a young, 20-year-old businessman. He is single and lives in Palpa with his family. For many years, he has worked by transporting people on his mototaxi to different places in the city. With the income that he earns, he helps his family with household expenses. It is going well for him because he is dedicated to his job, responsible, transports his clients safely, and always obeys traffic laws.

Anthony is very grateful to Kiva lenders because the support they have provided will allow him to purchase tools to perform ongoing maintenance on his mode of transportation so that he can earn more money to help his family. 

He will also purchase some furniture for his home, like a living room set, a mattress, and a bed so that his home will be more comfortable and better. This way, he will improve his quality of life. He will continue working with the same determination and enthusiasm that he always has.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his motorcycle, a living room set, a mattress, and a bed.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She sells fried cassava, chapati, and other snacks at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cassava, cooking oil, cartons of baking flour, spices, and a bag of charcoal. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build permanent business premises. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, cassava, and baking flour

loans.name: Nidia Xiomara

texts.es: Nidia de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de  antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. que vende cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza y a la ayuda de su esposo han logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Nidia pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maiz para los tamales, platanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración y asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nidia is 44 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and their son. She makes a living by making and selling snacks like french fries, fried yucca, empanadas, tamales, etc., which she sells near her home. Thanks to the sales that she has made and her husband's help, she has been able to pay for household expenses. 

Nidia requests a loan to purchase products that she uses to make her food like oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and all other ingredients to cook. This way, she will be able to continue to support her family, pay for expenses that arise, and have a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and all other ingredients.

loans.name: Dora Lilian

texts.es: Dora tiene 47 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 21, 19 y 12 años de  edad. Dora se esfuerza mucho para sacar adelante a su familia ella se gana al vida trabajando como jornalera y además elabora y vende antojitos típicos. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la introducción del agua potable en su vivienda y para construir una pila para almacenar el agua, para lo cual necesita materiales como: arena, ladrillo, cemento, etc.
texts.en:
Dora is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her three children, ages 21, 19, and 12. Dora works hard to move her family forward. She makes a living by working as a day laborer, and also makes and sells traditional foods. 

Because she wants to improve her living conditions, she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in connecting her home to a source of potable water and building a sink to fill with water. For this, she will need materials like sand, bricks, cement, etc.

loans.use: to connect to a source of potable water and to build a sink.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, a mother of 4, has been a mixed farmer for 30 years! She lives together with her family in Kericho, Kenya. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, bananas and other food crop varieties - all produced at her farm. She is also involved in other small seasonal businesses. She gets her most enjoyment raising chickens and growing bananas. Her biggest challenge, however, is the market uncertainties.

Elizabeth is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She has been to various financial and agricultural trainings that have empowered her to take risks. She used to dread loans but today she perceives a loan as a stepping stone to success. Elizabeth looks for lenders with favorable interest terms and repayment periods.

With your loan, Elizabeth will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan and save an extra amount. The profits from the poultry are already committed to satisfying her family’s needs and relieving the burden of high farm input expenses.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the shop, add shelves, and install a display stand

loans.name: Arcenio

texts.es: Arcenio esta agradecido con los prestamisats kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, insumo, gastos de mantenimiento, de esta manera podrá tener una buena cosecha y poder mejorar sus ingresos, sobre todo porque es padre de dos  pequeños y todo su esfuerzo y sacrifico es con la finalidad de darle una vida digna y poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”
texts.en:
Arcenio is grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he will be able to purchase manure, fertilizer, and supplies, and pay for maintenance costs. This way, he will be able to have a good harvest and increase his income. 

He is the father of two young children, so every effort and sacrifice he makes is to provide them with a respectable life and achieve his greatest dream: "to have his own home and provide a good education to his children."

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Osmar Antonio

texts.es:
Tras haber tenido una larga jornada de trabajo, Osmar todavía tiene que recibir clases de Administración de Empresas por las noches, la pasión por su carrera es su principal energizante. Tiene 25 años, está soltero y cursa quinto año. Hace siete meses inició a laborar en una pequeña empresa, se encuentra satisfecho por la oportunidad laboral, espera ser bueno en ello para lograr buenas referencias.
Osmar solicita el crédito para pagar el proceso de titulación, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que no cuenta con el monto establecido. Su sueño es lograr culminar su carrera y desarrollarse en el ámbito laboral como un gran profesional. Es un joven emprendedor, inteligente y trabajador, su plan aparte de trabajar es seguir adquiriendo conocimientos, aspira a obtener un posgrado y una maestría. Sus padres y sus abuelos, son las personas que día a día lo motivan a cumplir sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
After a long day at work, Osmar attends Business Administration classes at night.  His passion for the subject is his primary motivator.  Osmar is 25 years old, single, and in his fifth year of study.  Seven months ago, he started working at a small company and is pleased to have this job opportunity.  He hopes to do well and obtain good references.  

Osmar is requesting a loan so that he can pay the cost of processing his degree.  He is placing his trust in this loan because the exact cost has not been established.  His dream is to finish his degree and grow in the workplace as a successful professional.  Osmar is an enterprising, intelligent, and hardworking young man.  Besides working, his plan is to continue acquiring knowledge.  He aspires to pursue postgraduate study and earn a Master’s degree.  His parents and grandparents are the people who encourage him each day to fulfill his goals and dreams.

loans.use: to pay the cost of processing his degree.

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San Marcos está en su ciclo número 8º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, y de esa forma poder ayudar también a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Julia, quien se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, ella en su última encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró un amplio progreso, por lo que está muy contenta y entusiasmada por seguir con su emprendimiento.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, colores, tintes y demás, para poder seguir haciendo sus artesanías, con lo cual mantiene y ayuda a su familia y seres queridos.
texts.en:
This group is named San Marcos. It is in its 8th loan cycle with the women's committees program, where they all work and help each other get ahead. This way they are also able to help their families.

One of the members is Julia, who makes a living making crafts. In her last poverty elimination survey she showed great progress. As a result, she is very pleased and enthusiastic to continue with her business. Today she asks for this loan to invest it in the purchase of fabric, thread, markers, dyes, etc. to continue making her crafts by which she supports and helps her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, markers, dyes, etc. to make crafts

loans.name: Yguazu Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Yguazu, está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comités, también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder ayudarlas a mejorar su situación.
Una de ellas es la señora Ydelina, quien es vendedora, tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día. Comenta que al principio le costó un poco empezar, pero que poco a poco se fue abriendo camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, condimentos, frutas, hortalizas y demás.
texts.en:
This group is called Yguazu. They are in their second loan cycle of the committee program and they are also doing the survey of poverty elimination, to be able to help themselves to better their situation. 

One of them is Ydelina, who is a saleswoman. She has a well stocked store in which she works every day from very early hours in the morning. She comments that in the beginning it was a little difficult to start, but that little by little she started to make progress. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of a variety of supplies for her store, such as vegetables, seasonings, fruits, leafy greens and other items.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, seasonings, fruits, leafy greens and other vegetables, for sale in the store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy working materials such as fabrics, threads, needles, etc. in order to sew a lot of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mario Edgar

texts.es: Mario tiene 41 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 16 años, 15 años y 14 años de edad. Mario se dedica a la venta de cinchos y carteras desde hace 10 años en las principales zonas de su localidad. Se esfuerza mucho para mantener la economía de su hogar. Mario habita en condiciones muy humildes y con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto para sus hijos  para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y adobes y para pagar la mano de obra necesaria para la construcción.
texts.en:
Mario is 41 years old and lives in his own home with his partner and their three children aged 16, 15 and 14. Mario makes a living selling belts and wallets in the major areas of his city for the last 10 years. He works hard to maintain the household finances. 

Mario lives in very humble conditions, and with the desire to improve his conditions he is requesting this loan from FUSIA to invest in the construction of a room for his children. To do this he needs materials like galvanized sheeting, wood, nails and bricks, and to pay for the necessary labor for the construction.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, nails and bricks, and to pay for labor to build a room.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children neither of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family member. She has been selling avocado fruits at retail prices from the market for five years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to be able to stock more avocado fruits to sell and buy trees for future supply. Her challenges include thieves and the short life span of avocado fruits. Her dream is to acquire land and plant avocado trees and other fruits. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans and to save money. 

She stays in her own house with no access to either electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: To buy avocado seedlings.

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es: Gilma de 35 años de edad es una mujer muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto con su grupo familiar, ella es muy trabajadora, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora su principal siembra es el maiz y frijol. Gilma desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, entre otros, y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así ella seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Gilma is 35 years old. She is a very responsible woman with her household obligations, given that she has always been characterized as giving her family the best. She currently lives with her family.

She is very hardworking. She has always worked with joy and enthusiasm. She makes a living being a farmer, and her main crops are corn and beans.

Gilma wants to increase her sales and that is why she went to the offices of INTEGRAL, to request a loan that would allow her to buy: manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and weedkiller, among other things, and improve the land that the photograph shows.

She wants to have the requested help because she has no other monetary income and that way she can keep taking the daily bread to her household without limitations.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and weedkiller, among other things, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
This is Valentina, 39, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Remmel, a worker abroad, and she is a mother to her child. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.       
                      
Valentina operates a van rental business. She has 1 van that they offer to be rented for transportation service or for people who need a van for out of town service. They provide their services within the city & nearby provinces. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her van.

Valentina dreams to have more van units and hopes to give her child a good education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of her van.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick, a progressive farmer from Litein, has been doing dairy farming for the last 10 years. He is particularly passionate about dairy farming. His main sources of income are milk, eggs and other personal businesses. 

Like any serious dairy farmer, Erick takes animal health very seriously. He drenches drugs to his dairy animals from time to time - an activity he really enjoys! However, he says the major challenge to dairy farmers in his area is lack of quality breeds of animals.
 
Erick is seeking a loan to purchase a good quality dairy cow. This cow produces more than 20 litres of milk daily. Milk sold from this cow will provide Erick with a significant amount of income on a daily basis and enough to clear loan repayments on time. 

Erick has a clear business plan. Juhudi Kilimo, smallholder farmers’ microfinance, has been very encouraging and supportive to such progressive farmers. We want his farm to be an example to other farmers who have potential but are constrained by funds. Erick says the extra income he will generate will enable him to save enough money to buy a pedigreed dairy cow.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 39 years old and married with five children who are all in school. She works hard to provide for her family. Maribeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like rice, salt, snack foods and other groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from farming sugar cane and pig fattening.

Maribeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, salt, snack foods and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a resident of Kericho. He sells milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops as a means of livelihood. Having been influenced by the success of poultry farmers, he became part of Juhudi Kilimo through a group he mobilized so as to qualify for a loan.
 
The father of 3 is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. He wants to get started with a couple of units of broiler poultry birds on his premises. At present, he has 34 years of experience in farming. He is confident that he will take good care of the poultry he plans to acquire in order to maximize their productivity. 

Previously, Sammy was focusing mostly on fish farming, but recently he saw the need to diversify since the fish market has various forthcoming challenges. With your loan, Sammy dreams of expanding his poultry farming to full capacity. Juhudi Kilimo will keep intervening to provide such progressive farmers with help on technical know-how, extension services and marketing opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Zihiruka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Maramuke, âgée de  50 ans est  mariée à un  homme d’affaire et ensemble ils ont  13 enfants  tous  scolarisés. Présidente du groupe de credit  Zihiruka, elle étale sa marchandise au marché central de la place. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter  15 douzaines de souliers homme. Son objectif est de scolariser ses enfants jusqu’au niveau supérieur et améliorer son habitat. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de tout cœur pour le travail de développement économique des femmes pauvres actives.
texts.en: This client is named Maramuke. She is 50 years old, married to a businessman and they have 13 children that all attend school. She is the president of the Zihiruka credit group and she lays out her merchandise at the central local market. She requests this loan to buy 15 pairs of men's shoes. Her ambition is to send her children to high school and to improve her lodgings. So, she sends heartfelt thanks to Hekima for their work to improve the economic development of poor working women.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of men's shoes.

loans.name: Dionisie

texts.en:
Dionisie is 42 years old; he is married with four children. 

This is a new loan product for UOB. This is a new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) which will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire farmers to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. 


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store construction for maize production.

loans.name: Tahsin

texts.en:
Tahsin is a client with special needs from Iraq. He is 49 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom appears in the picture. He is the only provider for the family. 

Tahsin owns a grocery store. He sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He established his business in 1996. He has built up good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area. He has an excellent reputation. 

Tahsin is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business more and expand his shop in the future so he may increase his profits and make more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en:
God's Time Group is made up of two members who both live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Mary, is the woman standing on the right in the photograph.

She's 59 years old and married to Prince. The couple has one dependent child. Mary lives with her husband and child and, together with her husband, makes sure the various expenses of the household are covered. For almost 31 years, Mary has been selling salted fish and spices in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies in a market in Ghana.

Mary and the other member are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner ID Ghana, in order to bolster their working capital and better meet their customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy salted fish and spices and sell in her neighborhood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase plantains and shellfish from farmers and fishermen to make and sell corviches.

loans.name: Mauricio De Jesús

texts.es:
Mauricio de 37 años,  estudio hasta  6º grado,  le fue imposible seguir estudiando por el nivel bajo económico que vivió con sus padres, esta acompañado,  su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, procrearon  3 hijos los cuales  2 estudian y viven en la misma casa y dependen económicamente de él.


 Mauricio se dedica a la pesca y a la venta de minutas, también sabe la profesión de albañilería por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en dichas actividades, las cuales aprendió de sus padres y un amigo,  él viaja un kilómetro en su lancha hasta don de va a vender minutas y por las noches a la pesca  lo cual lo hace con su esposa y su hijo mayor. Ademas, de esas actividades, también cultiva maíz para consumo familiar.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar fertilizante para el cultivo de maíz,  ya que tiene dispuesto sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y le realizara una reparación a la maquina de moler hielo para  tener mas ingresos  para  que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 37 years old, studied until 6th grade.  It was not possible for him to continue studying due to the low economic level he was living at with his parents.  He is in a relationship, and his wife spends her time on household chores.  They have had 3 children, 2 of whom study and live in the same house, and are financially dependent on him.

Mauricio makes his living fishing and selling shaved ice snacks.  He also knows the construction trade, so he has a lot of experience in these activities, which he learned from his parents and a friend.  He travels one kilometer in his boat to where he goes to sell shaved ice snacks, and he spends the nights fishing, which he does with his wife and oldest son. He also cultivates maize for household consumption. 

The loan is applying for from CREDICAMPO is to buy fertilizer for his corn crop, because he has 7,000 square meters of corn ready for planting.  He will also make a repair to his ice-crushing machine, in order have more income so that his family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn crop, since he has 7,000 square meters of corn that are ready for planting, and to make a repair to his ice-crushing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to set up a worm compost production and distribution business

loans.name: Delmi Elizabeth

texts.es: Delmi tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de ocho años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Delmi se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos típicos como: tamales, pupusas, sopas, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y colabora con la economía del hogar. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI  para invertir en la construcción de un servicio sanitario  de fosa séptica para el cual necesita materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, grava, etc.
texts.en:
Delmi is 27 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and her 8-year-old daughter, who studies at the town's public school. Delmi makes and sells typical snacks like: tamales, pupusas, soups, etc. This is how she makes her living and collaborates with the household economy.

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a septic tank sanitary system, for which she needs materials like: cement, sand, bricks, iron, gravel, etc.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, gravel, etc. to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, two of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other member of her family. She has been operating a retail shop for the last three years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more soda, sugar, drinking water and detergents to sell. Her challenges include collecting money from debtors. Her dream is to move to a bigger shop and increase stock. She joined MCDT because the organization puts emphasis on lending to poor women.

She rents a house with no access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and soda.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her since she was able to buy more products for her business. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has an apartment, for additional income.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 51,000, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merlinda dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a better living. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners that gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hagijah

texts.en:
Hadija lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with 7 children, and three of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and cassava. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses and buy a van for transporting green bananas from villages to the market for sale. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas and cassava.

loans.name: Kholbiby

texts.en:
