Kholbiby, a married mother of two, is a sewer who has always wanted to be a successful business woman and to get ahead in life. In business for more than 13 years, Kholbiby sews national woman dresses in her own workshop where she provides services to her clients. 

Kholbiby is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy a TV set for her workshop because she wants to improve her working conditions to attract more clients. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a TV set for her workshop

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 34 years old. He is a farther of four children. This is a new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) which will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire farmers to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a warehouse/store for maize production.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 25 years old. She is married with three children and they all go to school. Her husband worked as a farmer for the past 12 years in field of farming, and they all enjoy farming, especially maize. This is a new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) which will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire community to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Meranie

texts.en:
Meranie is 41 years old. She is married with seven children. This is a new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) which will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire community to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store construction for maize production.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 32 years old. She is married with three children.This is a new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) which will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire community to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Brenda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Los pasos de los padres y las madres, son el ejemplo a seguir de cada hijo e hija. Desde pequeña, Brenda miraba a su madre cómo se levantaba a las 5 de la mañana, para preparar la yuca, el chicharrón y la ensalada del vigorón que ella vendía.  Admiraba los deseos de superación de su madre. Tiempo después fue ayudando a su madre. Luego, hace 15 años, decidió emprender su propio negocio como comerciante de vigorón en distintos puntos de Granada. Ahora es madre de una adolescente de 17 años, quien ya está en la universidad y que diario ayuda, sin interrumpir sus estudios, a su madre, como lo hacía Brenda cuando estaba a punto de establecerse en su negocio.
Brenda no alcanzó a estudiar su universidad, por lo que la motiva a seguir trabajando para ayudar a su hija a cumplir su sueño de convertirse en una profesional. Desafortunadamente no tiene más ingresos, por lo que necesita de un préstamo para comprar yuca, chicharrón, repollo, bolsas, platos y otros materiales para su negocio. Además piensa que con esta ayuda los clientes van a incrementar y podrá ahorrar para comprar más sillas y mesas, para ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
A father’s and mother’s steps are examples for every son and daughter to follow.  Since she was small, Brenda watched her mother get up at 5:00 am to prepare the yucca, pork rinds, and vigorón salad that she sold.  She admired her mother’s desire to succeed.  Later she helped her mother and then 15 years ago she decided to start her own business selling vigorón in different parts of Granada.  Now she is the mother of a 17 year old girl who already attends university and who helps out daily, as Brenda helped her mother when she was setting up her business, without interrupting her studies.

Brenda was not able to study at university and this motivates her to continue working so she can help her daughter achieve her dream of becoming a professional.  Unfortunately she doesn’t have another income and needs a loan to buy yucca, pork rinds, cabbage, bags, plates, and other things for her business.  She also believes that this loan will help increase her number of customers and she will be able to save up to buy more tables and chairs so she can provide better service.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 33 years old. She is a mother of three children. 

This is a new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) which will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire community to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with six children, and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

Annet sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of UGX 500,000 from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy pineapples, watermelons, onions, cassava, vegetables, and a box of tomatoes. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Romareice

texts.es: Romareice es una curioso mujer a la cual toda la vida se le inculco el valor del trabajo y el sacrificio por sus seres queridos y desde entonces en todas las etapas de su crecimiento fue trabajando y ganándose ella misma el dinero para satisfacer sus necesidades, pero con la llegada de sus dos hijos tuvo que frenar muchos proyectos que tenía pues debía dedicarse de lleno al roll de madre, aprovechando que sus hijos ya son más grandes vio en la gran sala de su casa una oportunidad para montar un negocio, una tienda que le permitiera colaborarle a su pareja en los gastos del hogar, una oportunidad para comenzar a forjar el futuro estudiantil de sus dos amados hijos ya que los estudios universitarios son muy costosos, por ende solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido; grano, Dulces, gaseosas pues su tienda carece de muchos productos y ya que tiene tiempo se dedicara de lleno a su negocio pues sabe que dé él depende gran parte el futuro y la educación con la que se formaran sus dos retoños.
texts.en: Romareice is a curious woman to whom life has been instilled with values of hard work and sacrifice for loved ones. Since then, she has grown up working and earning her own money to meet their needs. Upon the arrival of her two children, she had to stop many of her projects so that she could devote herself to the role of being a mother. Now she has the advantage of having older children. In the great room of her home, she saw an opportunity to start a business, a store, that would allow her to collaborate with her partner to pay household expenses. She saw an opportunity to begin to shape the future of their two beloved children who are students since university studies are expensive. She is requesting a loan to purchase an assortment of grains, sweets, soda, and more for her shop because it lacks many products. She has devoted herself to this business because she knows that a large part of their future depends as does the education of their little ones.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Lukman

texts.en:
Lukman runs a small stall where he sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Purwokerto, a semi-urban area about ten hours from Jakarta. Lukman is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Lukman began working with Ruma two months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man who has four children. When asked, he describes himself as focused.

For the past five years David has operated a bakery. He sells to the general public. He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of capital.

David is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through SMEP. He will use his loan for capital improvements.

loans.use: to make improvements to his bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Carsum

texts.en:
Carsum runs a small stall where he sells mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Purwokerto, a semi-urban area about ten hours from Jakarta. Carsum is married and lives with five people in the family home. As seen in the picture, Carsum is with his daughter.

Carsum began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.es: ANTHONY  de 23 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad  de ingeniería de sistemas que estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Con la ayuda de sus padres, Anthony  con mucha dedicación a sus  estudios está logrando un buen record de notas y así poder ser un buen ingeniero.  Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Anthony    se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a Kiva y Edaprospo.
texts.en:
Anthony is 23 years old, single and without children. He is a friendly student in the department of Systems Engineering. He studies a lot in order to achieve his goals in life.  With the help of his parents and with a lot of dedication to his studies, he is managing to have a record of good grades.  This way he will be able to be a good engineer.

With this loan Anthony will pay his room and board at the university and will purchase the supplies that he needs to study. Anthony is very grateful for the help.  As a parting note, he has a great desire to achieve his proposed goals.  He is grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo.

loans.use: to pay his room and board at the university and to purchase the supplies that he needs to study.

loans.name: Amita

texts.en:
Amita is a 45-year-old woman of Maynaguri. She lives with her husband, Pabin, and two children (one son and one daughter) in the village of Khagrabari. She is illiterate, and just can sign her name due to her parental monetary problems, but she is dedicated to providing a good education to her children. They are attending their school regularly and studying in different grades.

Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates different types of vegetables and sells them in the local market. Being a housewife, Amita manages all the household work and then assists her husband in the farming activities. Both of them give hard labor to take care of their family, but are unable to provide sufficient income.

Amita wants to extend her helping hands to her husband. She has decided to cultivate jute on her farmland, as it is a most important profitable crop. So, she thinks this will be a lucrative business because jute fibers are commonly used in making ropes, bags, sacks, canvas, gunny bags, twine, carpets, curtains, twining threads, and covers for cotton bales. 

She has taken the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase jute seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation as early as possible. She is very hopeful to earn profit from this new cultivation, which will help her to reach her goals of giving a decent lifestyle to her family and educating her children to establish them in life. 

Amita and her husband are very much thankful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for giving them the loan.

loans.use: to purchase jute seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating jute on her own farmland.

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine lives in Vanadzor in the Lori region of Armenia. She graduated from the Department of Obstetrics at Vanadzor State Medical College, then for twenty years worked as a head nurse. She is now head teacher of the nursing department at the college.

As Hermine says, she has always loved working as a nurse, especially in regard to those aspects dealing with her specialty. Now, however, there is a medical problem upsetting her. Her beloved niece is very sick, and the doctor has urgently suggested surgery. Of course, Hermine desires that her niece be examined and operated on as soon as possible.

So Hermine is applying for this 400,000 AMD loan through Nor Horizon to pay for her pretty niece’s surgery. She hopes that, thanks to this loan, her niece will recover and be well very soon.

loans.use: to pay for her niece’s urgent surgery.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 29 years old, married to Peter and has three children between seven and twelve years of age. For the past four years she has run a shop where she sells assorted kinds of clothing. This brings her a monthly income of approximately 20,000 KES.

Teresia is applying for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She is requesting 40,000 KES to buy additional clothes to sell. She plans to use the anticipated income to expand her business and educate her children. She hopes to open a bigger store soon and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: La Divina De La Union Group

texts.es: El  Sr. WILFREDO   de  50  años de edad  conviviente y padre  de  1 hijo, el  Sr. Wilfredo  es taxista   ya hace unos  12 años el cual es su único fuente de ingreso, trabaja mucho para poder darle una buena educación a su hijo y salir adelante con su familia. El Sr. Wilfredo tiene clientes fijos el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener  su propio carro, para obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar repuestos para el carro Y así sus clientes puedan ir bien seguros. A la vez Sr. Wilfredo y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. El Sr. Wilfredo es el único caballero de la foto , Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Wilfredo lives with his partner and is a father to one son. Wilfredo has been a taxi driver for twelve years; this job is his only source of income. Wilfredo works a lot in order to give his son a good education and to prosper with his family. Wilfredo has regular customers, generating profits that allow him to cover household costs. In the future Wilfredo would like to own his own car, in order to earn higher profits. This loan will be invested in buying spare car parts so that his passengers may travel more safely. 

Wilfredo and all of the members of this loan group are grateful to Kiva for this loan, and for the trust being put in them. In the photo, Wilfredo is the only man. Wilfredo ends this message promising that he will achieve all of his targets.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts.

loans.name: Lesly Alinda

texts.es:
Lesly esta agradecida con los prestamisats kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar mejoras en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas; Lesly podrá comprar algunos estantes, pintado de local, mejoras en la puerta, así como también solventar algunos gastos, entre otros; asi su negocio se vera mucho mejor y podrá atender a sus clientes con mayor orden.

Lesly es una mujer muy trabajadora, ya que su pequeño negocio es su única fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante; de esta mnarea podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Lesly is thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they have provided her, she will be able to make improvements to her business, where she sells groceries and soda. 

Lesly will be able to buy some shelves, paint the store, make improvements to the door, take care of some personal expenses, and more, thus her store will look much better and she will be able to attend to her clients in a more orderly fashion.

Lesly works very hard, since her small business is her only source of income to get her ahead. By working hard, she can keep fighting to make her dream of owning a mini market a reality.

loans.use: to buy some shelves, paint the store, make improvements to the door, and more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional tomatoes and collard greens to sell.

loans.name: Marta Enit

texts.es:
Marta, de 36 años, es madre de dos hijos de 12 y 9 a los cuales ha procurado darles la mejor educación y estilo de vida que le ha sido posible.
Desea poder verlos convertidos en profesionales honestos y responsables.
Vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en el municipio de Rionegro, Antioquia y es allí donde tiene un taller de confección de uniformes escolares y de arreglos de modistería que le ha dado la oportunidad de trabajar y sobrevivir.
Ella solicita un préstamo para ampliar su negocio y tener un mejor nivel de producción comprando una maquina recubridora que le permita ofrecer un empleo y tener más trabajo.
Es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada en su trabajo pues tiene muy claro que esta es su única fuente de ingresos y vive muy agradecida con la vida por permitirle ser independiente.
texts.en:
Marta is 36 years old and a mother to two children, aged twelve and nine years old respectively. Marta has given her children the best lifestyle and education that she could. She wants to see her children become honest and responsible professionals.

Marta lives with her husband and two children in the Rionegro municipality of Antioquia, Colombia. There she has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given Marta the opportunity to work and survive.

Marta is applying for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production by buying a coverstitch sewing machine. This will allow Marta to offer employment to another person, and to have more work.

Marta is responsible and dedicated in her work; this is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a carpenter. He is married and has four children. When asked, he describes himself as optimistic.

For the past four years Kennedy has made furniture to sell to customers in a busy urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge as being lower in stock than he would like.

This will be Kennedy’s third loan with SMEP; the two previous loans were repaid successfully. He is applying for a 50,000 KES loan to buy more wood to make his furniture. He hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy more wood to make his furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops this season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies in order to expand his honey-producing business.

loans.name: Rider Jesus

texts.es:
Rider es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 31 años de edad y vive en Huanuco junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde hace más de 15 años se dedica a la Agricultura, cultivando diferentes productos como el plátano, frejol y maíz de muy buena calidad que son ofertados al mejor precio en el mercado.
Rider está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos para abonar la tierra, fertilizantes, así como también pagará la mano de obra del mantenimiento que pueda necesitar el cultivo hasta la etapa de la cosecha. Con esto, Rider obtendrá mayores ingresos que lo utilizará en comprar más tierras para cultivar y más adelante poder brindar una educación de calidad y una carrera profesional a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rider is an entrepreneurial man. He is 31 years old and lives in Huanuco with his wife and two children. He is a person who is eager to get ahead. He has made a living in agriculture for more then 15 years, cultivating different products such as bananas, beans, and high-quality corn, which are offered at the best price in the market. 

Rider is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support that they have offered him, he will be able to buy supplies to fertilize the land, such as compost and fertilizer, as well as paying for labor for the maintenance that the crops might need before the harvest.

With these, Rider will obtain a better income which he will use to buy more land to cultivate, and later, he will be able to provide a quality education and professional career to his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies to fertilize his crops, such as compost and fertilizer, and to pay for labor for maintenance

loans.name: Annabala

texts.en:
Annabala is an old woman of 50 years. She lives with her husband and one son in Bagjan village at Maynaguri. She is illiterate and able to sign her name only. Her son has completed his education up to grade ten.

Annabala is a housewife and manages all the household work, while her husband is associated with foundations of rural houses in their local area. As it is a very lucrative business, Annabala wants to expand the business. Due to lack of capital, they could not meet their expectation. 

As soon as Annabala heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner), she applied for a loan to purchase more raw materials (wood, bamboo, straw, mud, etc.) for foundations of rural houses. 

She hopes she will gain more profit from this business. Her dream is to give a high education to her son to establish him in life with the profit from her business.

Her full thanks go to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for building foundations of rural houses in her area.

loans.name: Juana De Jesus

texts.es: Juana de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, desde hace varios años se dedica a la pesca artesanal y es así como ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, cuenta con una lacha y algunas redes para pescar, Juana es una mujer muy trabajador y responsable con su familia y es por esa razón que ha decido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar trasmayos para continuar con su pesca ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana, 51, lives in her own house with her family members. She has been making a living in non-industrial fishing for several years, and that is how she has been able to get her family ahead. She has a boat and some fishing nets. 

Juana is a very hard-working woman and is responsible with her family, and it is for that reason that she has decided to request a loan from Integral. With the loan, she will be able to buy fishing nets to continue with her fishing, since this is her only source of work and income. In this way she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fishing nets

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.es: José tiene 44 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre. José se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día lo prefieren más. José desea reparar el techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado y el agua se filtra cuando llueve. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: José is 44 years old and lives with his mother in a house that they own.  José has worked for a long time as a traveling clothing salesman.  He now has many customers who prefer him more each day.  José hopes to repair the roof of his home because it is in poor shape and it leaks when it rains.  For this, he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in purchase of the needed materials such as galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails.

loans.use: purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase supplies, seeds, manure and fertilizers to continue with his business so he show that he is a person who is capable of having his own business.

loans.name: María Guillermina

texts.es:
María, estudio hasta primer grado, por razones de no haber más grados no pudo continuar aprendiendo, el padre de sus hijos falleció cuando los últimos aun estaban pequeños, tomando ella toda la responsabilidad de criar y enseñar a trabajar a todos. En la actualidad vive con una hija y dos nietas los demás de sus hijos ya están a parte. Las dos nietas dependen de los ingresos que ella consigue.


Ella es comerciante, una mujer muy emprendedora capaz de sobre pasar lo que propone, se dedica al comercio de ropa, ya tiene más de 6 años de dedicarse al negocio, la venta la realiza de casa en casa por diferentes lugares, anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero por su edad ya no se dedica a eso. No tiene más actividades a las que se dedique, la mercadería la tiene en su casa, para cuando sale a vender. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar pantalones, faldas, camisas, vestidos, ropa interior, ropa  de niño, etc. El mejoramiento que el préstamo le dará es el poder ofrecerles más variedad a los clientes, la necesidad satisfecha será el comprar por mayor  donde esto le genera un ahorro en sus compras y  una mejor ganancia.

Desea poder tener primero lo más necesario para ella y sus nietas, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad de generar más ventas y tener más clientela, las ganancias serán destinadas una parte al gasto de la casa, al pago de la cuota y en seguir invirtiendo.
texts.en:
María attended school until the first grade because there were no more grades, and she could not continue.  The father of her children passed away when the youngest were still small.  She took all the responsibility of raising them and teaching them to work.  Currently, she lives with one of her daughters and two granddaughters.  The rest of her children are already on their own.  Her two granddaughters depend on the income that she earns.  

She is a saleswoman.  She is an enterprising woman who is capable of achieving everything she sets her mind to.  She works selling clothing, and she has over six years of experience in this business.  She makes her sales from house to house in different areas.  Before this, she worked in agriculture, but based on her age, she no longer works as a farmer.  She has no other job.  She keeps her merchandise in her house for when she goes out and sells.

The loan that she is seeking from Credicampo will be used to purchase pants, skirts, shirts, dresses, underwear, children's clothing, etc.  The loan will allow her to offer more variety to her customers.  The loan will allow her to purchase merchandise in bulk, which will generate savings in her purchases and greater earnings.  

She first wishes to have all of the necessities for her and her granddaughters, which is why she plans to continue working as long as God grants her life and health.  The loan will help her satisfy her need of making more sales and attracting more customers.  The earnings will be used to cover household expenses, pay back the loan and continue investing.

loans.use: purchase pants, skirts, shirts, dresses, underwear, children's clothing, etc...

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain one Manzana of cacao [about 1.7 acres].

loans.name: Modesto Bonifacio

texts.es: Modesto es una persona con muchos conocimientos en las actividades del campos, se dedica a la Producción Agrícola y Ganadera de forma ordenada, aprovecha el potencial suelo y los recursos naturales como las buenas temporadas de lluvia en esta zona tropical, él necesita crédito para comprar diversos insumos agrícolas los cuales le permitirá realizar un control de plagas, enfermedades y desarrollo del cultivo de cacao, que actualmente producirá una manzana el que desea aprovechar en esta época de invierno dándole buen manejo y obtener una buena cosecha; por ende contará con mayores ingresos que serán de mucha importancia para su economía familiar.  Don Modesto trabaja en conjunto con su papa, por lo que ésta cosecha la realizaría en la propiedad de su padre quien le ha heredado sus conocimientos y manejo del campo, ademas al producir cacao aprovecharía la sombra y el buen clima que brinda este cultivo en la zona cercanas donde se alimenta de pasto el ganado.
texts.en:
Modesto has wide knowledge of work in the fields. He works in farming and cattle raising in an organized way. He takes advantage of the potential of the soil and the natural resources, such as good rainy seasons in this tropical area. He needs the loan to purchase farming supplies that will allow him to perform plague and sickness control, to grow his cocoa tree plantation. He will also grow apples during the winter season, obtaining a good harvest. This will provide better income for him, which is important for his family finances.
Modesto works alongside his father and this harvest will be performed in his father's land, from whom Modesto has learned the trade. Besides producing cocoa seeds, he will make good use of the shade and good weather provided by this crop in nearby areas where cattle feed.

loans.use: to set up and manage a cocoa tree plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase basic goods to stock her store.

loans.name: José Presentación

texts.es:
José de 43 años de edad,  no fue a la escuela, por no haber escuelas en la zona, pero la necesidad de tener un empleo lo llevo a tomar la iniciativa de inscribirse en un curso de alfabetización, donde aprendió lo necesario para desempeñar sus funciones, se casó a la edad de 28  años lo cual no funciono, hoy en día está acompañado nuevamente.


Él es empleado de la alcaldía desde hace más de 9 años, se desempeña como personal administrativo, anterior al trabajo que tiene se dedicaba a la agricultura, que la aprendió por medio de su hermano mayor. El trabajo le queda a unos 300 metros de su casa, lo cual se desplaza a pie, el horario que cumple es de  8 am a 4 pm.
  

El préstamo será invertido en la construcción de un corral para las gallinas, por lo que comprara cedazo, clavos y el pago de la mano de obra, también terminara de construir la cocina donde elabora los alimentos, también comprara teja,  madera y clavos. La mejora que el préstamo hara es el poder solventar las necesidades de la casa.

Preparar bien su casa para que en un futuro tenga mejor valor de adquisición, también seguir trabajando para tener lo necesario para vivir, la ayuda que el préstamo hara es el poder terminar los proyectos que están necesitando. Con lo que gana de su salario pagara la cuota y lo demás para los gasto de la casa.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old.  He did not attend school because there were none in his region.  The need to have a job led him to take the initiative of signing up for a reading class where he learned the necessary skills to work.  He got married at the age of 28, however it did not last.  Today, he is newly married.  He has worked for the town government for more than nine years.  He works on the administrative staff.  Prior to this, he worked as a farmer, which he learned from his older brother.  His job is about 300 meters away from his home, and he walks there.  He works from 8am to 4pm.

The loan will be used to invest in the construction of a pen for his chickens for which he will purchase mesh, nails and pay for labor.  He will also finish building the kitchen where he makes his meals.  He will purchase tiles, wood and nails.  The improvement that the loan will make is to cover the needs of his house.  He will prepare his house so that in the future it will have a better purchase value.  He will also continue working to have his living needs.  The loan will help him to finish the projects that he has left.  With his salary, he will pay back the loan and the rest will be used for his household expenses.

loans.use: build a pen for his chickens for which he will purchase mesh, nails, and pay for labor.  He will also finish building the kitchen where he makes his meals.  He will purchase tiles, wood and nails.

loans.name: Jeaneth Sidney

texts.es:
Jeaneth es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia la cual es también agricultora y comerciante, actividad con la cual genera los ingresos para cubrir los diferentes gastos en el hogar, casada y de su matrimonios tiene 4 hijos, la mayor quien es una fémina pero ella está acompañada, el segundo es un varón el cual le ayuda con su negocio, la tercera es una hembra y está en secundaria y el ultimo quien es varón estudia en la primaria y todos viven en su casa de habitación incluyendo su yerno. Buscándole salida a los problemas económicos y tratando de salir adelante ella y su esposo trabajan desde hace 10 años en la siembra y cultivo de café ya que en la zona es un producto muy buscado y vendido por los habitantes pues el clima cálido, la tierra fértil y el cuidado que ella y su esposo dan al mismo es pieza clave del éxito de su negocio. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados aproximadamente a 15 kilómetros de distancia desde su casa de habitación en la cual se involucran en familia una vez llegado el tiempo de corte y recolección del grano siendo ella quien lleve el control del grano cortado para su venta posteriormente. Diariamente trabaja muy duro con su negocio y principalmente con su familia.  
En esta ocasión ella solicita un apoyo financiero por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva para poder pagar los costos médicos en el hospital y los diferentes tratamiento que un familiar de ella necesita. Su más grande deseo es poder tener nuevamente a su familiar con salud pues es una persona joven y con una vida por delante.
texts.en:
Jeaneth is a woman who is very dedicated to her family and she is also a farmer and businesswoman. This job generates the income to cover the various household expenses. She is married and has four children; her oldest daughter is married, the second is her son who helps her out with her business, the third is her daughter in high school, and the last is her son who is in elementary school. All her children live in her home, including her son-in-law.

Looking for a way out of their financial problems and trying to get ahead, her and her husband have been working for 10 years planting and growing coffee beans, since this product is sought after by residents and sells out in the area. The warm climate, fertile land and, at the same time, the care that her and her husband give are the main reasons for the success of their business. Their coffee crops are located approximately 15 kilometers from their home. Once it is time to cut and gather the coffee beans, the whole family is involved, but Jeaneth is the one who is in charge of selling the beans afterwards. She works very hard every day for her business and especially for her family.

She is asking for support from Kiva investors to pay for the hospital costs and the different medical treatments needed by a family member. Her biggest wish is that her family member recovers because the family member is a young person with their whole life ahead of them.

loans.use: to fully repay the medical expenses and treatments received among other tests.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 59 años de edad y trabaja como albañil desde hace cinco años aproximadamente. Carmen es un hombre muy trabajador y visionario quien siempre esta pendiente de mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Carmen solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda para lo que necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder contar con el financiamiento y así reparar el techo lo antes posible.
texts.en: Carmen is 59 years old and has worked as a bricklayer for about 5 years. Carmen is a very hardworking and visionary man who is always ready and willing to improve his living conditions. Carmen is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the repair of the roof of his home, for which he will require materials such as: galvanized sheet, wood and nails. He hopes that he can count on the funding so that he can repair his roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet, wood and nails to repair the roof of his home

loans.name: Ana Geysel

texts.es: la señora  vive en el municipio de chichigalpa,departamento de chinandega,como característica principal de este municipio es la producción de caña de azúcar y fabricación de ron,la señora  es soltera tiene 4 hijos en edades escolares cuenta con un negocio de fabricación de tortillas en el mercado municipal de chichigalpa desde hace 16 años ella inicia un dia de trabajo desde las 5:00 am hasta ls 4:00 pm ya que la venta de tortillas es para los tres tiempo de comida (desayuno,almuerzo,cena) con el trabajo que ella desempeña es el pilar de su familia.
texts.en: Ana lives in Chichigalpa municipality in Chinandega department. This area is known for its sugar cane and rum. Ana is single, has 4 school-age children and has a business making tortillas in the Chichigalpa municipal market for 16 years. She begins the day at 5 AM and works until 4 PM as selling tortillas is helpful for the three meal times of the day (breakfast, lunch, dinner). With this work she supports her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her food to sell.

loans.name: Ahiya

texts.en:
Ahiya is a 48-year-old, married woman and together with her husband, is raising one son. She is illiterate and able to sign only her name. She is married to Abdul, who is a local van driver by profession. Her only son is working as a mason in her area due to poverty. They are from a remote village of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made).

Her husband pulls a van, rented from a local owner. Ahiya is engaged in livestock as an additional source of income for her family. She started this business a few years back, as she was unable to run her family with her husband's small income. Every day she gets up at early dawn, does all the household work and then looks after her animal husbandry business. Ahiya is a very hardworking lady and has a great dedication to her work.

Now she is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase another dairy cow with the aim of starting a business of milk products.  She hopes she will earn more profit from this business, as the products (butter. Paneer, curd, and cheese) are in great demand in her present local market. She plans to invest the profits in the future acquisition of more cattle.  She also intends to save money for her son’s future as well as to build a Pakka (made of bricks) house for her family.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for making her dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a dairy products supply business.

loans.name: Enoc

texts.es:
Enoc de 27 años de edad,  estudio hasta octavo  grado,  ya grande de 10 años empezó a ir a la escuela ya que no existían cerca de donde vivian cuando se estaba creciendo.  Está casado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar con quien ha compartido dos años su vida.  Su hija recién nacida es la que vive con ellos.

Él se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 16 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su padre por medio de las correcciones que le hacía fue como lo hizo que fuera una persona de bien para la sociedad. Por el tipo de actividad de la zona es que se dedican solamente a la agricultura. Enoc ha sido un hombre responsable, se está estrenando como padre,  sin abandonar sus responsabilidades.  El trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, nadie más se dedica a la actividad, y su horario de trabajo es de 6 am a 11 am.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para la preparación de la  tierra para la siembra,  compra de semilla, abono, herbicidas , pago de mano de obra y pesticidas  para los cultivos hoy que viene la época de invierno, con el préstamo pagara personas quien le ayuden con los trabajos, ya que él solo le cuesta, pero la costumbre del trabajo lo tiene siempre ocupado. 

Desea tener primero lo más necesario para su recién nacida y su esposa, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad el poder comprar los insumos que necesita. A la venta de la cosecha una parte la destinara para la venta y pago de la cuota del crédito y lo demás para el consumo.
texts.en:
Enoc is 27 years old and studied until the 8th grade. He began going to school at the age of 10 since there weren't any schools close by to where he grew up. He is married, his wife takes care of domestic household activities and they have shared two years of their lives together. His newborn daughter lives with them.

He makes a living in agriculture, and has more than 16 years of experience. His father, through the lessons he taught him, is the one who made him into a person who contributes to society. In the area where he lives, the people primarily make a living in agriculture. Enoc has been a responsible man who pushes himself just as his father did, without abandoning his responsibilities. He works close to his home, traveling on foot. Nobody devotes himself more to his job, and his work schedule is from 6 a.m. until 11 a.m.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is for the preparation of the land for sowing, the purchase of seeds, manure, herbicides, the payment of labor and pesticides for his crops. Since winter is coming, he will use the loan to pay the people who help him with his work. He is accustomed to always being busy.

He wishes first to have all that is necessary for his newborn daughter and his wife. For this reason he hopes to always work as long as God blesses him with health and life. The loan will help him buy the supplies he needs. Upon selling his harvest, part of his income will go toward his sales and paying off his loan and the rest will be for consumption.

loans.use: to prepare the land for sowing, buy seeds, manure, herbicides, and to pay for labor and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motor to accelerate his work and implement technology in his locale.

loans.name: Gangadebi

texts.en:
Gangadebi is a young lady, only 20 years old. She lives in the village of Khagrabari at Maynaguri. She lives there with her only child and husband, Khagen. Her child is now a kid, below school-going age. She has attended school up to grade five. Being a housewife, she takes care of her child as well as her family. 

Her husband provides cable connection in his neighborhood. He started this business a few years back, but his income is inconsistent. He wants to enhance his business by providing the cable connection to almost all the places in his local area, but needs sufficient capital. 

For this reason, Gangadebi requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s Partner) to invest in their existing business of providing cable connection. With the loan money, her husband will buy wires and set top boxes, and provide the cable connection to almost all the places in her village and gain more profit. She hopes she can enhance her business with the profit.

Gangadebi and her husband are very happy after getting the loan and give thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for the existing business of providing cable connection in her local area.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is a 22-year-old young woman of Dhupguri. She lives with her husband, Majinur, in the village of Board School Para. She has completed higher secondary level education, but her husband has attended school up to grade eight.

Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates different types of vegetables and sells them in the local market. Being a housewife, she manages all the household work and then assists her husband in the farming activities. Both of them give hard labor to take care of their farmland and to generate income.

Now they decided to cultivate cucumbers on their farmland, as it is a most useful and profitable vegetable. So, she thinks this will be a lucrative business because cucumbers are in great demand in her area, mostly in the summer season. She has taken the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase cucumber seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation as early as possible.  

She is very hopeful to earn a profit from this new cultivation, which will help her to reach her goals of leading a decent lifestyle. Hasina and her husband are very much thankful to the lenders for giving them the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating cucumbers on her own farmland.

loans.name: Noerine

texts.en:
Noerine is 56 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children. For the past 10 years, Noerine has been working hard to manage her restaurant, where she sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Noerine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more food to cook, and will help Noerine to generate greater profits and improve on her family's basic needs. Noerine hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Noerine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Noerine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock for more food to cook.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells hardware products. She has been involved in this business for seven years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to purchase additional hardware stock

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya lives at the frontier village of Aygehovit in Tavush region. Now she lives alone since her husband died many years ago and her children are already married and live with their families. Amalya’s grandchildren visit her very often and as Amalya says, they become the greatest happiness of her life. Amalya is a very active and hardworking woman since she became a widow when she was very young and she got used to her life full of hardships, which she would overcome alone without anybody’s help. Now she works at the school as a cleaner and at the same time, runs a farming and agriculture business. On her cute farm, she has 12 chickens and thanks to them, she sells eggs and chickens. On her plot of land, she cultivates beans and corn and she has fig and persimmon trees. The sale of her farm products allows Amalya to provide her living and support her beloved grandchildren.
 
Amalya is asking for this loan and hopes very much to get it. She wants to buy chickens and fodder for them and hopes to organize some agricultural work in her fruit garden.

loans.use: to buy chickens and fodder

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be focused and determined. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a promising location and his primary customers are individuals. 
He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

Charles will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to have a large scale grocery store within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 35-year-old married woman. She has three children, and she describes herself to be honest. She operates a food business where she sells chicken. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

Grace will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to own a large store within five years.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman, and she has a child who is three years old. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

Margaret will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of shoes. Her business goal is to be the biggest stockist of shoes within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of shoes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman, and she has four children ranging in age from five to thirteen years. She describes herself to be industrious. 

Grace operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather. 

Grace will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell. Her business goal is to have a hotel within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Voskehat

texts.en: Voskehat is 49 years old and lives with her children in the frontier village of Aygehovit in Tavush region. Voskehat has already been divorced for 10 years and all the care and numerous needs of her three children are her duty alone. Her elder son now is in the army, her second son and her daughter are still school-aged. During these years, she worked in different places as a worker and a milkmaid and finally became engaged in farming and agriculture. Simultaneously with farming, she also works as a cleaner at the school. Voskehat dreams of a bigger farm than she has now; in her farm she has a pig, 25 chickens and a plot of land on which she mainly raises fruit trees. Her children help her very much and from the farm, they sell eggs, meat, grapes, corn and persimmon. As Voskehat says, thanks to her farm’s income she can keep her children dressed and shod. That is why she wants to develop her farm and agriculture.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy three more pigs and fodder for it. She will also organize work in her orchard and vineyard.

loans.use: to buy three more pigs and fodder

loans.name: Aboda

texts.en:
Aboda is a 51-year-old married woman and her husband Chhamchher is 62 years old. Aboda and her husband are illiterate and can just sign their names. Aboda is a mother of one child who is working as a driver due to poverty. She lives in the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri. 

Her husband cultivates different types of vegetables and sells them in the local market. Aboda cares for her own livestock after managing all the household work. Due to the lack of capital, she could not increase her livestock.
 
Now Aboda thought to buy a useful animal to generate more income from her livestock business. She learned that BJS (Kiva’s partner) loans to poor women for business purposes, so she plans to buy a goat so that she can sell milk in her neighborhood and earn more profit . She hopes this will upgrade her financial status leading to a decent life. She dreams of purchasing more farmland in the future with her business profit.

Aboda is grateful to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a goat to sell milk.

loans.name: Ajina

texts.en:
Ajina is a 40-year-old woman. She lives with her husband, Aijul, in a small village, Baroghariya, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is blessed with a son who works as a mason in a foreign country. She is illiterate and only knows how to sign her name, as she could not study because of the financial crisis in her family. 

Her husband is a farmer. Ajina's husband has an inconsistent income, so it is very difficult to run the family smoothly. Ajina has been working in animal husbandry for many years. She is a hardworking lady and has the courage to go ahead in life. She keeps faith on her own ability.  

She has a milk cow and sells milk in her neighborhood. In order to expand her business, she wants to purchase a dairy cow, and for that she needs money. So, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will utilize the loan for purchasing another dairy cow, and she hopes to improve her milk supply business. It will provide her a steady income to tide them over rough patches and allow them to save money for their son's future.

She wants to save money to purchase a tractor in the future for her husband’s farmland. 

She is thankful to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Ingrid Milena

texts.es:
Ingrid es el claro ejemplo de una mujer visionaria y con miras de progreso, saca la cara por sus hijos y le pone el pecho a los problemas con valentía y sin doblegarse.
Es madre soltera de dos hijos de 7 y 5 años a los cuales ha tenido que levantar sola ya que hace un tiempo se separo del hombre que era su esposo.
Ella desea ser independiente y generar sus propios ingresos, por eso acude a un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de un computador y una fotocopiadora, de este modo puede montar una sala de internet en zona rural del municipio de Montería, Córdoba.
La idea surge al notar que las personas del sector tienen que realizar grandes recorridos para acceder a los servicios de internet, impresora y fotocopias y en muchas ocasiones no podían acceder al servicio fácilmente.
Es así como ella decide prestarle este servicio a su comunidad y por otro lado generar los recursos suficientes para mantener y sacar adelante a sus dos hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a clear example of a visionary woman with her sights set on progress. She keeps her head high for her children and confronts problems bravely and without compromise. She is a single mother of two children, ages 7 and 5, who she is raising alone as she separated from her spouse some time ago.

She wants to be independent and generate her own income. Therefore she seeks a loan for a computer and photocopy machine so she can open an internet cafe in the rural area of Montería, Córdoba. The idea occurred to her when she noted that many people in this area had to make long journeys to access internet, printing, and copying services and in many occasions they could not easily access these services. So she decided to offer this service to her community and at the same time generate enough income to support and help her small children have a successful upbringing.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a copy machine.

loans.name: Pendeza Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Mwenge est une brave commerçante depuis 5 ans, âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 étudient et 1 encore gosse. La cliente est  membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Pendeza». Elle est vendeuse de la farine de manioc. Elle installe ses marchandises  à son domicile dans un quartier animé de la place. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 2 sacs de farine de manioc.  Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de ses familiers. Son conjoint est un couturier. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de pénurie post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent ses bébés
texts.en:
The borrower, Mwenge, is a courageous woman who has been involved in retail for five years.  She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  Three of her children are in school, the fourth is still very young.  She is a member of the "Pendeza" business association, and she sells cassava flour.  She sets up her merchandise in front of her house, which is located in a lively neighborhood.  

Mwenge is taking a loan from Hekima in order to boost her business.  She will use this loan to buy two bags of cassava flour.  She started her business with some money received from her relatives.  Her husband works as a tailor.  

In the future, Mwenge hopes to be able to feed and educate her children.  She thanks Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the banking system, and for granting them loans at a time when the eastern part of the country faces shortages due to the recent conflicts.  It should be noted that some of the women in the photo are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy two bags of cassava flour.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is a 33 year old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be honest, humble and faithful. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar cane. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a favorable location and his primary customers are reliable. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes. He will use the loan to purchase additional stock of sugar cane. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sugar cane.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more drinks like wine, spirits and beer to sell in the bar. This will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for her children. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to start providing accommodation for her clients. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more drinks like wine, spirits and beer for the bar to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 34 year old widowed man. He describes himself to be disciplined, focused, and determined. He operates a trade business where he buys and sells second-hand clothes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area popular with commuters. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

Daniel will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional inventory. His business goal is to own at least two stalls in a permanent building within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a big enough business to be able to afford to buy his own plot of land. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 38 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Eric has been working hard to manage his juice business where he sells soft drinks. 

To help expand his business, Eric has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fruits for making juice. This will help Eric to generate greater profits and take good care of his family by providing enough basic needs. Eric hopes that in the future, he will be able to construct a very big juice company. 

Eric is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eric who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more fruits to make juice

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a house construction business where he builds houses. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of building materials. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big house. This is his second loan with SMEP Micro finance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood and nails to repair the roof of the house

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is 50 years old and she lives with her son at the frontier village Aygehovit in Tavush region. Now her son is passing his military service at the army. Since Siranush is divorced she now lives alone. She works at the school as a cleaning woman and perfectly runs a farming busines on her small farm. She has 10 chickens and a plot of land, on which she cultivates beans, greens and corn. She also has apple trees, fig, pear and persimmon trees. 

Siranush says that she likes her work on the land and thanks it for the good yield that she gathers and allows her to make an income for her small family.
Siranush says that since her farm is so poor with farm animals she greatly wants to make her farm bigger by the help of this loan. She plans to buy several pigs and fodder for the pigs. She wishes to start swine breeding, which will be more profitable for her family.

loans.use: to buy several pigs and fodder to start swine breeding, which will be more profitable for her family.

loans.name: Onyango

texts.en: Onyango is a married man. He has a child who is 4 years old. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells cooking fat, rice and other food products. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial difficulties. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase additional stock. His business goal is to own a large wholesale business within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Spholah

texts.en:
Hello World! Meet Spholah, a mother of 7 who is practising mixed farming in Ndaragwa, a remote location in Kenya. For the past 30 years, Spholah has been selling milk, eggs and various crop varieties from her farm. Spholah is seeking a loan to purchase a water tank.

Spholah is very passionate about dairy farming! She has 3 cows namely; Kameni, Mweru and Jata. She constantly worries about her animals’ health and welfare. With your loan, she plans to harvest rain-water for her animals’ consumption. The tank will help cut shortages by ensuring a constant supply whenever it is needed. 

Additional income realized as a result of this acquisition will go to satisfying her family's needs and farm-related expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina and her beloved husband live in a nice frontier village Aygehovit in Tavush region. Nina has vocational education and a specialty in nursing. For many years she worked as a nurse at the hospital and at the same time was engaged in farming with her husband. Now her only occupation is farming and agriculture. In her farm she has 2 pigs, 50 chickens and a plot of land with the trees (apple, pear and persimmon) which, together with meat and eggs, they sell at the city’s wholesale market. Nina says that they also have a contract with Ijevan famous Botanical Park and by this contract they raise decorative trees for this park. 

Through these occupations this couple earns their living and they also try to support their children. Nina needs this loan since their cattle barn needs to be repaired and she also wants to sow some forage for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to sow some forage for her farm cattle and to repair her cattle barn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electric household appliance (a refrigerator).

loans.name: Magrate

texts.en:
Hello world, Meet Magrate from a very remote settlement in Kenya known as Siongiroi. The mother of three has been practicing mixed farming and selling milk, eggs and vegetables in the local market. She also holds a job paying a monthly salary and a motorcycle transportation service business. Of all the economic activities she is involved in, she enjoys dairy farming the most. Farming has been engrained in her system slowly and firmly during the 13-year period she has been practicing it. Milking is her hobby. Drought periods present a challenge to Magrate because it is usually hard to find pasture for the animals.

Magrate is seeking a loan form Kiva lenders to purchase a chaff cutter. This tool will help Magrate to chop up fodder into little pieces that are easy to store or mix with silage or feed to the cows. “The grass should be chopped so as to help the cow digest. This will contribute to better health and higher milk output.” 

With your help, Magrate will channel the additional profits to pay for her children’s education and satisfy her family’s needs

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Mama Inuka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Zihalirwa est une commerçante depuis 2 ans et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Mama Inuka», entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants, dont 6 étudient et 1 encore gamin. Elle est vendeuse souliers. Elle étale son business dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 90 paires de souliers. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle scolariser, vêtir et nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflits dans la région de l’Est Pays.Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
The borrower, Zihalirwa, has been involved in retail for two years and she is a member of the "Mama Inuka" business group.  She is a 40-year-old entrepreneur, married, and the mother of seven children.  Six of her children are in school.  The seventh is still very young.  

Zihalirwa sells shoes.  She sets up her merchandise at her town's central market.  She is taking a loan from Hekima to increase her business, and is planning to buy 90 pairs of shoes.  Her husband is also involved in retail.  

In the future, she would like to buy a piece of land and be able to feed, clothe and educate her children.  She thanks Hekima for focusing its support on women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, and for granting them loans without any material collateral (particularly during this post-conflict period in the eastern part of the country).  It should be noted that one of the borrowers in the photo is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy 90 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle to sell, as he wants to expand his purchasing and therefore increase his earnings.

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad,  esta acompañado.


José se dedica a la agricultura y el jornal desde muy pequeño, ya que por la situación económica no pudo terminar sus estudios. Sin embargo trabaja arduamente para sostener a su familia y que no les falte lo necesario para vivir,  cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y lo hace con la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos, dicha actividad la realiza a 5 minutos de su casa.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar  fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz  y realizar unos arreglos al techo de su casa para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old, and he is in a common-law relationship.

José has been making a living by farming and doing day labor since he was little. Due to his financial situation, he was unable to finish school, however he works hard to support his family and to make sure they have the necessities of life. He farms 7,000 square meters of corn, which is five minutes from his house, with the help of his wife and their children.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy fertilizers for the corn crop and to make some repairs to the roof of his house so that his family has better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his corn crop and to do some repairs on the roof of his house so that his family has better living conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grafted cacao trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grafted cacao seedlings.

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en: Sylvestre is a newly established Maya Mountain Cacao farmer. He lives in Indian Ville, Punta Gorda Town, in the Toledo District. Sylvestre currently owns a cacao farm situated in San Miguel Village. He is excited with his plan of purchasing cacao tree seedlings and further expanding his one acre cacao patch. He currently owns two hundred mature cacao trees. Therefore, for him to continue his farm expansion he requires a seedlings loan through the help of Kiva and Maya Mountain Cacao.

loans.use: to purchase grafted cacao seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grafted cacao trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase grafted seedlings

loans.name: Denis Alfonso

texts.es: Denis de 35 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con a su grupo familiar, el posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de hermosos y finos muebles. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su dedicación ha logrado mantenerlo en marcha. Muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus muebles. Últimamente los clientes han aumentado y cada día la demanda es mayor. Su sueño es poder ver florecer su negocio y sabe que para eso tiene que invertir un poco más en la producción de tal forma que logre cubrir toda la demanda. Para esto ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Denis, age 35, lives in his own home with his family. He has a carpentry workshop where he makes and sells a variety of beautiful, fine furniture. He has worked in this business for many years, and thanks to God and his dedication, he has managed to keep it going. Many people prefer him since he offers quality and good prices on his furniture. Lately his clientele has increased and every day the demand is greater. His dream is to see his business flourish, and he knows that for this he has to invest a little more in production so that he can meet the demand. This is why he has made the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business through the purchase of wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane, and more items to attract more customers so he can achieve his goal of improving the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane, and other items.

loans.name: Sebabi

texts.en:
Sebabi is 44 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Sebabi has been working hard to manage his retail business, which sells building sand. 

To help expand his business, Sebabi has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sand that is used for constructing houses. The loan will help Sebabi to generate greater profits and pay school tuition for his children. Sebabi hopes that in the future he will be able to build more rental houses. 

Sebabi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sebabi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more sand that is used for constructing houses.

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en:
Mkhitar successfully paid back his first Kiva loan which he untilized for the purchase of a lot of potato seedlings, in order to start producing potatoes on his farm. He is greatly thankful and hopes for furtherdeal with Kiva and its field partner Nor Horizon. 

Mkhitar lives with his large family in the village of Zovaber in Gegharkunik region. He is doing well in his agricultural occupation and potato cultivation brings a perfect income. His farming is also profitable, thanks to his farm animals such as cows, sheep, lambs and chickens. He manages to sell milk, meat and eggs to his already loyal customers. 

Mkhitar is sure that his second deal with Kiva will also be of great use for his farm, since he wants to enlarge his potato cultivation and he again wants to buy potato seedlings and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and also fodder for his farm cattle in order to enlarge his potato cultivation.

loans.name: Bena
