texts.en: Bena lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and 3 go to school. She takes take of two additional family members. She sells green banana and charcoal at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fess and rent.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia es una mujer emprendedora, con grandes convicciones y visión siempre al futuro; buscando siempre las oportunidades que la vida le ofrece y sacándoles el máximo provecho.
Es madre de dos hijos de 13 y 9 años y quiere asegurarles un futuro estable y duradero, por eso desea iniciar un negocio de venta de helados y comidas rápidas. El problema es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para montarlo y es por eso que acude a un préstamo para poder hacer realidad su sueño.
Ella invertirá el dinero en la compra de una nevera, sillas, mesas, surtido de helados y compra de insumos e ingredientes para las comidas rápidas.
El préstamo le permitirá tener la ilusión de tener un negocio propio y unos ingresos estables.
texts.en:
Nidia is an enterprising woman, with great convictions and always looking to the future; always looking for opportunities that life offers and making the most of them.

She is the mother of two children of 13 and 9 years old, and she wants to ensure a stable and lasting future for them. That is why she wants to start a business selling ice creams and fast food. The problem is that she does not have sufficient capital to start it up, and this is the reason she is requesting a loan to be able to make her dream come true.

She will invest the money in buying a fridge, chairs, tables, assorted ice creams and purchasing materials for the fast food.

The loan will enable her to have the hope her own business and a stable income.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, chairs, tables, assorted ice creams and purchase ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a 36-year-old lady. She lives with her husband and two sons in Dhupguri of Jalpaiguri district. Both of her sons go to school, and are studying in grade 10. Her husband, Mantosh, is 38 years old and works in a gold shop.

Jayanti is engaged in a business of supplying cow’s milk to her neighbors. She started her business five years back. She is a diligent, enthusiastic lady. She has one cow in her herd. Now she wants to purchase one more cow because the demand for milk is high, and she is unable to supply the growing demand of her customers.

She has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow and fodder.  She hopes this business will help her to support her children's education. She says this loan can help her to increase her income and give financial support to her family.

Jayanti is very glad after getting this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is an energetic lady of 45 years. She resides in a small village, Purba Magurmari, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, with her husband, Goutam, and two children (one son and one daughter). They are very much concerned with the education of their children, who are students of grade nine and six.

Pratima’s husband is engaged in the mushroom business. He grows mushrooms on his farmland and sells them in the local market. As an additional source of income, Pratima sells milk in her neighborhood. Nowadays, the demand for milk is increasing in her locality. 

With the goal of further developing her business and satisfying the demand of her customers, she has turned to BJS (Kiva’s partner) for a loan to purchase a cow and to sell more milk to her customers. She plans to invest the profits from her business into further development of her business and to give a good education to her children. 

She is happy after getting the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel de 31 años de edad,  no estudio mucho hasta 3º grado,esta soltero actualmente vive con su madre en casa familiar y un primo, nadie depende de él solo le ayuda a su madre.

Noel se dedica a la albañilería,su padre desde pequeño le enseño varios trabajos para que se ganara la vida, de jornalero y albañil de ese modo todo el tiempo siempre tiene trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, para comprar arena, cemento, pago de mano de obra,  para arreglar el piso de su casa y repellar las paredes; ya que por pocos ha ido construyendo su casa y con el préstamo terminara de esa forma viviran en mejores condiciones él  y su madre ya que planea casarse y tener una familia.

El sueño de Noel es terminar por completo su casa y tenerla lista para cuando decida casarse y tener una familia y quiere seguir trabajando con credicampo.
texts.en:
Noel is 31 years of age; he did not study a lot past the 3rd grade; he is single and right now he lives with his mother and cousin in the family home; no one depends on him, but he helps his mother.

Noel works as a bricklayer; from a young age his father showed him different jobs in order to earn a living, from being a day laborer to a brick layer; because of this, he always has work.

The loan he is asking for from Credicampo is to buy sand, cement, and to be able to pay for day laborers in order to fix the floor of his home and to plaster the walls. Little by little, he has been constructing his house, and with the loan he will finish. In this way, he and his mother will live in better conditions; he plans to marry and to have a family.

Noel's dream is to completely finish the home and to have it ready for when he decides to get married and to have a family; he wants to continue working with Credicampo.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and pay for labor costs in order to fix the floor of his home and to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy catalog products in order to increase and sell her inventory

loans.name: Krowor Ladies Group

texts.en:
The five members of the Krowor ladies group have different businesses and live in Accra-Teshie. They sell slippers, rice, charcoal, chicken, bags, cosmetics and dresses.

Roberta is a single mother with three children. She is 46 years old. She sells chicken meat through hawking and from her house. Two years ago she began her business with the sale of chicken. She tells us that, at the request of people in her neighborhood, she was encouraged to sell chicken for people to use in preparing their food. This helps her to cover the expenses of her family in terms of healthcare, education, and food. Through her business, she has been able to take good care of her family very successfully.

Roberta is considered to be an enterprising and dynamic woman. She is happy with her business because her customers are from her neighborhood and the nearby neighborhoods. In the future, Roberta wants to have more merchandise and be able to update her stocks to serve more customers. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicken meat to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
Jairo, de 41 años es un hombre de coraje y muy responsable con su familia.
Tiene gran experiencia en el área agrícola ya que ha vivido la mayor parte de su vida en el campo.
El sueña con tener un gran cultivo de plátano y otros productos y día a día trabaja para alcanzar este objetivo.
Actualmente tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual tiene sembradas algunas plantas de plátano y yuca, alimentos que cosecha y posteriormente vende en los pueblos cercanos.
El pide un préstamo para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes y riegos, elementos que le permitirán tener unos cultivos sanos y de muy buena calidad.
texts.en:
Jairo, 41, is a brave man and very responsible with his family. He has a lot of experience in farming, since he has lived most of his life out in the country. He dreams of having a large crop of bananas and other items and each day he works to reach this goal.

Now, he has a small plot of land where he has planted some banana and yucca plants, food that he harvests and then sells in towns nearby.

He is requesting the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and irrigation components that will allow them to have some healthy and good quality crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Nicolas

texts.es: Pedro de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, desde hace varios años se dedica a la pesca artesanal y es así como ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, cuenta con varias lachas y algunas redes para pescar, Pedro es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable con su familia y es por esa razón que ha decido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar trasmayos para continuar con su pesca ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Pedro is 37 years old, he lives in his own home with his family. For several years he has worked in non-industrial fishing and this is how he has managed to get his family through. He uses various boats and some nets to fish.

Pedro is a very hardworking man and responsible with his family. For this reason, he has decided to request a loan from Integral to be able to buy trammel nets to continue his fishing, as this is his only source of work and income, and thus he will be able to give his family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy trammel nets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood, flour, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Meet Magdaline, a mother of four who practices mixed farming in Nandi Hills, Kenya. She has been in this business for 15 years. She makes a living farming and selling her produce into the local market. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

She spends most of her time grazing her cows. Her biggest challenge is brought about by drought- a lack of green pastures for feeding her animals. 

Farm inputs are increasingly becoming expensive by the day. Farmers who seek cheaper sources end up buying ‘fake’ seeds that either do not germinate or do not produce. 

Magdaline is seeking a loan to purchase seeds. 

With your loan, Magdaline will be able to afford seed for planting from recommended sources to ensure her crops grow healthy and productive.

Profits made from this harvest will be reinvested into business for growth and expansion. She is seeking to improve the livelihood of her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase seeds

loans.name: Selevesta

texts.en:
Selevesta used the previous loan to buy cows for slaughtering during the Christmas season.  He operates a butchery as his main business, and also takes contracts building houses, which has earned him some extra income. 

He has managed to progress despite facing the challenges of customers who delay in paying him and quarantines on all animals because of diseases, leading to low profits. He maintains his vision of buying land. 

Selevesta has asked for a loan to buy a cow and goats for slaughtering.

loans.use: to buy a cow and goats for slaughtering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.es:
Christopher es un joven emprendedor, tiene 32 años de edad y vive en el Distrito de Calleria junto a su familia.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como Coordinador de Operaciones en una reconocida empresa de la Ciudad donde reside, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora y porque lucha constantemente para brindar un futuro mejor a su familia.
Christopher está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con la ayuda que le han brindado él podrá comprar mercadería para abrir un negocio en su domicilio y así pueda obtener más ingresos y formar más adelante una empresa.
texts.en:
Christopher is an entrepreneurial young man. He is 32 years old and lives in the district of Calleria with his family. 

He has worked for several years as an Operations Coordinator for a renowned company in his hometown. He does well because he is a very responsible and hardworking person, and because he works hard to provide a better future to his family.

Christopher is very thankful with the Kiva lenders because with their help he will be able to buy merchandise to open a store in his home, which will allow him to have a higher income and later have his own company.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Bathesheba

texts.en:
Bathesheba is a married woman. She has two children with, ages 4 and 6. She describes herself to be determined and hardworking. 

She operates a retail business where she sells maize and beans; she has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are individuals, schools, and hospitals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial difficulties. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock. 

Her business goal is to be the largest supplier of cereals within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. 

She will use the anticipated profits to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her cereal business.

loans.name: José Vicente

texts.es:
José de 59 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a una escuela, por la distancia que le tocaba recorrer, ya que era de unos 5 km, y tenía que perder todo el día para asistir a ella, por la necesidad que tenía su padre que la ayudara en los trabajos no lo dejo que fuese. Se casó a la edad de los veinte y cinco  años, a procreo 4  hijos con su pareja, su esposa es ama de casa, ella es la que se encarga de las labores del hogar, de los hijos que tiene solo tres viven con ellos y los otro ya están aparte. 


Él es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, también tiene 3,500 metros cuadrados de sandillera, la actividad la realiza desde los 10 años, su padre desde pequeño lo indujo por el buen camino, siendo responsable. La parcela donde trabaja le queda cerca de la casa, por lo que el recorrido lo hace a pie, a pesar de su edad, su buen estado de salud es el que más bien tiene.  Cuando saca la cosecha una parte la vende y lo demás para el consumo, nadie más se involucra en la actividad, el trabajo lo hace por la mañana de 6:00 am a 12:00 md.


El préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos para la siembra de los granos, específicamente comprara semilla de maíz y sandia, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas y pago de mano de obra. La mejora del préstamo será el poder tener ya todo preparado para la siembra del cultivo del maíz, la necesidad satisfecha es el poder tener un capital de trabajo con el que empezará a trabajar.

El seguir primero Dios trabajando la tierra, ya que con esto mantiene sano su cuerpo y mente, y tiene el ingreso seguro para su familia, el préstamo le ayudara a poder comprar tolo lo que necesitara para la siembra del cultivo, al sacar  la cosecha de sandilla la vende en su totalidad y el maíz una parte la vende y lo demás para consumo, las ganancias serán invertidos en el pago de la cuota de préstamo y en los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
José, 59, did not have the opportunity to go to school because of the distance he had to cover, since it was 5 kilometers away and he had to spend the whole day to attend. Because his father needed him to help with the work, he did not let José go to school. José married at age 25, and had four children with his partner. His wife is a housewife, and she is in charge of the chores of the home. Of the children that he has, only three live with them and the other one already lives away from home. 

He is a farmer. He makes a living sowing corn and beans. He also has a 3,500 square meter watermelon patch. He has been doing this work since he was 10. His father has led him in the right direction since childhood, being a responsible man. The parcel of land where José works is close to his house, which is why he walks to it in spite of his age. The good state of his health is the best thing he has. When he harvests the crops, he sells one part and the rest is consumed. No one else is involved in this work, which he does in the mornings from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies for the sowing of the grains. Specifically, he will buy corn and watermelon seeds, compost, herbicide, pesticide and will pay for labor. The improvement that will result from the loan is that he will now have everything prepared for the sowing of the corn crops. The need that is being met is that of access to working capital, with which he can start doing work. 

He follows God first by working the land, since with this he keeps his body and mind healthy and has a secure income for his family. The loan will help him to be able to buy everything he will need to sow the crops. Upon harvesting the watermelon, he sells all of it, and he sells part of the corn, leaving the rest to be consumed. The profits made will be invested in the payment of his loan and home expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn and watermelon seeds, compost, herbicide, pesticide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Farid D'badu Katherine

texts.es:
Farid esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de estudio ya que actualmente cursa la carrera de computación e informática, lo que le permitirá, estudiar con los materiales necesarios y desempeñarse mejor como estudiante.

Farid trabaja en un restaurante de su ciudad, lo cual le permite solventar sus gastos de estudio y poder luchar para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar sus estudios y   poder obtener un mejor empleo”.
texts.en:
Farid is grateful for the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they are offering her, she will be able to purchase study materials.  She is currently enrolled in an information technology program.  The loan will allow her to study with the materials she needs and perform better as a student. 

Farid works in a restaurant in the city.  Her work allows her to meet her education expenses and work toward making her greatest dream a reality: "To finish her studies and get a better job."

loans.use: to purchase study materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and iron to build a wall in her dwelling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for getting a professional degree

loans.name: John Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy un experimentado ganadero el cual se ha empleado toda su vida en granjas aprendiendo y perfeccionando sus habilidades como ganadero y más de 10 años de experiencia le dan el aval para pensar en su propio negocio pensar en obtener ganancias extras para mejorar  las condiciones de su familia, quiere darle mayor comodidades a su esposa, gusto a sus tres hijos un buen estudio y muchas cosas que todo padre quisiera para su hijo y familia.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de ganado con los que iniciara su negocio, su vida, su sueño de poder tener una finca llena de ganado y ver correr y divertirse a sus hijos sanamente rodeado del aire fresco y las buenas costumbres del campo.
texts.en:
Fredy is an experienced farmer. He has worked all his life on farms, learning and perfecting his skills raising cattle. With more than 10 years experience, he has the backing to think about his own business, to think about making extra income to be able to improve his family's conditions, he wants to give greater comforts to his wife, he'd like to see his three children studying well, and many things that all fathers want to give their children and families. 

He is asking for a loan to buy the cattle that will start his business, his life, his dream of having a farm full of cattle and to see his children running around, having fun, growing up healthily in the fresh air and good customs of the countryside

loans.use: buy cattle to start his own business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Felix tiene 66 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y y su hija de 16 años de edad. Felix  es muy trabajador y visionario. Para él lo más importante es su familia y hace todo lo que este en sus manos para darles mejores condiciones de vida. Felix desea reparar el techo del corredor de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. De esta forma desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Felix is 66-years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their 16-year old daughter.  Felix is very hard-working and a visionary.  For him, family is the most important, and he does everything he can to give them a better standard of living.  Felix wants to repair the roof of his home's hallway, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  He will invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails.  With this repair, he hopes to improve his standard of living and that of his family as well.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to repair his home's hallway.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and five of them go to school. She has no additional members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. She has requested for a loan of 2,200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build permanent business premises and rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate is 33 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Cate has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, where she does tailoring.

To help expand her business, Cate has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials for her tailoring business, and will help Cate to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standard of living. Cate hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a training school.

Cate is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Cate who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick used the previous loan to repair his motorcycle. His main business is motorcycle transportation, alongside selling fresh foods. He started these businesses with a vision of supporting himself and boosting his income. He is facing challenges of bad weather and poor roads, leading to constant mechanical issues. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new market areas. Patrick is in need of a loan to service his motorcycle.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, one of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Grace has been working hard to manage her beauty salon where she does hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more relaxers for the salon to attract more clients. It will help Grace to generate greater profits and buy basic needs for her family. Grace hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business into a vocational school. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hair relaxers

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past eight years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, where she does hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair relaxers for her beauty salon and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and take good care of her child. Fatuma hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the beauty salon into a bigger parlor. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fatuma who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more hair relaxers for her  beauty salon

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
"Sarah is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy dryers and other  items for the beauty salon so as to attract more clients, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standard of living. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business and add a men's salon then she will call it a unisex salon. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.


"

loans.use: to buy dryers and other items for the beauty salon so as to attract more clients,

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a food stall where she makes food. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell. Her business goal is to have a big hotel that will attract many customers within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business and will be able to sustain her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 35 years old, married and the mother of four children who are aged between three to 13 years. She has been in food crop farming for the last five years with a monthly income of KES 6,000 which she uses to support her family. Her husband does support the family with additional income.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides to boost the farm yields.

She hopes to grow her business and in the future to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Cindy Lisbet

texts.es:
Cindy es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Sunampe junto esposo y su hijo.
Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como ayudante de cocina y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable y siempre pone empeño en todo lo que hace. Su mayor motivación es su hijo por quien día a día lucha para brindarle un futuro mejor.
Cindy está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un juego de dormitorio para su hijo para que pueda sentir mayor comodidad dentro de su hogar.
texts.en:
Cindy is a very hardworking person, she is 22 years old, and lives in Sunampe with her husband and son. 

She has been working as a kitchen assistant for over a year and is doing very well because she is a very responsible person and always puts effort into all that she does. 

Her biggest motivation is her son, for whom she struggles daily to provide a better future. 

Cindy thanks Kiva lenders for with their support she can buy a bedroom furniture set for her child so that they can feel more comfortable at home.

loans.use: to buy a bedroom furniture set

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal and other items she sells

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Mujeres Luchadoras está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, Cuenca está ubicada al sur del Ecuador, a una altura de 2500 msn, es la capital cultural y deportiva del país, además es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad declarada por la UNESCO, es considerada por los ecuatorianos como su ciudad más bella. Todas las socias son mujeres amables, gentiles y luchadoras que trabajan para mejorar la situación económica de sus hogares. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Delfa, tiene 44 años de edad, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 22, 16 y 12 años de edad, su primer hijo vive independiente y dos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Delfa desde muy joven se dedica al comercio, en los días de feria vende una gran variedad de ropa, el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a sus hijos y familia. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa para tener más variedad. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The loan group "Mujeres Luchadoras" (Hardworking Women) is composed of eight women who live in Cuenca. Cuenca is located in the southern part of Ecuador, at an altitude of 2500 meters. Cuenca is the cultural and sporting capital of the country and is also a UNESCO world heritage site. Ecuadorians consider Cuenca to be their most beautiful city. 
All of the partners in this group are kind, polite and hard-working women who work to improve their family's economic circumstances. One of the members of this group is Delfa. She is 44 years old and is a widow with three children who are 22, 16 and 12 years old. Her oldest son lives independently and two of them are studying in a local school. Delfa does not own her own home so she is renting. 
Since she was very young, Delfa has been a saleswoman. On market days she sells a large variety of clothing items; the rest of the time she dedicates to her children and the rest of her family.
She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of clothing in order to obtain a greater variety. Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.
